story:
The DINNER TABLE EPICS ARE A SUCCESS!

If you made a contribution to our campaign, expect an e-mail in the next few days with details on how and when your art packs will be delivered!  In the meantime if you have questions, please contact Heavy Cat Studios at creativity at heavycatweb dot net

Introducing the DINNER TABLE EPICS!

Making a game?  Interactive demo?  App?  Web site?  Are you in need of low-cost fantasy adventure creatives?  Illustrations, animations, title screens, game art, maps, monsters and buildings?   Congratulations, your quest is a success!

  • Pixel Art for Pennies?

  • Illustrations for $1 each?

  • Tiles, Isometric Animations and even Trading Cards?

 

Who Are We?

Heavy Cat Studios (HCS) is an animation house based in Southern California near Hollywood.  We offer creative services to game developers, producers, webmasters, directors, publishers and authors.  We have a team of 44 creative professionals with a variety of specialized talents in illustration, voice acting, sound engineering, interactive design and script doctoring.

Palace in the Sky Productions LLC (SKYPRO) is our distribution division.

We have produced art, voices, animation and pixel graphics for commercial games (Flash, Apps and Steam), comics, audiocasts, ebooks (Kindle), mobile apps (iPad and Android), video productions, soundtracks, music, book covers, illustrations and officially licensed merchandise.  We've been in business since 2007 and our parent company has been in business since 1996.

Heavy Cat Studios is capable of producing up to 700 production quality color illustrations a week.

 

What Are We Offering?

Our studio is now prepared to make available to you for the first time, specialized packages of high-quality commerically-licensed production creatives for your independent projects.

 

 

Ten Thousand New Illustrations

  • animations
  • pixel frames
  • GUI elements
  • character sheets
  • maps
  • isometric tiles
  • outfits
  • game engines
  • sound loops
  • voice effects
  • book covers
  • adoptible pets
  • trading card graphics
  • logos
  • title screens
  • buttons
  • textures
  • tiles
  • backgrounds
  • environments
  • buildings
  • creatures
  • weapons
  • music tracks
  • music stings
  • map construction kits
  • Dragons. Lots of dragons.

 

 

Do you or your company make any of these?

  • Video Games
  • Game Apps
  • Flash Games
  • Board Games
  • Pen and Paper Role-Playing Games
  • Card Games
  • Adoptable Pet Games
  • Browser Games
  • PC Games
  • Cafepress Stores
  • Zazzle Stores
  • Pinterest Blogs
  • Fiverr Products
  • Ebay Stores
  • Wordpress Blogs
  • Blogger Blogs
  • YouTube Channels
  • Twitter Pages
  • Facebook Pages
  • Ebooks
  • Animation
  • Video Productions
  • Podcasts
  • Dramatic Audiocasts
  • Audiobooks
  • iTunes Products
  • iOS Apps
  • Android Apps
  • Kindle Apps


If so, you may very well find something you can use among the Dinner Table Epics Series.

 

The Dinner Table Epics are Just The Beginning!

Science Fiction, Steampunk, Modern Urban, Zombies, Horror, Pirates, Imperial Chinese Era Warfare, Robots, Post-Apocalyptic, Cute Pet Worlds.  It's all coming soon, and you will have a chance to choose from any theme you like!

What do you mean by $1000 worth of graphics for $20?

Pro quality custom graphics take many many hours to produce.  128x128 pixel art tiles can take a couple hours each to assemble pixel-by-pixel.  Our studio list rate for such tiles is $9 each.  If we sold 100 of them on rush delivery with commercial rights, it could very well add up to $1000 to do custom tiles.  But we're making exactly the same graphics at the same or better quality available in our shop for $20 during our campaign.

Here's how it works.

We are going to use the funds we raise to produce packages of creatives (what we'll call "packs") consisting of sets of graphics, audio effects, Flash/HTML5/PHP source, animations, music tracks, sets of pixel art tiles, etc. 

Each pack will be designed to fit a particular need.  For example, if you are creating a fantasy adventure game with pixel art graphics, you may find a pack of pixel art tiles including terrains, animated monsters, animated player characters, buildings, trees, fences, lava craters, etc.  When you buy that pack, you will be able to drop those graphics right into your game and start playtesting.

Each pack will be licensed by SKYPRO on a non-exclusive no-royalty no-compete commercial basis.  SKYPRO will retain copyright, trademark rights and ownership of the graphics and other materials in each pack.

  • Commercial means you will have the right to use the graphics in any kind of project:  commercial, non-commercial, academic, whatever.  You can also resize, modify, composite, munge, puree and stir them too.  
  • No-compete means you can't re-sell or sublicense the packs themselves to a third party.
  • Non-exclusive means multiple developers will be able to use the same packs.
  • No-royalty means even if you make money on your project, you will not be required to pay any percentage of your earnings to SKYPRO.


The trade-off here is pretty simple.  You will get professional-quality graphics at a ridiculously low price.  In exchange, we give you non-exclusive rights to the graphics themselves, as other developers may be using them in their own projects too.

We plan to produce hundreds of graphics packs on an ongoing basis, so there will always be something new, and therefore you will always have a wide selection to choose from.

 

 

Dinner Table Epics Graphics Store

Once our packs are released, we will be opening a new store where creative professionals will be able to find and buy packs in the future under the exact same terms and for the same ridiculously low prices.

In the store, our basic pricing formula is to offer packs that would normally be $1000 worth of custom art services for $50 each.

For color illustration work (characters, environments, title screens, book covers, etc.) you will get two full pages (eight million square pixels) of illustrations, up to 70 individual designs, for $50.

For pixel art, you will get 200 32x32 frames/sprites/tiles or 100 128x128 frames/sprites/tiles for $50.  Pennies for a sprite?  Yep.

The Store Will Help All Independent Creative Professionals

By making a contribution, you are helping to create a great resource for all kinds of independent authors, developers and producers.

Heavy Cat Studios will use all contributed funds to produce more materials, more art and more cool stuff for you to use.  We're always coming up with something new!  And you will have access to it all for a tiny fraction of what it would cost to commission each illustration as a custom work.

However, it gets even better! 

During our IndieGoGo campaign, if you help us start our project off by making a contribution for a pack, you will get an additional 60% off, making your packs only $20 each.  That's 98% off our list rates.  Three professionally illustrated game characters for a dollar?  Yep.

 

 

The DINNER TABLE EPICS Introductory Catalog

These packs come in the following configurations (one per pack):

  • Top-Down 128x128 Pixel Art Sprites
  • Top-Down 32x32 Pixel Art Sprites
  • Isometric 128x128 Pixel Art Sprites
  • Isometric 32x32 Pixel Art Sprites
  • Top-Down 128x128 Illustrated Sprites
  • Top-Down 32x32 Illustrated Sprites
  • Isometric 128x128 Illustrated Sprites
  • Isometric 32x32 Illustrated Sprites
  • 750x1050 Trading Card Illustrations (300 dpi)

 


Pack #1 "The Dungeon Club" Six Four-Direction Animated Characters (Walk and Attack): DumDum and his Clubclub, Gloria Dawnhalo, Sticky McSticker of the Stickies, Snitch the Witch, Nancy Swiftarrow the Frumpy (Don't laugh, she's a Ranger), Johnny Threechord and his Lovely Lute

Pack #2 "We Need Dragons. Lots of Dragons." Six Four-Direction Animated Dragons (Walk and Attack)


Pack #3 "Dumb as a Post" Six Four-Direction Animated Barbarian Monsters (Walk and Attack)

Pack #4 "Ham Bone Connected to Da..." Six Four-Direction Animated Skeleton Monsters (Walk and Attack)



Pack #5 "Pointies!" 100 Weapons:  Swords, Maces, Daggers, Staves, Shields, Bucklers, Bows, Crossbows, Spears, Flails

 



Pack #6 "Tin Can Alley" 100 Armor Pieces:  Helmets, Boots, Tunics, Mail, Plate, Splint, Leather, Capes, Leggings, Cinches, Gloves, Bracers



Pack #7 "Dungeon Elegance" 100 Basic Objects:  Chests, Tables, Chairs, Debris, Doors, Floors, Pillars, Gates, Fences, Walls, Ceilings, Tunnels

Pack #8 "It Makes a Village" 100 Static NPCs: Blacksmiths, Guards, Merchants, Stable Hands, Shady Types, Cobblers, Armorers, Weaponsmiths, Beggars



Pack #9 "Let There Be Flight" Six Animated Avian Creatures:  Eagle, Bat, Hawk, Mini-Dragon, Pegasus, Hover-Skull  (Fly, Attack)

Pack #10 "Who Could Ask For More?" Six Animated Undead Creatures:  Skeleton, Zombie, Mummy, Specter, Vampire, Ghoul

 


Pack #11 "Uh, Do You Guys Make Like, Tiles?" 100 Outdoor Terrain Tiles:  Grass, Desert, Snow, Forest, Jungle, Lava, Badlands, Town, Road, Stone Path


Pack #12 "Little Twisted Evil Bastards" Six Animated Evil Bastards: Ankle Chewer Vine, Rabid Gibberer, Rolling Skull, Furball of Blood, Death Shoe, Clump of Grabby Hands

Pack #13 "Knights of the Holier Table" Six Animated Paladin Characters: Sir Gleaming Teeth, The Beard, Gladhand of the Gloves, Sir Prancealot, Sir Virtuous Lighthaven of the Loquacious Goldencurls, Clark


Pack #14 "Irresistably Adorable Adorables" Six Animated Pets: Pink Sphere of Fuzzy, Chirpy, Mr. Turtle, Enchanted Chartreuse Pony, Bitties the Kitty, A Dog Named Ralph

Pack #15 "Uh, Do You Guys Make Like, Other Tiles?" 100 Indoor Terrain Tiles:  Stone Floor, Wood Floor, Dirt Floor, Wet Stone, Metal Floor, Dusty Floor, Waxed Floor, Marble Floor

 

Double-Pack 16 "Big Building Right Hand, Small Building Left Hand" Six Large Buildings 25 Small Buildings: Forest House, Village House, Hermit Shack, Haunted Manor, Merchant Shop, Guard Tower, Marketplace, Trade Shop, Stable, Motte and Bailey, Shrine, Fibblebibble and Tragicmagic's Sundae Bar

Pack #17 "And Now Our Feature Terrain Presentation" 100 Naturally Occurring Terrain Features:  Rocks, Trees, Bushes, Shrubberies, Flowers, Grass, Puddles, Ponds, Debris, Fossils, Fungus, Swamps



Pack #18 "Beware the Land-Mark" 100 Landmark Terrain Features:  Fence Sections, Fountains, Wells, Lampposts, Gates, Signs, Benches, Abandoned Carts, Farm Equipment, Troughs, Hitching Posts

Pack #19 "Youuuu Shall Nooooot Caaaaaaast!" Six Animated Spellcasters:  Sparkbeard the Arcane Arsonist, Fibblebibble and His Magnificent Canivorous Hat, Wendell Tragicmagic, Maude of the Inappropriate Gesture, Chumpy the Foodbringer, Dave the Hermit

Pack #20 "Six Pounds of Tropes in a Five Pound Room" 100 Static Wizard Lair Furnishings:  Tables, Chairs, Bookcases, Desks, Alchemy Labs, Cauldrons, Spellbooks, Crystal Ball, Maps, Armchair, Couch, Rodent Cage, Skull, Treasure Chest

story:
WHO WE ARE

The Forge is home to a large group of artists from all backgrounds and mediums: cinematographers, photographers, producers, directors, musicians, illustrators, dancers, inventors, writers, performers, editors, designers, and more. 

We are surrounded by friends and artists who need space like ours on a regular basis. Our studios and lofts are available for rent as a means to supplement building and operation costs. Whether it be for photo or video shoots, meetings or workshops, our space is in demand every day. Any income that the studio makes goes directly back into studio costs and improvements. 

We create to live and live to create. We are trying to strengthen, build, and expand our team and community, and the Forge is our clubhouse. 

WHAT WE NEED

It is time to take the Forge to the next level. Our colleagues, friends and associates want the same thing we do: a place to produce work. The better our amenities are, the more efficiently we operate and freely we produce. With your help, we will acquire the necessary means to function as a multi-media production house - concrete and virtual, where creatives make, study, share, experiment, network, and evolve.

Our ability to function and facilitate quality productions in-house are limited by a lack of basic resources a studio should have: professional light and sound gear, proper storage to organize our set walls, props and costumes; we need a PA system so we can host more performances and art events; sound control so we can record audio for video shoots and recording sessions; and an interactive website that can host all of the content produced at the Forge. 

Here's a detailed breakdown of what we need:

$30,000 studio build out: sliding partition, mixing room, office, prop room, storage, deck, lighting grid, doors, windows, sound proofing, carpet, insulation/padding, bass traps, curtains, hardwood flooring, trim, lumber, hardware, stall dividers, mirrors, bathroom vent, towel dispensers, bins, makeup station, church pews, awnings, garage door opener, back perimeter fence, back ally gate, trellis, front perimeter fence, side barn doors, front ally gate, service ramp to side walk, security gate for driveway…

$23,000 studio gear: computer, camera, mixer, speakers, monitors, stereo, mics, headphones, cables, plugins, adapters, hot lights, strobes, stands, rollers, sand, dolly, jib…

$7,000 new website: design, development, programming and up-keep. 

Donations that come to us through paypal actually transfer immediately. This allows us to actively work and progress as we are raising funds. Contributors will see the fruits of their generosity as we document our progress each step of the way.

WHAT YOU GET 

From your donations, a community of artists will thrive. Countless hours will be recorded, thousands of photos and videos will be created, sets will be built, and many visions will be brought to fruition. We will also be putting out monthly performances, weekly productions, and daily projects. In exchange for your donations, aside from greatly impacting the evolution of a community of artists, contributors will be receiving studio time and art. Contributing to our campaign is a way to support art in a very direct way, by allowing artists to assemble in a functional space where new works can be conceived and produced on a daily basis.

The studio is on its way to completion and with your help we will be up and running in 60 days. Be a part of our project and expand WITH us! As our space develops and grows, our entire community develops and grows; and one of the most effective ways to help is by simply spreading the word about the Forge. Comment, connect, link, and share. 

We are also open to other types of donations. Send us your ideas! If you or someone you know would be interested in donating any gear, equipment, materials or studio supplies, please send us an email at info(at)forgela.com.

Thanks for your support! We can't do it without you.

story:
POSIWID: The Purpose of Seattle Is What It Does

By Seattle Rogue CORE

In 2012, Seattle debuted in the Circle Of Regional Effigies (CORE) at Burning Man with Tendrillar Woods. This large-scale, whimsical installation enjoyed tremendous success at our regional burn, Critical, and on the playa. It amused nearly sixty thousand participants; was immortalized in the satellite 2012 Image Of the Year; and went aflame in the largest intentional simultaneous burn in history along with 33 effigies from all over the globe. 

(Tendrillar Woods at Burning Man 2012, with the Man in background - photo by Michael Holden)

 

This year, from the team that designed Tendrillar Woods, we deliver POSIWID: The Purpose of Seattle Is What It Does - a three-tier, interactive construct comprised of a labyrinth abounding with surprise twists, gadgetry and intriguing chiaroscuro projections; a midlevel balcony containing a control panel; and an observation podium offering a panoramic vista. Although regionally selected by public vote, our proposal was not accepted into the CORE, deemed as insufficiently "tied to our region's recognizable structures". Yet, the consensus among our Seattle community remained unchanged: POSIWID is the vision we identify with and resolve to materialize. Regional landmarks do not statically define us - our dynamic collective choices do.

(POSIWID Concept)

 

Thus, undeterred, we proceed as planned - Seattle's whimsically-named Cult of POSIWID is going rogue and forming a Nexus Of Disavowed Effigies (NODE) in alliance with other self-funded regional and individual projects at Burning Man 2013: Cargo Cult. We are also planning to make an appearance and bring some aspects of the structure to the regional burn, Critical Northwest. With your support, and building on last year's success and experience, we can indulge the public with yet another compelling and engaging experience.

Help us achieve this shared vision!

Based on our costs last year and the expected build materials cost and other expenditures this year, we expect that the full cost of this project (not including perk fulfillment) will be about $18,000. This includes:

  • Construction materials, tools and supplies
  • Workshop rental and insurance for May through September
  • Transporting the project to and from CriticalNW and to Burning Man
  • Powering light and sound at both events
  • Materials to safely burn POSIWID at Burning Man.

With all the great art projects competing for limited funds from both BM Org and IgnitionNW, we have not received any major grants from either group this year, but we continue undaunted. Our goal is to raise about half the money through this IndieGoGo campaign and the rest through fundraisers, our silent auction, and any other local grants we can get. The rest of the goal is for fulfilling some excellent perks to show our gratitude to you! Including:

  • Custom-designed, 18 Gage stainless steel laser-cut pendants
  • POSIWID mementos (heck, full maze panels even!)
  • Bask in whiskey, bacon and hugs at our private donor parties on and off playa (tickets to our upcoming events in June also included!)
  • Go playa tubing behind a mutant vehicle with a friend at Burning Man!

(Pendant design)

If we end up short of our Indiegogo target, we will downscale the design and reroute group energy from building to fundraising. We are committed to presenting artwork that will make our community proud in any case. And your donation can ensure that we do not divest!  

The Impact

Nearly 100 people in the Seattle area are already involved in this undertaking – more than double the number from last year. And in the absence of size limitations applicable within regular CORE placement, this rogue effigy expands well beyond a 20 foot diameter. With your help, we can maintain the increased scope of this year's project and further the outreach to engage a broader public in art production. Our recruits are of diverse backgrounds and various levels of prior artistic experience: novices eager to learn a new technique and experts glad to share pearls of wisdom, Ukrainians and Brits, youngsters and grandparents. The momentum is growing to do bigger and better things, and we are determined to keep it up.

With our track record and degree of self-efficacy, we have high confidence in another triumphant presentation on the Playa, and we are looking to expand our horizons thereon. Our ultimate goal (beyond the scope of this campaign) is a radically inclusive, volunteer-driven community arts initiative, where everyone is encouraged to participate and our ranks continue to grow. This would be enabled by a sustainable community art space, and generate more opportunities for artistic immersion and installation art in our hometown. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As the title of this year's art piece suitably underscores, our purpose is what we do. And we are determined to live up to our zeal - one individual action at a time and all together. So if you share in our passion for building and strengthening community through art, and would like to see the Pacific Northwest represented at Black Rock City - contribute to this daring and rewarding DIY endeavor. We need financial contributions, but there are so many other ways to help too!

  • Connect with us on Facebook to get involved, join the conversation and/or follow our progress.
  • Spread the word about this project and share this campaign with your friends and family to help us raise awareness and pride in what we are doing collectively!
  • Stop by our build space to swing a hammer, or help us organize and mail perks before or after Burning Man.
  • Jot us an encouraging note! We can share it with the rest of the team and get everyone stoked. Kind words go a long way!
  • Come explore POSIWID on the playa, and join us at Thursday midnight for the NODE Burn!

Most of all, we want to see you and hear from you, and have you enjoy this project with us beyond any financial contribution! Many thanks from many hearts!

Note: We are an associated program of Shunpike, a 501(c)3 with a mission "to fuel innovation in the arts by building productive partnerships, cultivating leadership and providing direct services to arts groups of all kinds". Interested in tax deductible donations, or have an employer who will match donations to non-profits? Shoot our finance guy Paul an email at paul.gafni@gmail.com.
story_txt:
POSIWID: The Purpose of Seattle Is What It Does
By Seattle Rogue CORE
In 2012, Seattle debuted in the Circle Of Regional Effigies (CORE) at Burning Man with Tendrillar Woods. This large-scale, whimsical installation enjoyed tremendous success at our regional burn, Critical, and on the playa. It amused nearly sixty thousand participants; was immortalized in the satellite 2012 Image Of the Year; and went aflame in the largest intentional simultaneous burn in history along with 33 effigies from all over the globe. 

(Tendrillar Woods at Burning Man 2012, with the Man in background - photo by Michael Holden)
 
This year, from the team that designed Tendrillar Woods, we deliver POSIWID: The Purpose of Seattle Is What It Does - a three-tier, interactive construct comprised of a labyrinth abounding with surprise twists, gadgetry and intriguing chiaroscuro projections; a midlevel balcony containing a control panel; and an observation podium offering a panoramic vista. Although regionally selected by public vote, our proposal was not accepted into the CORE, deemed as insufficiently "tied to our region's recognizable structures". Yet, the consensus among our Seattle community remained unchanged: POSIWID is the vision we identify with and resolve to materialize. Regional landmarks do not statically define us - our dynamic collective choices do.

(POSIWID Concept)
 
Thus, undeterred, we proceed as planned - Seattle's whimsically-named Cult of POSIWID is going rogue and forming a Nexus Of Disavowed Effigies (NODE) in alliance with other self-funded regional and individual projects at Burning Man 2013: Cargo Cult. We are also planning to make an appearance and bring some aspects of the structure to the regional burn, Critical Northwest. With your support, and building on last year's success and experience, we can indulge the public with yet another compelling and engaging experience. 
Help us achieve this shared vision!

Construction materials, tools and supplies
Workshop rental and insurance for May through September

Materials to safely burn POSIWID at Burning Man.

Custom-designed, 18 Gage stainless steel laser-cut pendants
POSIWID mementos (heck, full maze panels even!)

Go playa tubing behind a mutant vehicle with a friend at Burning Man!

(Pendant design)
If we end up short of our Indiegogo target, we will downscale the design and reroute group energy from building to fundraising. We are committed to presenting artwork that will make our community proud in any case. And your donation can ensure that we do not divest!  
The Impact

And in the absence of size limitations applicable within regular CORE placement, this rogue effigy expands well beyond a 20 foot diameter. With your help, we can maintain the increased scope of this year's project and further the outreach to engage a broader public in art production. Our recruits are of diverse backgrounds and various levels of prior artistic experience: novices eager to learn a new technique and experts glad to share pearls of wisdom, Ukrainians and Brits, youngsters and grandparents. The momentum is growing to do bigger and better things, and we are determined to keep it up.
With our track record and degree of self-efficacy, we have high confidence in another triumphant presentation on the Playa, and we are looking to expand our horizons thereon. Our ultimate goal (beyond the scope of this campaign) is a radically inclusive, volunteer-driven community arts initiative, where everyone is encouraged to participate and our ranks continue to grow. This would be enabled by a sustainable community art space, and generate more opportunities for artistic immersion and installation art in our hometown.

As the title of this year's art piece suitably underscores, our purpose is what we do. And we are determined to live up to our zeal - one individual action at a time and all together. So if you share in our passion for building and strengthening community through art, and would like to see the Pacific Northwest represented at Black Rock City - contribute to this daring and rewarding DIY endeavor. We need financial contributions, but there are so many other ways to help too!


Connect with us on Facebook to get involved, join the conversation and/or follow our progress.
Spread the word about this project and share this campaign with your friends and family to help us raise awareness and pride in what we are doing collectively!
Stop by our build space to swing a hammer, or help us organize and mail perks before or after Burning Man.
Jot us an encouraging note! We can share it with the rest of the team and get everyone stoked. Kind words go a long way!
Come explore POSIWID on the playa, and join us at Thursday midnight for the NODE Burn!
Most of all, we want to see you and hear from you, and have you enjoy this project with us beyond any financial contribution! Many thanks from many hearts!
Note: We are an associated program of Shunpike, a 501(c)3 with a mission "to fuel innovation in the arts by building productive partnerships, cultivating leadership and providing direct services to arts groups of all kinds". story:
.PROYECTO DESPERTAR.

Proyecto DESPERTAR (the word "despertar" means to awaken in Spanish) was started by two young women activists from Esmeraldas in January of 2013. It is an arts-based project that intersects social justice, community building, and popular education through the needs and experiences of the city's emerging youth leaders.

The aim of Proyecto DESPERTAR is two-fold: to empower Afroesmeraldeño youth through the exploration of their identities facilitated by a community of elders: musicians, oral historians, poets, painters, folklorists, and other cultural icons embedded in the Afro Ecuadorian community. Afroesmeraldeño elders have described the "dying of identity and culture" in their community as youth become less interested in their “raices” or roots and increasingly involved with organized crime and drug trafficking. This is a direct result of the structural inequalities faced by the Afroesmeraldeño youth.

Our second aim is to instill leadership skills in each of our participants through mentoring programs with elder community leaders who have dedicated their lives to furthering the afro Ecuadorian cause and are eager to pass down their knowledge and wisdom to the next generation of leaders. We are invested in training a core group of youth so that they have all of the tools necessary to become leaders within their own communities and keep the actions of their elders ongoing once they are no longer with us. There is no greater way to impact change than through a bottom-up approach, especially by tapping into the potential that lies within the youth of a community.

 

.THIS SUMMER.

This summer 25 youth leaders will work side-by-side with well-respected artists in the city to create a community mural depicting Esmeraldas' maroon history and cultural traditions that are slowly losing their significance with the passing of time. We are depending on the generosity of people who believe in our cause and the work that needs to be done here in Esmeraldas to make this project a reality.

Our community mural intends to bring visibility to the historical richness that has been excluded from the educational curriculum's textbooks. A history that afro Ecuadorian youth are rarely taught and that has the potential to create a counter narrative to the history that has been misconstrued by those that benefit from our exclusion.

Our community mural will pay homage to the many voices in our community that have fought hard for the ideals of equality and justice in a country that has historically marginalized afro descendents who call this land their own. Finally, we will depict our rich cultural traditions through the eyes of our youth and what these traditions mean to them in the work that they do and how their generation has sought to reinvent them and make them their own.

 

.WHAT WE NEED.

The community assessment and preliminary work for this project have been done. We are now in need of funding to make this project a reality in our community.

$500 to buy a space in the center of the city where the mural would have the most visibility

$50 for wall preparation

$400 for paint (based on cheapest local market price)

$50 for 2 ladders

$30 for 3 long tables

$200 for paint brushes, rollers, buckets, tarps, and other supplies

$175 for the daily transportation of 25 youth leaders x 7 days ($1 round-trip on the public bus)

$21 for transportation of 3 artists x 7 days ($1 round-trip on the public bus)

$250 for 25 art kits for youth leaders

$25 for 25 journals for youth leaders, to be used for daily reflection throughout the experience

$875 budget for daily lunch ($5 a meal) for 25 youth leaders x 7 days

 

Our secured wall space:

story:
WHAT IS ART MARATHON FESTIVAL?
For fifteen years Eastern Edge Gallery has presented an annual summer visual art festival called The Art Marathon in St. John's Newfoundland! In recent years we've expanded from a 24 hour event to a 5 day extravaganza that celebrates all forms of contemporary art from local, national, and international contemporary artists.

Our festival is all about community, sharing amazing artistic work in a variety of ways. You can join in on the nighttime art crawl, take an artist-led workshop, dance the night away to local music, raise your hand or glass at our fancy artist talks or watch artists make art live for 24 hours straight!

Come play a game of chance, get lost in the magic of the unknown!

WHAT'S NEW THIS YEAR
This year artists working with ideas of chance, spectacle, and the uncanny take center stage at this years’ Art Marathon Festival as we explore our new theme Carnival. Suspending disbelief artists act as ringmasters ushering in visions that promise to mesmerize, delight, and captivate minds both young and old. www.artmarathonfestival.com

WHO IS EASTERN EDGE?

Eastern Edge Gallery is a non-profit artist-run centre overlooking the harbour in the heart of St. John's, NL. The gallery was created in 1984 by a movement of Canadian artists who decided to take charge of the way their art was presented. From installation art to performance-based works, Eastern Edge is the place to see something new, experimental and different. We do not sell art rather create art experiences which challenge, provoke, re-imagine and celebrate contemporary visual art today. Eastern Edge is a supportive space to develop skills, share information and resources and fosters meaningful context for artistic activity.

Every year we present 7 main gallery exhibitions/projects, over 40 educational and social events, local artists pushing their practices in the Rogue Gallery and the annual Art Marathon Festival. We also host Destination Library, the only free public library to find art magazines in the city. In 2014 we are turning 30!

WHAT ELSE WILL YOU SEE AT THE ART MARATHON FESTIVAL?
Outdoor Cinema  featuring a curated line up of Canadian video art.
Launch of Artist Publication – We are currently working on a special Members Publication that will be launched at our Festival’s Opening event! Featuring over 30 artists works from across Canada touching on this year’s festival theme, Carnival.
Fancy Artist Talks - 8 different artists present their work while you sip on a cosktail inspired by their art at Eastern Edge Gallery
Daily Community BBQs with invited guest organizations such as Happy City and Visual Artists Newfoundland and Labrador (VANL-CARFAC).
Carnival Art Crawl – featuring 5 visiting and 3 local artist projects across downtown as well as variety of pop up events, artist studios and local galleries
Carnival Art Crawl Headquarters – Location TBA,  where if you’ve visited 5+ artists projects you’ll get in for 1/2 off. Entertainment by local musicians and performers.
Art Workshops led by two of our acclaimed invited artists for the public, no previous art experience necessary!
Children’s events and workshops – kids video dance party and marathon day workshops
The Art Marathon Event – Over 60 artists making art live, with 5 local bands (TBA), and various pop up performances throughout the day.

EXCITED YET? HERE'S HOW YOU CAN HELP
As a not for profit gallery and registered charity, Eastern Edge relies on public support to make its programming happen. We are largely volunteer run with a regular staff of two. Eastern Edge is super unique being the only gallery of our kind in our province and what's more we present the only visual arts festival in the City - The Art Marathon Festival. WOO!

We are looking to raise $5000 to help make this year's festival the best one yet!

Your contribution will go directly to the costs of making this event happen. We pay artists and bands professional fees for the presentation of their work, and bring in the best to lead exciting hands on workshops for the public and many more exciting events.

Many of the festival events are free and open to the public so your contribution helps us keep the AMF accessible and open to all.

During the festival, Eastern Edge Gallery expands out of our space, throughout its building, and into the downtown community of St. John's. To do this we require extra materials like chairs, tables, water, security, and special permits to keep things running safely and smoothly!

We also assist our visiting artists with travel costs and materials for their installations during the nighttime art crawl as well as print a unique Festival Publication, that features Members of Eastern Edge Gallery from across the province and country, that way everyone can take part in the AMF.

COME JOIN US!
The festival will take place August 13th to 17th 2013 at 72 Harbour Drive and surrounding areas. For a full schedule check out www.artmarathonfestival.com

story:
R-Evolution a sponsored project of Flux Foundation, a nonprofit arts organization dedicated to engaging people in designing and building large-scale public art as a catalyst for education.  As such, contributions for the purposes of R-Evolution via Flux Foundation are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

The Woman Stands:  R-Evolution Burning Man 2015

R-Evolution is the final sculpture in The Bliss Project- A 3-part series of monumental sculptures. 

Beginning with Bliss Dance: 

photographer unknown       

 And followed by Truth is Beauty:

photo by Sidney Erthal

We’ve danced, we’ve reached for ourselves and now we can just be…well…who we are….present.


The Bliss Project and R-Evolution

R-Evolution is the third and final sculpture in the series of three monumental sculptures, The Bliss Project, by Marco Cochrane of a woman expressing her humanity.  At 48 feet tall, R-Evolution will debut at Burning Man 2015.  These sculptures are intended to demand a change in perspective… to be catalysts for social change.  They are intended to challenge the viewer to see past the sexual charge that has developed around the female body which has been used for power and control, to the human being.  They are intended to de-objectify women and inspire us all to take action to end violence against women, thus allowing everyone to live fully and thrive.

Another collaboration with Deja Solis, R-Evolution is different than Bliss Dance and Truth is Beauty. There is no overt action in her expression; she is not dancing in the face of danger, she is not reaching to meet herself and find her own truth.  In R-Evolution, Deja explores and expresses what she feels like when she can just be...a whole person... a woman, radiating her energy into the world. 

The completed sculpture will be made of steel rod and tubing, utilizing two layers of geodesic triangles covered by a stainless steel mesh with LED lighting effects.  Want to know more?


What’s Done?

2014 was a busy year at Bliss Dance Studios.  It started with Marco and Deja in the studio:  using a Pantograph – a medieval-era enlargement tool –  and starting from a ¾ life-size original,  a 15-foot clay version of R-Evolution was built from hand using classical sculpting techniques.  The next step was to begin the second phase enlargement to her final metal form. 

Last year we set a goal to complete one-half of R-Evolution so that we could finish her in time for Burning Man 2015.  We are thrilled to say that with the help of hundreds of generous donors and volunteers, we met that goal!!!

Here are some pictures of the clay/moldmaking process and pieces of the interior structure completed last year…


What’s Next?

The Sculpture

Everything else!  Metalwork for the second half of R-Evolution is well underway.  We need to complete the sculpture, paint her for rust protection, design, purchase and install the lighting, place the mesh skin and construct the base. Additional funding is needed to support special surprises for your discovery on the Playa.  To bring her to Burning Man we will need to pay for heavy equipment and trucking. 

Together We Stand

We believe that there should be no incidents of sexual assault at Burning Man. This place should be safe.  Full-stop.  If any place can be, Burning Man can. If anyone can make it happen Burners can.  We would love the legacy of the Bliss Project to be that there were no incidents in 2015 and on in to the future.

To that end, we are also working on expanding our public activation campaign: “Together we Stand.”  We plan to bring more wristbands and to continue to ask those who agree to wear one to take “active responsibility of the safety of their sister’s on the playa.”  In addition we will be working with a number of camps to create safe spaces, all connected by 20 foot tall lighthouses, constructed with steel rods, designating their location.  These lighthouses are intended to both raise public awareness and to provide a safe place for those in need. To build these lighthouses, we need to purchase metal, lighting, solar panels, motors and signs. 


How Can You Help?

There are two ways you can help:

·  First, we are pleased to have been awarded a grant from Burning Man, but this does not cover our remaining costs.  We have launched this Indiegogo page to help us close the gap and have great perks to offer as a show of our appreciation for your support. Please check them out and consider donating! 

·  Second, you can actively participate in the Together we Stand campaign.  If your camp would like to host a lighthouse, or if you have any thoughts on how to further expand on this concept, or you have an idea that you think will align with The Bliss Project, please contact us.  We’d love to hear from you!


My Inspiration

If you didn't already click the link, watch this video about The Bliss Project:


The story of R-Evolution and The Bliss Project began when I was 7-years old and my best friend was a 9-year old little girl.  One day I was told, in way too much detail for a little boy, that she had been raped right outside of my house.  It was incomprehensible, horrible, I never forgot, I never understood...it still haunts me.  I thought...that man couldn't have realized my friend was a person...if he really could see her, this wouldn't have happened.

I grew up in the Bay Area in the 60's and 70's, in the philosophical revolution and turbulence of those times.  I learned to deeply appreciate feminine energy, influence and strength…and realized that the objectification of women imprisoned women and also men.  I also saw first-hand that one person, or a small group of people, can start a movement that can make a difference and change the course of history.

In my 20s I discovered sculpting, and in particular, the joy of seeing and then sculpting women; of the healing energy and power that I saw when women were not afraid...when they could be present, when they could be themselves, speak their minds...and the heroism it takes to do this in the face of real danger in their daily lives.  For more than 25 years I have been sculpting women.  At first glance, they appear to be classical figurative nudes, but they are not.  They are radically modern...revolutionary.  These women are safe, present. Look at them. They have chosen their own expression, so you will see the actual woman, the person, her energy and spirit.  It is my intent that these sculptures exude this healing energy and inspire us to take action; to finally say enough is enough.


Risks and Challenges

The risks and challenges with this project relate to being able to raise sufficient funds to complete the sculpture, the lighthouses and the accompanying surprises! (Which we don't want to disclose here, so as to not ruin the aforementioned surprises).


The Bottom Line

Art can illuminate the human condition and be a catalyst to social change ...My hope is to expand human consciousness and inspire men and women to take action to end violence against women, beginning a healing process that will make room for women’s voices, thus allowing all of us to live fully and thrive! I am asking you to stand with us!

Thank you to everyone for the incredible support you have provided in the past, and to everyone who is considering supporting R-Evolution. There is just no way projects like this could happen without you!

Marco and the Bliss Dance Crew

Please Join Us in Making R-evolution a Reality, Donate Now, Spread the Word!

P.S.  We have some great perks, stickers, sweatshirt, 4-inch clear mini-sculptures, a 3 foot tall torso of Truth is Beauty, experiences, etc.  Plus, everyone gets a Together We Stand Wristband.  Check it out!

P.P.S.  Taking you back old school... here's one more of Bliss Dance for the road! ; )

photo by Barry Toranto
story_txt:
R-Evolution a sponsored project of Flux Foundation, a nonprofit arts organization dedicated to engaging people in designing and building large-scale public art as a catalyst for education.  As such, contributions for the purposes of R-Evolution via Flux Foundation are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.The Woman Stands:  R-Evolution Burning Man 2015
R-Evolution
is the final sculpture in The Bliss Project- A 3-part series of monumental
sculptures. Beginning with Bliss Dance: photographer unknown        And followed by Truth is Beauty:photo by Sidney Erthal
We’ve danced, we’ve reached for ourselves and now we can just be…well…who we are….present.

The Bliss Project and R-Evolution
R-Evolution is the
third and final sculpture in the
series of three monumental sculptures, The Bliss Project, by Marco Cochrane of
a woman expressing her humanity.  At 48 feet tall, R-Evolution will debut at Burning Man 2015.  These sculptures are intended to demand a
change in perspective… to be catalysts for social change.  They are intended to challenge the viewer to
see past the sexual charge that has developed around the female body which has
been used for power and control, to the human being.  They are intended to de-objectify women and
inspire us all to take action to end violence against women, thus
allowing everyone to live fully and thrive. 
Another collaboration with Deja Solis, R-Evolution is
different than Bliss Dance and Truth is Beauty. There is
no overt action in her expression; she is not dancing in the face of
danger, she is not reaching to meet herself and find her own truth.  In
R-Evolution, Deja explores and expresses what she feels like when she
can just be...a whole person... a woman, radiating her energy into the
world. 
The completed sculpture
will be made of steel rod and tubing, utilizing two layers of geodesic
triangles covered by a stainless steel mesh with LED lighting effects.  Want to know more?

What’s Done?
2014 was a busy year
at Bliss Dance Studios.  It started with
Marco and Deja in the studio:  using a
Pantograph – a medieval-era enlargement tool –  and starting from a ¾ life-size original,  a 15-foot clay version of R-Evolution was
built from hand using classical sculpting techniques.  The next step was to begin the second phase
enlargement to her final metal form.  
Last year we
set a goal to complete one-half of R-Evolution so that we could finish her in
time for Burning Man 2015.  We are
thrilled to say that with the help of hundreds of generous donors and
volunteers, we met that goal!!! 
Here are some
pictures of the clay/moldmaking process and pieces of the interior structure completed last year…


What’s Next?
The Sculpture

Everything
else!  Metalwork for the second half of
R-Evolution is well underway.  We need to
complete the sculpture, paint her for rust protection, design, purchase and
install the lighting, place the mesh skin and construct the base. Additional
funding is needed to support special surprises for your discovery on the
Playa.  To bring her to Burning Man we
will need to pay for heavy equipment and trucking.  
Together We Stand

We believe
that there should be no incidents of sexual assault at Burning Man. This place
should be safe.  Full-stop.  If any place can be, Burning Man can. If
anyone can make it happen Burners can. 
We would love the legacy of the Bliss Project to be that there were no
incidents in 2015 and on in to the future.
To that end,
we are also working on expanding our public activation campaign: “Together we
Stand.”  We plan to bring more wristbands
and to continue to ask those who agree to wear one to take “active
responsibility of the safety of their sister’s on the playa.”  In addition we will be working with a number
of camps to create safe spaces, all connected by 20 foot tall lighthouses,
constructed with steel rods, designating their location.  These lighthouses are intended to both raise
public awareness and to provide a safe place for those in need. To build these lighthouses, we need to purchase metal, lighting,
solar panels, motors and signs.  

How Can You Help?

There are two
ways you can help:
· 
First,
we are pleased to have been awarded a grant from Burning Man, but this does not
cover our remaining costs.  We have
launched this Indiegogo page to help us close the gap and have great perks to
offer as a show of our appreciation for your support. Please check them out and
consider donating! 
· 
Second,
you can actively participate in the Together we Stand campaign.  If your camp would like to host a lighthouse,
or if you have any thoughts on how to further expand on this concept, or you have an idea that you think will align with The Bliss Project, please
contact us.  We’d love to hear from you!

My Inspiration

If you didn't already click the link, watch this video about The Bliss Project:

The story of R-Evolution and The Bliss Project began when I
was 7-years old and my best friend was a 9-year old little girl.  One day
I was told, in way too much detail for a little boy, that she had been raped
right outside of my house.  It was incomprehensible, horrible, I never
forgot, I never understood...it still haunts me.  I thought...that man
couldn't have realized my friend was a person...if he really could see her,
this wouldn't have happened.
I grew up in the Bay Area in the 60's and 70's, in the
philosophical revolution and turbulence of those times.  I learned to
deeply appreciate feminine energy, influence and strength…and realized that the
objectification of women imprisoned women and also men.  I also saw
first-hand that one person, or a small group of people, can start a movement
that can make a difference and change the course of history.
In my 20s I discovered sculpting, and in particular, the joy of
seeing and then sculpting women; of the healing energy and power that I saw
when women were not afraid...when they could be present, when they could be
themselves, speak their minds...and the heroism it takes to do this in the face
of real danger in their daily lives.  For more than 25 years I have been sculpting
women.  At first glance, they appear to be classical figurative nudes, but
they are not.  They are radically modern...revolutionary.  These
women are safe, present. Look at them. They have chosen their own expression,
so you will see the actual woman, the person, her energy and spirit.  It
is my intent that these sculptures exude this healing energy and inspire us to
take action; to finally say enough is enough.

Risks and Challenges
The risks and challenges with this project relate to being able to raise sufficient funds to complete the sculpture, the lighthouses and the accompanying surprises! (Which we don't want to disclose here, so as to not ruin the aforementioned surprises).

The Bottom Line
Art can illuminate the human condition and be a catalyst to
social change ...My hope is to expand human consciousness and inspire men
and women to take action to end violence against women, beginning a healing
process that will make room for women’s voices, thus allowing all of us to live
fully and thrive! I am asking you to stand with us!
Thank you to everyone for the incredible support you have
provided in the past, and to everyone who is considering supporting
R-Evolution. There is just no way projects like this could happen without
you!
Marco and the Bliss Dance Crew
Please Join Us in
Making R-evolution a Reality, Donate Now, Spread the Word!
P.S.  We have some great perks, stickers, sweatshirt, 4-inch clear mini-sculptures, a 3 foot tall torso of Truth is Beauty, experiences,
etc.  Plus, everyone gets a Together We Stand Wristband.  Check it
out!
P.P.S.  Taking you back old school... here's one more of Bliss Dance for the road! ; )

story:
Short Summary

In response to the creative minds that assemble short films for school, work, or fun; and after showing them to their peers the films are forgotten about. I want to re-surface and share these works. The show will consist of a series of drawings from a group of Hip Bop artists. There will be an open bar, local press coverage and street attention, a managed canvas for graffiti artists, intro to aerial lessons on the trapeze, and tasteful entertainment followed by film screenings all based around the theme of urban intellect, community and togetherness.

What We Need & What You Get

Benefits of making this event possible include vip service during the exhibition, shout outs on social media sites, access to the artists and performers and discounts on art works. We will be working to deliver more awareness about the Hip Bop music style with the suggested donations we are pledging that will help us transform the space into an exhibition complete with a proper cinema needs, set-up, and guest services.

The Impact

Hip Bop is a culture of awakening and upheaval as a new forms of music and art are emerging. Hip Bop is a high arts society of urban minds. Our goal is continuously be forward thinking. Whatever you are, you can be more than that and push your art form to the next level.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please share our campaign on social media sites
  • Feel free to reach out contact us if you would like to be involved in the movement in any other way. http://nilelivingston.com/contact/

story:
Join us for this unique and fun giving opportunity and support InterUrban ArtHouse for #GivingTuesday this year! We need your help to continue our work and support our mission into 2015 and beyond!

InterUrban ArtHouse's Mission

To enrich the cultural and economic vibrancy of the community by creating a place where artists and creative industries can work and prosper in an affordable, sustainable and inclusive environment.

InterUrban ArtHouse (IUAH) is a Creative Placemaking project in Downtown Historic Overland Park. We support artists and creative industries by:

  • hosting a creative space for artists 
  • providing programs to develop artistic and business skills, and
  • offering greater connections within the local and regional arts community
We have been working since 2012 to offer programming that supports artists of all levels and backgrounds while creating new studio, programming and event space for community arts and culture. Come visit us at 8001 Conser this #GivingTuesday or any other time! 
For more details, visit www.interurbanarthouse.org or Find Us On Facebook


What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for $7,500 towards our Annual End-of-year Fundraising Campaign, in order to support our general operations, programming, staff expenses and everything it takes to keep our mission going.

  • We have thought up lots of fun perks for you and ways for us to thank you for giving to InterUrban ArtHouse
  • You can get everything from shout-outs online and over the phone, to t-shirts, original artwork gifts and some unique arts experiences with us and the artists we work with.
Check out our Founder Nicole Emanuel & Executive
Assistant Lauren McGill in our InterUrban Tees!

 

  • Because we are doing a super-short campaign, a lot of our perks are ways for us to thank you in "real-time" - don't forget to keep track of our progress throughout the day on Facebook and Twitter. 

The Impact

Your gift will help us continue our programming that reaches many artists in and around our region, and to provide space and support for arts & culture. With your help, we can continue to create things like:

  • Studio space for art classes, public meetings, workshops and talks.
  • ArtSmart classes that bring artist mentors into underserved schools.
  • Community art initiatives such as the City of Overland Park's Cultural District. 
  • Art therapists working with at-risk youth and those with developmental disabilities in our community.
  • Business skills and networking opportunities for artists and creative industries.
  • Research into arts impact and needs across the KC Region.
  • 100+ events and programs serving as many as 2,000 individuals


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can offer financial support. There are other ways you can help us reach our goal!

  • Share this campaign - Facebook, Twitter, via email, word of mouth - whatever works for you! Indiegogo makes it easy with their sharing tools, below.
  • Drop by our space at 8001 Conser St on Tuesday December 2nd for these events:
  • ArtWorks Web & Marketing Co-op (Website Review Edition) 10am - 11.30am
  • ArtMatters Writers Roundtable 1pm - 2.30pm
    or anytime throughout the day to say hi and join in the fun as we follow our campaign!

Thanks so much for reading and for your support!

For any other questions or queries, contact (913) 432-1916

story:
We need your help to make a monument to courage. There is no room for compromise today and art is called upon to make choices and show a direction.
We want to create a life-size bronze statue of Assange, Manning and Snowden standing on three chairs with an empty fourth chair next to them.
It is not a simple homage to individuals, but to courage and to the importance of freedom of speech and information.

This is the reason for the empty chair.
Each of us can climb onto it, however uncomfortable and vulnerable, and change our point of view.
The work of art will travel from country to country and offer the opportunity for us  to hear each other out and think.

To be free, we need to be courageous. And courage is contagious. 

All the money donated will be used for the casting in bronze, transportation and installation of the artwork.

The sculpture will be hosted in Dresden between June and Sept 2015
The sculpture will be executed by artist Davide Dormino in one of Italy's most prestigious foundries, in Pietrasanta - Tuscany

http://anythingtosay.com

press@anythingtosay.com

Facebook: Anything to say? _ a public art project for freedom

https://twitter.com/AnythingtoSay_


The artist and the man behind the idea:

Davide Dormino, born in 1973, is an Italian sculptor.
His works are both in private collections worldwide and public spaces. In 2011, he created the monument for the victims of Port au Prince's earthquake in Haiti, commissioned by the United Nations.

Charles Glass, born in 1951, is an American author, journalist and broadcaster specializing in the Middle East.He writes for The New York Review of Books, London Review of Books, Times Literary Supplement and other journals and has written many books. Glass himself made headlines in 1987, when he was taken hostage for 62 days in Lebanon by Shi'a militants. He describes the kidnapping and escape in his book, Tribes with Flags.

story:
Bum Rush Art Basel!

Seven artists from DC have been invited to participate in the Prizm Art Fair and we need your help to get there!

In recent years, DC artists, collectors and gallerists have been making the pilgrimage to Art Basel Miami Beach in ever-growing numbers. With 260 leading galleries participating and over 50,000 people in attendance, Art Basel Miami is one of the most highly exposed art fairs in North America. This year a group of 7 Black artists will be showing work together at the Prizm Art Fair, along with other jury-selected American and international artists. This is an incredible opportunity, not only as artists but as ambassadors of DC’s contemporary art scene. 

Participation in Prizm will allow us to exhibit our work to a much wider audience on a scale we could not achieve individually. Each artist will show up to five works, more than is typical for an art fair. As well, the exhibition will be on view from December 4-22. We are asking for your help to offset the expenses associated with participating in a traveling exhibition.

The Selected Artists:

Holly Bass 

Wesley Clark

Jamea Richmond-Edwards 

Shaunte Gates 

Amber Robles-Gordon 

Adrienne Gaither 

Stan Squirewell

About PRIZM

PRIZM is a curated art fair that expands the spectrum of international artists from the African Diaspora and emerging markets at one of the most prestigious art festivals in the world. In 2014, Prizm will exhibit a dynamic group or contemporary artists during Art Basel/Miami at the Miami Center for Architecture and Design. Salient works will be presented that highlight the diversity evident in contemporary visual art practices today, including painting, sculpture and mixed media installations. In addition to a major presence during ABMB, Prizm hosts workshops and special events throughout the year to advance the careers of local and regional artists. Prizm was founded in 2013 by Mikhaile Solomon. Mikhaile Solomon is a designer and arts advocate. She holds a Master’s of Architecture from Florida International University and worked as Assistant Producer for Art Africa Miami, which celebrates work from the Global African Diaspora. 

How Will Donations Be Used?

The seven artists are working together to pool resources to minimize costs and to maximize this opportunity. As independent artists we would benefit from any support you can offer!

Total request: $7,150.00

Art shipping: $500 per artist x 7 for round-trip shipping and art handling. ($3,500)

Marketing: $150 x 7 for each artist to print 4x6 color postcards showcasing their work as well as general materials which will be printed by the Prizm fair, including a full color catalogue. ($1,050)

Travel stipend: $300 per artist x 7 as a modest stipend will help offset the costs of traveling to Miami, though artists are still responsible for lodging and other expenses. ($2,100)

Transaction fees: These fees range from 7-14%, depending on the success of the campaign. We are including $500 to partially offset the fees collected by Indiegogo (4-9%) and financial merchants (Paypal and credit card fees averaging 3-5%).

Perks:

$1-$1,000 Join us for a Post-Miami reception at Marvin in December.

$10 A declaration of love on our Facebook page

$20 Handwritten thank you from one of the artists

$35 Postcard packet featuring images from at least 5 of the artists, signed and suitable for framing

$75 Hand-printed t-shirt or tote bag by one of the artists

$150 Full-color catalogue signed by all of the DC artists

$250 The complete package: All four of the previous perks!

$500 Studio visit and light dinner with artist of your choice

$1,000 All of the above plus 8x10 signed print of an original work

Thank you so much! Whether or not you can give directly, please support us by sharing our Indiegogo campaign link with your networks and on social media.

story:
MY STORY

My Name is Noma.  The name was given to me by friends to reflect my nomadic ways. I am a traveling photographer and cultural reporter.  I travel to a region   and embrace, observe and participate in local culture for a long period of time. 

My work has brought me to 15 countries over the last few years.  Each new venture breathes new life into me and further invigorates my love of new people and places. I feel like a newborn that is constantly inundated with newness and firsts. A new place and overload the senses and make a person feel like a newborn baby. I’ve grown to love this feeling – it really makes me feel like I am alive and gives me a sense of how diverse the world really is. 


  My latest project was the Burning Man


The nomad usually enjoys the freedom of traveling with their entire life in a large backpack.  Unfortunately, it also means everything can easily be snatched away. Then one day, I was the innocent victim of crime in U.S. Losing my art, my dream, my people, my love and my self would have been bad enough, 



They were gone before they could see the light of day. I did everything I could to find what precious things I lost Yet no one else seemed to care. Because really my existence was no more significant that a spec of dust.

I wallowed in sadness and pity before I decided to refocus. I poured my energy into learning to fill the void.  I prepared to recapture the stimulus of newness.  I thought I lost everything I owned that day When I realized I had yet unlimited potential It is the moment I knew that to be nothing is really to be ANYTHING!  I've trained myself to take each step forward. That's right. It's a fresh start. 


My Nomadic worldwide adventure is about to begin anew.

THE JOURNEY BEGINS FEB 2015

story_txt:
MY STORY
 

My Name is Noma.  The name was given to me by friends to reflect my nomadic ways. I am a traveling photographer and cultural reporter.  I travel to a region   and embrace, observe and participate in local culture for a long period of time. 
My work has brought me to 15 countries over the last few years.  Each new venture breathes new life into me and further invigorates my love of new people and places. I feel like a newborn that is constantly inundated with newness and firsts. A new place and overload the senses and make a person feel like a newborn baby. I’ve grown to love this feeling – it really makes me feel like I am alive and gives me a sense of how diverse the world really is. 




  My latest project was the Burning Man

The nomad usually enjoys the freedom of traveling with their entire life in a large backpack.  Unfortunately, it also means everything can easily be snatched away. Then one day, I was the innocent victim of crime in U.S. Losing my art, my dream, my people, my love and my self would have been bad enough, 





They were gone before they could see the light of day. I did everything I could to find what precious things I lost Yet no one else seemed to care. Because really my existence was no more significant that a spec of dust.
I wallowed in sadness and pity before I decided to refocus. I poured my energy into learning to fill the void.  I prepared to recapture the stimulus of newness.  I thought I lost everything I owned that day When I realized I had yet unlimited potential It is the moment I knew that to be nothing is really to be ANYTHING!  I've trained myself to take each step forward. That's right. It's a fresh start. 

My Nomadic worldwide adventure is about to begin anew.
THE JOURNEY BEGINS FEB 2015













WHAT YOUR SUPPORT MEANS

 


 10% Indiegogo & Paypal Fees
 30% I'll repay for the last project (The cost of production & Perks)
 60% All money raised will go towards my next project 








PARTICIPATION


If you're able to pledge, i'd love to have you as part of the Nomad Project:Finding her wings. But even if you can't, you can be part of my Nomad Project:Come with me. You can apply through my web site if you have your own story that want trip around the world but can’t. If you need more information about this project, please feel free to click the link right now.

story:
" Its like having 3 helmets in 1 "

 

With this 3 face helmet modular face-plate system, each mouth plate is magnetized with strong earth magnets. Even the backplate has magnets!

This helmet will require some hot glue and basic painting and assembly skills.

Available as a kit, you can paint any color you like. 

Comes as is in Black primer painted already and all you have to do is add more paint of any color you like on it!

 

**WARNING: If you have metal implants, dentures and metallic fillings it may get stuck or if you have sensitivity to magentic forces please do not wear this helmet. You may own it as a display piece though.

story:
A collection of 49 everyday extraordinary people who have done the Impossible, and through the mediums of art and written narrative we collated them into a book. 
it’s a guide to personal motivation, purely designed to bring happiness and strength to its readers. Do the Impossible, FLY!

We are two sisters: Liron - an architect & painter and Shira - a writer & poet. We were perplexed by the lack of humanity we saw surrounding us and refused to be sucked into the darkness, instead choosing to open our eyes and hearts to the wonders of the world! We've been working on FLY for the last year and a half by creating and producing all of its artistic elements. Join us and find the ability to FLY <3

Our vision and dream is to fill your senses with strength, empowerment, determination and self-fulfillment as you flick through the pages of FLY.

FLY tells the personal stories of 49 extraordinary people, some are known and famous people and some are anonymous but spectacular - They are FLY's FIGURES !

Each remarkable story relates to a specific field of interest and occurred at a different period of time in history. From renaissance artists and World War 2 protesters, to modern gay rights activists and Kurdish warriors that still fight ISIS. 

FLY is a one-of-a-kind inspirational art book, crafted by pen & ink portraits and uplifting lyric texts, based on true extraordinary stories of people who changed the course of humanity.

Each one of FLY's Figures gets 4 pages in the book:

  • Length - 240 pages 
  • Weight - 2.6 pounds (1.2kg)
  • Size - 8 X 10.5 inches (20.5 X 26.5 cm)

This is our offering to humanity :)

FLY consists the tales of 49 everyday heroic people who transcended the boundaries placed against them, and done the impossible.

We were moved by the story of Sophia Scholl - a young woman who protested against the Nazis by painting murals. We uncovered the story of Media - a woman currently risking her life fighting for Kurdish rights against ISIS in Iraq. We learned of Karina Chikitova -a little girl who survived 11 days in the wilds of Siberia. We researched modern heroes such as gay-rights activist Brian Skerry and the first women who ever won a Nobel Prize for science, Marie Curie.

As well as heroes from times gone by, such as Leonardo Da Vinci and Ludwig van Beethoven, who were both misunderstood during their lifetimes, but who nonetheless followed their creative pursuits and created timeless masterpieces. 

Being human isn't always easy. The world around us is so often full of conflict and complexity: war, famine, discrimination – and also heartache, stress, regrets and unfulfilled dreams. All of it so often leaves us feeling disillusioned and frustrated. 

Refusing to be sucked into the darkness, we decided to open our eyes and hearts to the wonders of the world; use art as a medium to touch and motivate the people around us!

When we heard stories of terror and tragedy we sought out stories of tremendous courage of people who transcended the boundaries placed around them. We fought the fear and degradation with celebration and inspiration;

FLY was born from the bottom of our hearts and most passionate emotions of creativity. We aim that the power of human perseverance and positivity of these Honorary Members will flood all of your senses and remind you of the goodness in the world. 

Through our Pen & Ink portraits and poetic texts, we wish to transfer the sparkle and feelings which guided these life changing heroes to the reader, on the best side possible.  

Therefore, the money raised through pre orders, will also help to fund future FLY projects including exhibitions, lectures, workshops and other interactive visual media. 

Special Thanks To...

We wanted to personally thank all of the cherished people who helped us create FLY and this campaign on the best side possible - So thanks a lot to:

Campaign Managers - Sparqly™  | Johanna Hazan | Tomer Fishler | Toni Cohen | Michal Koren | Oded Calderon Ashkenazi | Ofer Koren | Michelle Yavor | Adi Gimpel | Daniel Farkas | Guy Ben-David | Carol & Menahem Sevdermish | ManorIrie Irilin | Assaf Flom | Katzav Shahar | Oded Levy | Yaniv Druker's Studio | Shany Natanzon | Rami & Rivka Ben Arzi | adv. Yotam Werzansky-Orland | Vered Zarhi | Avichai Kremer | Oren Shallome | Regina Burshtein | Sarit Ziv | Osnat Livnat | Eliav Alaluf | Elad Gur | Shani Rich | Leon Arts | Elad Manor | Sivan Melnick | Miki Melnick | Yael Warshavsky-Gal | Negrin David Elharar | Ori Levin

Your'e all made of FLY material :)

We researched modern heroes such as gay-rights activist Brian Skerry and the first women who ever won a Nobel Prize for science, Marie Curie.As well as heroes from times gone by, such as Leonardo Da Vinci and Ludwig van Beethoven, who were both misunderstood during their lifetimes, but who nonetheless followed their creative pursuits and created timeless masterpieces. 
"Why does the eye see a thing more clearly in dreams than the imagination, when awake?" Da Vinci
"In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different." Coco ChanelBeing human isn't always easy. The world around us is so often full of conflict and complexity: war, famine, discrimination – and also heartache, stress, regrets and unfulfilled dreams. All of it so often leaves us feeling disillusioned and frustrated. 
Leonardo Da Vinci - Considered to be one of the greatest renaissance artists and is known for his inventions, paintings and creations in science, architecture, engineering and music. He's one of FLY's 49 Figures.Refusing to be sucked into the darkness, we decided to open our eyes and hearts to the wonders of the world; use art as a medium to touch and motivate the people around us!
"Instead of telling about the tears, tell about the moment of hapiness. Instead of recreating how they tore your dreams, you could sing the beautiful song of the heart. Tell about the moment when joy spread through your body and woke up all the sleeping."When we heard stories of terror and tragedy we sought out stories of tremendous courage of people who transcended the boundaries placed around them. We fought the fear and degradation with celebration and inspiration;
"Somebody, after all, had to make a start" Sophia SchollFLY was born from the bottom of our hearts and most passionate emotions of creativity. We aim that the power of human perseverance and positivity of these Honorary Members will flood all of your senses and remind you of the goodness in the world. Through our Pen & Ink portraits and poetic texts, we wish to transfer the sparkle and feelings which guided these life changing heroes to the reader, on the best side possible.   The drawing process - Liron decided to draw all of FLY's portraits with her left hand, while she's a righty, just for making this creation more unique and much more personal.Therefore, the money raised through pre orders, will also help to fund future FLY projects including exhibitions, lectures, workshops and other interactive visual media. 
"Life is meant to be fun, and joyous, and fulfilling" - is the reason why Jim Henson took on himself the mission to spread joy!Special Thanks To...We wanted to personally thank all of the cherished people who helped us create FLY and this campaign on the best side possible - So thanks a lot to:Campaign Managers - Sparqly™  | Johanna Hazan | Tomer Fishler | Toni Cohen | Michal Koren | Oded Calderon Ashkenazi | Ofer Koren | Michelle Yavor | Adi Gimpel | Daniel Farkas | Guy Ben-David | Carol & Menahem Sevdermish | ManorIrie Irilin | Assaf Flom | Katzav Shahar | Oded Levy | Yaniv Druker's Studio | Shany Natanzon | Rami & Rivka Ben Arzi | adv. story:
Who:

My name is Naomi Tarle and I'm an artist. I graduated with a MFA in Visual Art in May 2015 from California State University Northridge. I also received an MFA in Creative Writing in 2009 from Boise State University. Since graduating last spring, I have been working on new art projects using a wide array of materials. I teach art at Cal State Northridge and English at College of the Canyons.

What:

My art investigates identity in relation to history and current events. Linking my identity to historical events and peoples is a linear sequence, yet current events though timely, are difficult to comprehend and relate. My work prompts questions and critical thinking: How do knives cut from pink vinyl connect me to stabbings in Jerusalem? How do the borders of land, religion, and identity coincide with a small embroidery of a house in California? Do domestic, tactile endeavors shape globalization? Does globalization speed the recession of events into history, or make them linger?

My work can be seen on my website: www.naomitarle.net

Why:

Part of what I hope will be a regular part of my art practice is engaging in new communities and environments through residencies. The environment that the residency and London provide will assist me in the experimentation of ideas. I hope to push my own boundaries and the border between medium and concept.

Where:

I have been accepted to The London Summer Intensive led by the Slade School of Fine Art, UCL and the Camden Art Center.

The residency will run throughout August 2016 and focus on independent studio practice. The program reflects the dynamic, rigorous and open-ended approaches to art-making championed by both institutions. The program includes artist talks, evening lectures, studio discussion, and curatorial and professional development. The London Summer Intensive concludes with a critique and showcase of ideas and work in progress at Camden Arts Centre’s Artists’ Studio.

More detailed information can be found at:                             http://londonintensive.org                                                          http://www.ucl.ac.uk/slade                                           http://www.camdenartscentre.org

Funding:

My goal is to raise at least $3,850 of the funds I need for the residency through this campaign. This will help cover: 

•  Airfare                    $ 1,600

•  Dorm room           $ 2,250

Additional funds after the initial goal is reached will help me pay for:

•  Residency fee       $3,500

•  Food                         $250

•  Art Materials         $200

Perks:

Everybody loves perks!

I will have a live blog during my month in London that anyone will be able to follow.

·  $5.00 gets you a social media shout out

·  $15.00 gets you a postcard from London

·  $25.00 gets you a handwritten letter/poem/sketch

·  $50.00 gets you a small limited edition print

·  $100.00 gets you a medium limited edition print

·  $150.00 gets you a small original embroidery

·  $200.00 gets you a medium original embroidery

· $300.00 gets you an artist talk

*prints and small embroideries will be sent by the end of July*

*large embroideries will be sent in Fall/Winter*

Impact:

Supporting me, and supporting the arts, is a way to engage in culture. Art urges society forward. It depicts and examines our faults and our triumphs. Art records history. Art shouts and whispers across the world. Art impacts the artist and the viewer. Engage in the world. Engage in art. Support artists!

Risks & Challenges

Obviously, with every new opportunity, there are risks and challenges to overcome. I will have to create work in a different city and different studio. I will be engaging with artists and peers I have never met. I am confident that I will use this residency for all the possibilities it offers. Although this is my first residency, I have had similar opportunities, such as two MFA programs, and have never failed to push myself and my abilities.

Even if I do not reach my funding goal, your money and support will not go to waste. Although it will be more difficult without reaching my funding goals, I will be attending the residency in August.

Other Ways You Can Help

A huge help would be for you to share my campaign on social media— Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc. The more people hear about my campaign, the better my chances of reaching my funding goal.

THANK YOU!
