story:
ArtBattles U is a live painting competition consisting of the best college student artists battling on stage in front of a crowd of their peers. The crowd and YOU cheer for and determine the winning artist. We give college students with a wide range of talents - not just the visual arts - a stage to be discovered. This includes the best college DJ’s, MC’s, models, body painters, singers, dancers, photographers, videographers and hype teams.

What are we going to do with the money?

Launch the Official ArtBattles U College Tour. We will host regional battles between the four best college artists in four cities: New York, Philadelphia, Boston and Washington, DC. We'll also seek out and work with the best college DJs, MCs, dancers, models and promoters to make each night absolutely EPIC and a great experience for the crowd. The winning artist from each regional battle will travel to New York to compete in the Finals in April. The champion will win bragging rights, exposure across the US and the title of 2014 ArtBattles U Champion.

The Official ArtBattles U College Tour dates:

  • November 2013: Philadelphia, PA
  • November 2013: New York, NY
  • February 2014: Boston, MA
  • February 2014: Washington, DC
  • April 2014: Finals in New York, NY

A few words from two of our artists:

"ArtBattles U was an amazing experience. It's something you'll remember for the rest of your life, I know I will." - Sam (FIT student and winner of ArtBattles U New York Launch Battle)

 

"I didn't know what college was until ArtBattles U." - Baskt (Parsons student and competing artist at ArtBattles U New York Launch Battle)

What do you get by funding us on Indiegogo?

By donating to our Indiegogo you will be joining the biggest movement in the college art world today. You will receive acknowledgment on ArtBattlesU.com for supporting these amazing student painters, illustrators, fine artists and street artists. Like us, you’re on Indiegogo to find creative go-getters who are doing it themselves. Your contribution will not only help us, but will give young go-getters their stage to be discovered.

What cool stuff do you get by funding us on Indiegogo?

Get some amazing swag! Pick up a pair of neon shades or authentic ArtBattles U t-shirts and tank tops (the super comfortable kind).

Visit our gallery to check out the ArtBattles U swag

With the VIP access package you and a guest receive a confirmed ticket to a battle in your city and get to skip the line. 

With the All Battles VIP package you and a guest receive VIP event tickets for the entire tour, including all 4 regional battles and the finals in New York.

Want a painting? With the All Battles VIP & Painting package you get first selection of any piece of artwork created at the show you attend. Get the piece everybody wants.

Official Tour Sponsors will be able to integrate themselves into the battles with brand ambassadors and sampling opportunities. With this comes full billing on all ArtBattles U promotional pieces and on the Step & Repeat in each city - viewed thousands of times through our social media channels. You will have the rights to use content from the battle, as well as licensing to all artwork created on the Official Tour. Your logo and billing as Official Tour sponsor will be headlined on our homepage and across all social media channels.

About ArtBattles U 

Our events are sensory-intoxicating. The crowd discovers new levels of excitement at every show. Join the rEvolution to experience the captivating creation of live art in the midst of dancing, DJing, and an all out party at ArtBattles U. Do something EPIC.

Want to get involved beyond funding us on Indiegogo? 

Are you a college student artist? DJ? MC? Dancer? Photographer? Reach out to us at www.artbattlesu.com/getinvolved

All participating students will have the thrill of performing on stage at a huge venue in front of thousands of their friends and peers, as well as a featured listing on our credits page. All competing artists are compensated for their time and also receive 50% of artwork sales and a percentage of retail sales.

ArtBattles U is a live painting competition consisting of the best college student artists battling on stage in front of a crowd of their peers. The crowd and YOU cheer for and determine the winning artist. We give college students with a wide range of talents - not just the visual arts - a stage to be discovered. This includes the best college DJ’s, MC’s, models, body painters, singers, dancers, photographers, videographers and hype teams.

What are we going to do with the money?
Launch the Official ArtBattles U College Tour. We will host regional battles between the four best college artists in four cities: New York, Philadelphia, Boston and Washington, DC. We'll also seek out and work with the best college DJs, MCs, dancers, models and promoters to make each night absolutely EPIC and a great experience for the crowd. The winning artist from each regional battle will travel to New York to compete in the Finals in April. The champion will win bragging rights, exposure across the US and the title of 2014 ArtBattles U Champion.
The Official ArtBattles U College Tour dates:

November 2013: Philadelphia, PA
November 2013: New York, NY
February 2014: Boston, MA
February 2014: Washington, DC
April 2014: Finals in New York, NY

A few words from two of our artists:

"ArtBattles U was an amazing experience. It's something you'll remember for the rest of your life, I know I will." - Sam (FIT student and winner of ArtBattles U New York Launch Battle)
 

"I didn't know what college was until ArtBattles U." - Baskt (Parsons student and competing artist at ArtBattles U New York Launch Battle)
What do you get by funding us on Indiegogo?
By donating to our Indiegogo you will be joining the biggest movement in the college art world today. You will receive acknowledgment on ArtBattlesU.com for supporting these amazing student painters, illustrators, fine artists and street artists. Like us, you’re on Indiegogo to find creative go-getters who are doing it themselves. Your contribution will not only help us, but will give young go-getters their stage to be discovered.
What cool stuff do you get by funding us on Indiegogo?
Get some amazing swag! Pick up a pair of neon shades or authentic ArtBattles U t-shirts and tank tops (the super comfortable kind).
Visit our gallery to check out the ArtBattles U swag
With the VIP access package you and a guest receive a confirmed ticket to a battle in your city and get to skip the line. 
With the All Battles VIP package you and a guest receive VIP event tickets for the entire tour, including all 4 regional battles and the finals in New York.
Want a painting? With the All Battles VIP & Painting package you get first selection of any piece of artwork created at the show you attend. Get the piece everybody wants.
Official Tour Sponsors will be able to integrate themselves into the battles with brand ambassadors and sampling opportunities. With this comes full billing on all ArtBattles U promotional pieces and on the Step & Repeat in each city - viewed thousands of times through our social media channels. You will have the rights to use content from the battle, as well as licensing to all artwork created on the Official Tour. Your logo and billing as Official Tour sponsor will be headlined on our homepage and across all social media channels.

About ArtBattles U 
Our events are sensory-intoxicating. The crowd discovers new levels of excitement at every show. Join the rEvolution to experience the captivating creation of live art in the midst of dancing, DJing, and an all out party at ArtBattles U. Do something EPIC.
Want to get involved beyond funding us on Indiegogo? 
Are you a college student artist? DJ? MC? Dancer? Photographer? Reach out to us at www.artbattlesu.com/getinvolved
All participating students will have the thrill of performing on stage at a huge venue in front of thousands of their friends and peers, as well as a featured listing on our credits page. All competing artists are compensated for their time and also receive 50% of artwork sales and a percentage of retail sales.

story:
Some of you might know that my 2012 “Snow Drawings” at Rabbit Ears Pass in Colorado received significant feedback and press nationally and internationally. Amongst others they were featured on NPR, MSNBC, The Discovery Channel, on TV in Canada – even on public TV Tokyo. They were also shown on numerous art, design and culture websites and written about in magazines, including SOMA Magazine, an Italian Archeology Magazine and a Chinese Art Magazine. Photographs and video of the pieces are shown in exhibitions in California and in Europe this summer and fall.

During several exhilarating interactive community events that combined art-making and outdoor winter activity in a most beautiful landscape in Colorado, we created large drawings that could only be seen from the air in their entirety – and only for a very limited period of time.

Check out the Snow Drawings at Rabbit Ears Pass

What exactly are “Snow Drawings”?

“Snow Drawings” are large designs that I “draw” in the environment by walking lines into fresh snow surfaces with snowshoes. Ideal “canvases” are deforested areas, as well as frozen lakes and rivers. The finished pieces are ephemeral, and while they can take many hours to create, their duration is entirely unpredictable. In some occasions they have been coated over by snowdrift or new snowfall shortly after completion. This requires that I photograph them immediately. In one instance I had a total of 20 minutes before nightfall to photograph a piece that had taken me 12 hours to create. The next morning there was nothing there at all.

Where did this idea come from?

I began this project in winter 2009 during an artist residency in the Rocky Mountains. Inspired by the lay of the landscape, I designed patterns in my mind, which I then walked into the snow. My drawings have since become more complex, and I have created “Snow Drawings” in diverse landscapes, including Northern New Mexico, the Sierra Nevada near Lake Tahoe, on a frozen pond north of New York City, and various locations in Northwestern Colorado.

How can the Community participate?

In January 2012 I engaged the community in participatory “Snow Drawings” near Steamboat Springs, Colorado. While offering opportunity for people to actively assist in the making of art, this enabled me to create even larger pieces. Volunteers greatly enjoyed their partaking in these outdoor art-making events. Creating art is not only inherent in all of us, but is also a necessity for healthy human beings and a healthy society. "Every human being is an artist who - from his state of freedom - … learns to determine the other positions in the total artwork of the future social order."  (Joseph Beuys).

These community events at Rabbit Ears Pass were made possible through the generous assistance of the Nature Conservancy of Colorado, the Steamboat Springs Arts Council and the Bud Werner Public Library of Steamboat Springs.

Thanks to a local pilot, who flew me over the area, I was able to shoot aerial photographs of the large-scale piece we had collaboratively created across the landscape within a fulfilling afternoon spent in the high-alpine Colorado winter world. A videographer with a remote-controlled helicopter shot video footage during the event, illustrating the creative process.

And what are the plans for winter 2013?

This past January‘s success - and experiencing how community volunteers took pleasure in their involvement in these outdoor art pieces - inspired even greater projects for this coming winter. I am now poised to create a more ambitious "Snow Drawings" project , involving host art- and environmental organizations across the US, providing opportunity for diverse communities to participate in the creative events, and resulting in monumental artworks embedded in varied landscapes. So far I have secured support from three organizations that will host and promote the events: in NY’s Hudson Valley, in Southern WY and in Northwestern CO. For the Colorado project we plan to work very large-scale – it is our goal to cover an entire frozen lake with snow drawings. The Wyoming snow drawings will be executed on a large prairie stretching across smooth hillsides near Saratoga Springs.  I am in discussion with additional venues across the US.

Artwork that disappears - what is left after the events?

As an artist and environmentalist I hope to inspire dialogue about issues connected to the natural world. Instead of creating lasting art pieces I rather like to unfold my work into large immersive experiences that live on in their documentation only (photo and video), and – more importantly – in the memories of my audiences.

During their short existence “Snow Drawings” correspond with the landscape – and so do those who help me create them. To make the work accessible to a larger audience, however, it is essential that photos be taken immediately after each event. The scale of the work requires aerial photography. In 2013 I will also put special emphasis on video, particularly to capture the process of creating these works in a group effort. I will arrange for photo-flights after each event, and videographers working with remote-controlled helicopters. The video will be edited for installations.

It is my goal to perform this work in as many different kinds of environments as possible. I hope that these pieces emphasize the beauty and uniqueness of each landscape, and thus inspire appreciation for nature - especially as modern society becomes increasingly disconnected from the natural world.

Hinrichsen creates work that is both informative and mystifying, methodical and magical. … Like the Native American tribes whose customs fascinate her, Hinrichsen orchestrates a symbolic relationship between the beauty of nature and the evolution of humanity. Her art speaks of the transience that defines our everyday lives, but rejoices in the wonders of the universe that transcend our earthly existence. (Emilie Trice, “Traces of Nature”, SOMA magazine, May 2012)

How can you help?

Your donation will help take this project to a much greater level, to expand it to environments throughout the US, engage new communities in the creation of these works, and present it to new audiences across the country – this time in an even more majestic expression. Imagine seeing this work from an airplane or in a satellite image! The projects planned for winter 2013 require me to raise $6,500. Please help me reach my goal by donating to “Snow Drawings 2013”

Your donation will help pay for travel expenses, photo-flights at each location, hiring videographers, who will shoot process video with remote controlled helicopters, and snowshoes for volunteers who cannot provide their own. Your donation will also help pay for the production of large-scale photo-prints and video pieces that will then be shown in exhibitions worldwide.

All donations are tax-deductible, as this project is Fiscally sponsored through Fractured Atlas– and you will also receive exciting rewards (see side panel).

Other ways to help

I know, of course, that not everyone is able to contribute financially. If you like my project, but cannot donate, you can still help by spreading the word, if you like.  Fell free to forward my campaign to people you know who might be interested in it, or post about it on facebook, twitter etc., or share it through the Indiegogo share tool.

 

Thank you for considering a donation to this unique arts project.

story:
A little about us
 

We are artists Tinsel & Twinkle; we met when we were 9 years old over pots of poster paints at school. Since that fortuitous meeting we have spent years collaborating and exhibiting our art works, as well as forming part of The Fairies Band and also setting up Pushing Pussy Records, a label promoting bands with female involvement.

We have both pursued our own artistic practice as individual artists, but sharing a history and similar creative concerns, we often join forces to collaborate on projects and exhibit together, including co-curating exhibitions.

We also stage public art events such as the Kidnapped Banker stunt where we held a ‘banker’ to ransom at The Bank of Twinkle and Tinsel within a gallery space, while the public were encouraged to leave their thoughts about the current financial crisis on bespoke banknotes.


PLEASE CHECK OUT THE GALLERY FOR SOME IMAGES OF THE PERKS AND OUR ARTWORK!!!

What we are up to...

Now we have been invited to exhibit at independent gallery, Galerie Michaela Stock which is in the heart of Vienna and in the midst of many other independent and established galleries. We have also been asked to take our interactive Bank of Twinkle and Tinsel with us, which will not only be set up in the gallery but will also be taking to the streets, so we can find out what people are really thinking and feeling about the global economy and how it is affecting them.

We created the ‘Bank of Twinkle & Tinsel’ because the global economic crisis has been at the forefront of the media and political discussion for a long time, and we wanted to create something that would allow people to really talk about and share their thoughts on this issue in a different, creative arena. Instead of trading in money, our banknotes trade in thoughts.

The part where we need to ask for your help!

With considerable lack of funding for the arts both here and in Austria we are now turning to outside help to get the financial backing needed for two key parts of this opportunity:

- To ship our paintings out there
- To fund the catalogue for the exhibition.

The catalogue is a unique opportunity for us. We have gained support from established and renowned artist Graham Crowley who is writing the foreword on us for it, the catalogue will not only be looking at works exhibited in Vienna but will be an overview of many different aspects of our creative careers. We believe this catalogue will be a wonderful and inspiring document to leave with visitors, collectors and gallerists in Vienna. It will give a professional edge to the show which in turn gives us extra credibility to an unknown audience and will provide an essential tool to learn more about us as artists.

By supporting our campaign on Indiegogo you will be helping two passionate UK artists make their mark in Vienna with a wonderful exhibiting opportunity. You’ll also be supporting us in our quest to give a voice to the public about how they are affected by the state of the financial world today.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we need to raise is £3000 (or $4700). These estimates have been rounded up to the nearest £100 to make sure any unforeseen costs are accounted for.

This will cover shipping of our paintings from London – Vienna and back which we estimate will cost £1700. The figure is based on a quote from Smart 4Art shipping specialists which includes the VAT.

The catalogue will be a further £1200 for printing costs and shipping to Vienna, based on a quote from Bishops Printers for 500 copies.

We will also need to take into account Indiegogo’s fees for using this platform which is why we have set our goal at £3000.

The unique perks we are offering to you in exchange for financial support are a range of limited edition items created and designed by us. We are offering prints, a Twinkle and Tinsel ‘Don’t Get Mugged’ mug, a studio visit, badges and signed photos of us from when we kidnapped our banker!
If we don’t manage to reach our total of £3000, we will still be putting any funds we do raise towards getting our work to Vienna so we can go ahead with the exhibition and stage our bank.


 PLEASE CHECK OUT THE GALLERY FOR SOME IMAGES OF THE PERKS AND OUR ARTWORK!!!

The Impact of your help:

If you believe in art as a format for real conversation, ways to create change in the world or simply to discuss what is going on in minds and in the world, then supporting artists like us is a way to keep that dialogue going and to support an industry which is and always has been so important culturally and historically, but which is currently being financially starved for young contemporary artists like ourselves.

We have had success with public support from crowdfunding before when we needed to fund the shipping for a group exhibition in LA in 2011. The exhibition lead to further opportunities to exhibit at the Orange County Centre of Contemporary Arts and created a high impact exhibition promoting the UK’s contemporary art scene to LA.

And finally!

If you cant help financially we would be so appreciative if you could help us to spread the word about our campaign and to let any friends, family and colleagues you have who are passionate or interested in the arts know about what we are trying to achieve.

Please feel free to use the share tools and tell your Facebook friends, tweet about it and help us to let everybody know…any help at all is simply wonderful, thank you!

PLEASE CHECK OUT THE GALLERY FOR SOME IMAGES OF THE PERKS AND OUR ARTWORK!!!

story:
A Letter from the Artist

Dear Friends,

This spring I will be taking a moment away from my looms and my artwork to dedicate some time to a very important and different kind of art project, and I hope you will consider helping me with it.  2017/2018 marks a pivotal point in my career, and I wish to capture and capitalize on this moment.  I am creating and publishing a professional and beautiful 40-page monograph including artworks from three recent museum and gallery exhibitions, which will feature a critical essay by Amanda Dalla Villa Adams and an interview with NCMA curator Jen Dasal. 

This book represents who I am and what I think about as an artist, right now.  Publishing and distributing it this year will continue the momentum of my recent success, helping to tell my story in a beautiful, impactful way, and on a national level.  It will be sent to museums, curators, and art departments across the country.  The goal is to build and sustain a thriving career as a professional artist. 

My project is supported in part by a CultureWorks Artist Grant and in-kind by the North Carolina Museum of Art, but I really need your help to make the Andrea Donnelly: Three Exhibitions monograph a reality.  

With deep gratitude,

Andrea

Theorems and Poems at Reynolds Gallery, November-December 2017

What I Need & What You Get

My Indiegogo fundraising goal is $9,000.  This amount will supplement the $3,000 CultureWorks Grant that I was awarded for this project in 2017.  Raising an additional $9,000 will fund high-quality design, printing, and publishing of the book, along with shipping costs to get it into the hands of at least 150 museums, curators, and collectors across the country.  Though I believe I will raise $9,000 with your help, I have created a flexible budget for a total project cost (which includes the CultureWorks funds) anywhere between $5,000 and $12,000.  This allows for varying tiers of design and production costs.  On the low end, I will publish with minimal freelance designer help, a mostly self-designed layout, and smaller quantity and lower quality publishing.  On the high end, your total donations will fund full-service layout design, a hardbound book with beautiful paper and high-quality printing, and quantities of 250 to 500 books.  Bottom line, I will be able to create a budget version of my book just by raising funds of $2,000.  Still, I’m shooting for $9,000 and maximum visual and object impact so my work can really shine (and we all love a beautiful hardcover book, right)? 

Here’s an overview of the range of funding needs of the project:

  • Photography and Photo Editing: from $1,800 to $2,500
    • Studio photography of new artwork (2-5 sessions) and installation photography of the following three exhibitions
    • Exhibition #1 (solo): We've Met Before, The North Carolina Museum of Art, Raleigh, NC, September 2017-January 2018
    • Exhibition #2 (solo):  Theorems and Poems, Reynolds Gallery, Richmond, VA, November-December 2017
    • Exhibition #3 (group): Declaration, Institute for Contemporary Art (inaugural exhibition), Richmond, VA, Spring 2018 
  • Commission Fee, Amanda Adams critical essay: $1,600
  • Publishing and Printing: from $1,300 to $6,500
    • Lower cost range, Blurb self-publishing: $1,300 to $2,000
      • 40-page photobook softcover, 25 copies per run of printing @$32.74 per book with 20%+ volume discount, 2-3 initial printing runs (50-75 copies)
    • Professional Publishing (includes varying levels of professional design services): $2,800 to $6,500
      • Lower end of funding: a small softcover book, 250 copies
      • Higher end of funding: a larger hardcover book, 250-500 copies
  • Domestic Shipping Costs: from $180 to $1,080
    • USPS Priority Flat Rate Padded Envelope: 25 to 150 pieces @ $7.20 each

                                                          TOTAL PROJECT COST: $5,000-$12,000                                                                                                             TOTAL FUNDRAISING GOAL: $2,000-$9,000

Perks

I have some beautiful things to give you in exchange for your contribution, but please note that quantities are limited, especially the featured artworks.  Any donation over $75 will receive a signed copy of the book later this year.  I'm not publishing this book for sale or wider distribution, so it's a very special opportunity to get one for yourself!

Don't Need a Perk, Just Want to Help: Thank you! You can contribute simply by clicking the pink button at the very top of my campaign page. 

Perk #1:  A handwritten thank you note on a one-of-a-kind card hand-made by me. 

Perk #2: A sweet little packet of four of my hand-made cards to write your own notes on.  These cards are created from Arches watercolor paper and feature an elegant little swatch of handwoven cloth on the front of the card and my signature on the back. 

Perk #3: Reserve your own copy of my limited-edition monograph, with artist signature. 

Perk #4: Coffee and a studio visit with Andrea.  Get the full tour, see what's on the walls and on the looms, meet Huey the Studio Pooch!

Perk #5:  Twill Color Study Print, 2016, 30” x 24”

Seven-color hand-pulled silk screen on 140lb. French stock.  Signed edition of 25 prints.  Limited to 5 backers.

Perk #6: Artwork from the Cross Pollination Series, 2014, sizes between 8"x10" and 10"x14"

Tiny woven paintings made from weaving, painting, unweaving and reweaving cloth.  They are mounted on archival watercolor paper, titled, signed and dated along the bottom.  Unframed.  Choose your piece from available works in this series (find them on my website, or contact me directly).  Limited to 5 backers.

Perk #7: Your pick from my inventory of award-winning, love-filled, one-of-a-kind, heirloom handwoven scarves.  Browse online or pick one out at the studio.  Limited to 5 backers.

Perk #8:  Flora #3 from the Garden of Forking Paths, 2014, framed, 22" x 29"

Rayon thread, textile pigment.  Woven, painted, unwoven and rewoven.  Framed in a white gallery frame.  Recently on display at the North Carolina Museum of Art.  

Perk #9: Temporal Cartography #2, 2017, 34" x 53", unframed

Handwoven cotton, dye, pigment, PVA, cotton backing.  Recently on display at the North Carolina Museum of Art.  I'm happy to consult about framing.

Other Artwork: I am proud to be represented by Reynolds Gallery in Richmond, VA.  You can visit them in person or online for additional available artwork by me.  All sales and donations, through me or through the gallery, support my career and will help with this book!

We've Met Before at the North Carolina Museum of Art, September 2017-January 2018

The Impact

I identified the opportunity for self-publishing a monograph when I learned that the North Carolina Museum of Art would not be producing a catalog to accompany my recent (and very first of my career) solo museum exhibition there.  Seth Godin reminds me that we are lucky to live in a time where we can choose ourselves, taking our turn instead of waiting to be picked, and that’s why I’m creating this book. 

A thriving art career is sustained by increasing levels of visibility, validation, and vetting of one’s work by relevant institutions; therefore, the value of a relationship/career-building tool like this monograph cannot be overstated.  The essay and interview will reinforce the conceptual depth of my work and its long-term value.  This will help convince more curators, museums, and collectors to invest in my career, and bring my work to a wider audience.  It will be the push I need to gain significant visibility and relevance in the larger art world, beyond my local communities of Richmond and Raleigh (where I am from, and where my family still lives). It will be my entry-point to create high-quality relationships with museums, galleries and institutions on a national level, which will in turn result in a new level of prestige in my exhibition record, and the acquisition of my work by museums and collecting institutions across the country. 

I want to turn my recent successes into a sustaining and positive feedback loop: as the value of my work and its desirability to collecting institutions increases, I will be increasingly able to not only sustain my studio practice but truly support myself with that practice.  My work and my practice are not just my career, they are the way I see and move through the world.  I need to nourish and create opportunities to keep this thing going, because I have something to contribute to the world, and I’m just getting started. 

From a Weaver's Collection of Poems, Pages 1-12, installation at Reynolds Gallery 2017

The Challenge

The challenge I foresee will come into play only if I raise a low amount of funds.  If I raise anywhere between $2,000 and $3,500, I will be in for some serious self-editing and design work.  Though I have published two small books on my own and am comfortable with self-publishing platforms, professional design is ideal.  But I am lucky to live in a supportive, generous community from which I can solicit design advice and feedback even if I’m doing the work myself.  Additionally, at lower levels of funding I will have to make quality and quantity decisions that reflect the reality of my budget and not the perfectionist standards of my artist-weaver heart.  Overall, the challenges of a lower budget are workable and will easily be overcome.  I am very confident in my own design aesthetic and work ethic, and in the professional generosity of my local community, to help me create a beautiful little book that I will be proud to put my name on, at any budget. 

Other Ways You Can Help

My friends (and oh, you lovely and enthusiastic students), I know that not everyone can contribute to my project with a donation.  You can still help me, though!  Please share, share, share with anyone you know (because collectively you know tons more people than I do), who you think might get excited about this obsessive, thoughtful weaver from Richmond, her artwork, and her publishing project.  Oh, and I also appreciate and will accept with gratitude: kind words, cheers, and free advice.  Thank you, thank you, thank you for your help.
story_txt:
A Letter from the Artist
Dear Friends,
This spring I will be taking a moment away from my looms and my artwork to dedicate some time to a very important and different kind of art project, and I hope you will consider helping me with it.  2017/2018 marks a pivotal point in my career, and I wish to capture and capitalize on this moment.  I am creating and publishing a professional and beautiful 40-page monograph including artworks from three recent museum and gallery exhibitions, which will feature a critical essay by Amanda Dalla Villa Adams and an interview with NCMA curator Jen Dasal. 
This book represents who I am and what I think about as an artist, right now.  Publishing and distributing it this year will continue the momentum of my recent success, helping to tell my story in a beautiful, impactful way, and on a national level.  It will be sent to museums, curators, and art departments across the country.  The goal is to build and sustain a thriving career as a professional artist. 
My project is supported in part by a CultureWorks Artist Grant and in-kind by the North Carolina Museum of Art, but I really need your help to make the Andrea Donnelly: Three Exhibitions monograph a reality.  
With deep gratitude,
Andrea

Theorems and Poems at Reynolds Gallery, November-December 2017

What I Need & What You Get
My Indiegogo fundraising goal is $9,000.  This amount will supplement the $3,000 CultureWorks Grant that I was awarded for this project in 2017.  Raising an additional $9,000 will fund high-quality design, printing, and publishing of the book, along with shipping costs to get it into the hands of at least 150 museums, curators, and collectors across the country.  Though I believe I will raise $9,000 with your help, I have created a flexible budget for a total project cost (which includes the CultureWorks funds) anywhere between $5,000 and $12,000.  This allows for varying tiers of design and production costs.  On the low end, I will publish with minimal freelance designer help, a mostly self-designed layout, and smaller quantity and lower quality publishing.  On the high end, your total donations will fund full-service layout design, a hardbound book with beautiful paper and high-quality printing, and quantities of 250 to 500 books.  Bottom line, I will be able to create a budget version of my book just by raising funds of $2,000.  Still, I’m shooting for $9,000 and maximum visual and object impact so my work can really shine (and we all love a beautiful hardcover book, right)? 
Here’s an overview of the range of funding needs of the project:


Photography and Photo Editing: from $1,800 to $2,500
Studio photography of new artwork (2-5 sessions) and installation photography of the following three exhibitions
Exhibition #1 (solo): We've Met Before, The North Carolina Museum of Art, Raleigh, NC, September 2017-January 2018
Exhibition #2 (solo):  Theorems and Poems, Reynolds Gallery, Richmond, VA, November-December 2017
Exhibition #3 (group): Declaration, Institute for Contemporary Art (inaugural exhibition), Richmond, VA, Spring 2018 


Commission Fee, Amanda Adams critical essay: $1,600

Publishing and Printing: from $1,300 to $6,500
Lower cost range, Blurb self-publishing: $1,300 to $2,00040-page photobook softcover, 25 copies per run of printing @$32.74 per book with 20%+ volume discount, 2-3 initial printing runs (50-75 copies)

Professional Publishing (includes varying levels of professional design services): $2,800 to $6,500
Lower end of funding: a small softcover book, 250 copies
Higher end of funding: a larger hardcover book, 250-500 copies





Domestic Shipping Costs: from $180 to $1,080USPS Priority Flat Rate Padded Envelope: 25 to 150 pieces @ $7.20 each


                                                          TOTAL PROJECT COST: $5,000-$12,000                                                                                                             TOTAL FUNDRAISING GOAL: $2,000-$9,000
Perks
I have some beautiful things to give you in exchange for your contribution, but please note that quantities are limited, especially the featured artworks.  Any donation over $75 will receive a signed copy of the book later this year.  I'm not publishing this book for sale or wider distribution, so it's a very special opportunity to get one for yourself!
Don't Need a Perk, Just Want to Help: Thank you! You can contribute simply by clicking the pink button at the very top of my campaign page. 
Perk #1:  A handwritten thank you note on a one-of-a-kind card hand-made by me. 
Perk #2: A sweet little packet of four of my hand-made cards to write your own notes on.  These cards are created from Arches watercolor paper and feature an elegant little swatch of handwoven cloth on the front of the card and my signature on the back. 
Perk #3: Reserve your own copy of my limited-edition monograph, with artist signature. 
Perk #4: Coffee and a studio visit with Andrea.  Get the full tour, see what's on the walls and on the looms, meet Huey the Studio Pooch!
Perk #5:  Twill Color Study Print, 2016, 30” x 24”
Seven-color hand-pulled silk screen on 140lb. French stock.  Signed edition of 25 prints.  Limited to 5 backers.
Perk #6: Artwork from the Cross Pollination Series, 2014, sizes between 8"x10" and 10"x14"
Tiny woven paintings made from weaving, painting, unweaving and reweaving cloth.  They are mounted on archival watercolor paper, titled, signed and dated along the bottom.  Unframed.  Choose your piece from available works in this series (find them on my website, or contact me directly).  Limited to 5 backers.
Perk #7: Your pick from my inventory of award-winning, love-filled, one-of-a-kind, heirloom handwoven scarves.  Browse online or pick one out at the studio.  Limited to 5 backers.
Perk #8:  Flora #3 from the Garden of Forking Paths, 2014, framed, 22" x 29"
Rayon thread, textile pigment.  Woven, painted, unwoven and rewoven.  Framed in a white gallery frame.  Recently on display at the North Carolina Museum of Art.  
Perk #9: Temporal Cartography #2, 2017, 34" x 53", unframed
Handwoven cotton, dye, pigment, PVA, cotton backing.  Recently on display at the North Carolina Museum of Art.  I'm happy to consult about framing.
Other Artwork: I am proud to be represented by Reynolds Gallery in Richmond, VA.  You can visit them in person or online for additional available artwork by me.  All sales and donations, through me or through the gallery, support my career and will help with this book!

story:
HONEYCOMB, is an international collective of young urban contemporary artists who work together to produce exhibitions and projects aimed at the promotion of young contemporary art,cross cultural exchange, and environmental conservation. Through our efforts we try not only to encourage cultural interaction within urban communities but also work to raise funds to help counteract the negative effect the production of contemporary art has on the environment. We hope that through our efforts we can begin the healing process, encourage others to take action through the support of young art and environmental causes, and provide upcoming artists with unique opportunities in which they can continue to grow both professionally and personally.

After a successful first season, we have scheduled Exhibitions and projects though 2012 in New York, Berlin, Buenos Aires and London. 
A rotating international residency program in which young urban artists would have the opportunity to live and work in a foreign city to further develop their skills is also on the agenda as is the desire to initiate an affordable urban art fair in NY during the 2012 season which would present the best of international urban and young contemporary in a fresh way which is entertaining sor the community as well as welcoming and accessible to both seasoned art lovers and young/new collectors. 

As always environmental conservation is on our mind and a portion of all proceeds earned will go to our partner charity wild-again.org to help assist in their reforestation efforts.

If you are looking for a way to support young contemporary artists and want to help contribute to the restoration of our environment, please feel free to give what you can and spread the word. Using the share tools makes it real easy!

Much thanks!

story:
Our Story

Skin City Body Painting is a woman-run cooperative of artists in Las Vegas who create art on the best canvas out there - the human body!  We create our "living art" for photo shoots, magazines, television, theater, trade shows, conventions, promotions, parties and more.  This company provides steady work to 12-15 freelance artists and 20-25 models and circus performers every year, and we are actively involved in the arts scene in Las Vegas, as well as several local charities.  It is owned and operated by fine artist Robin Barcus-Slonina.

After 6 years of operating this business out of suitcases and her garage, Skin City is ready to take the next step and rent a storefront.  The perfect location has been found - right in the heart of the emerging Las Vegas Arts District!  We are taking the plunge big-time to create a multi-use art and photo studio, retail space and artistic gathering spot.  We plan to use the space to sell the work of local artists, grow our body painting business and give back to the community with charity events.


What We Need & What You Get

There are many expenses associated with opening a space including: painting supplies, ladders, scaffolding, cement floor repairs, furnishings and equipment, signage, a cash register and safe, fire extinguishers, disability bathroom updates, security system, telephone, and of course purchasing merchandise!

We are looking to raise $3000 here, but we would LOVE to go over our goal and every penny will be well-spent!  Realistically this venture will cost at least $15,000 to get started, but we will pace ourselves with whatever funds we raise.  No matter how much we raise here, our doors are officially opening for the Las Vegas First Friday Arts Festival on August 5, 2011!

THE BEST THING ABOUT INDIE GO GO IS WE ARE NOT JUST ASKING FOR HAND-OUTS!  YOU WILL RECEIVE GIFTS FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS!  We are giving away something for every donation, even just $5!  Unique Skin City merchandise includes magnets, t-shirts, paintings and photographs as well as body painting sessions for those in Las Vegas!  Check out all our perks and enjoy this win-win form of fund-raising.  (Shipping is free within the continental USA, international shipping rates will apply for supporters out of the country!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribute whatever you can, then PLEASE SHARE THIS LINK WITH EVERYONE YOU KNOW!  We are so excited to take the next step in this artistic adventure and we couldn't do it without your support!

story:
Our story

Florian Afflerbach (1980-2016) was a remarkable person and sketcher. His self-chosen job was to revive the art of freehand drawing, most notably for students of architecture, because „the spontaneous and intuitive freehand drawing is capable of authenticating the designer’s idea on paper.“ He coined the sentence: „You can only see well with a pencil“.

Florian was a trained architect and teacher, assistant professor of the Department of Spatial Design and Design at the University of Siegen, as well as assistant professor of the Department Architecture at the University of Dortmund. He was an author, urban sketcher, car enthusiast, urbanist and so much more.

He was torn out of his life too early with just 35 years. Please help us to make his artistic heritage unforgettable!

 

The book

With your help and support we will create an extraordinary book about a very special person and sketcher - a cross-section from the more than 2,000 sketches and drawings that Florian made throughout his career. We will produce it in landscape format as a high-quality hard cover book sized DIN A4.

The book reflects many different facets of his art of sketching: drawings showing urban images and buildings, special vehicles and classic cars, fleeting ideas, scenes from daily life, designs for contests, and even the beginnings of his creative expression as a small boy.

Florian shows us his world using pen and watercolor brush. Incredibly fine and skillful. From dramatic perspectives. Sometimes reduced to the essentials, sometimes full of wonderful details.   

Florian's companions - from architecture, from universities, from sketching trips and workshops - have already agreed to contribute and will have the opportunity to speak. These texts will be published in German and English.

We want to publish a high-quality book with a first print run of 500 copies. As a backer of this campaign you will help us to bring our idea to life and thus get the book for the special price of 40 €. Later on the book will be available in stores for a higher price.

Once this crowdfunding campaign ends we will conclude the choice of drawings and text contributions, start lay-outing the book and launch the preparations for the print shop. Our goal is to send you the finished book early in 2018.

Note: The final layout of the book may differ from this mock-up

 

The book with add-ons

In addition to the book, you have the opportunity to purchase a set of postcards with drawings by Florian or a print of his „Siegen“ drawing, which he exhibited for the first time in December 2014 at the „Siegener Kunstwechsel“.

In more than 200 hours, Florian achieved the impossible: he drew the Siegen city center in a bird perspective (you can view his short time-lapse video here on vimeo). He did not rent a hot air ballon or used a drone. He worked with innumerable photographs taken on long walks through the city, aerial photographs, an old model and city map. „Building after building, I created the city of Siegen as a single drawing: Upper town, lower town, the castles, the church called „Krönchen““, he explained on the occasion of the exhibition. The numbered and signed prints are made from high-quality, age-resistant, UV-protected handmade paper in the format 60x30 cm. 

 

About Florian Afflerbach

Florian studied architecture at the University of Siegen. He went to Paris for one term, where his passion for drawing awakened in him. From this time on he was constantly on the move with his sketchbook and pencils both in his daily life and during his various trips to Sao Paolo, New York and Venice.    

After his degree course he was first employed as an architect in Stuttgart. Although he won prizes with many of his designs, he craved for more: He went to Cottbus to study architectural communication and interpretation. 

What occupied him most was the revival of the art of drawing especially for the master of architecture course. He viewed himself as a procurer of architecture. This is why he decided to teach drawing at university.

For Florian, drawing was “the best way to fully grasp a building”. He added: “When I draw, I walk around it, look at each side, go inside, if possible, and choose the best perspective in order to understand it well.”

Since 2013 he was an assistant professor of the Department of Spatial Design and Design at the University of Siegen, as well as assistant professor of the Department Architecture at the Technical University of Dortmund. 
 
In 2013 Florian explained during an interview with the magazine “Baunetzwoche”: “I only draw what fascinates me. This is why an overview of my drawings is a perfect reflection of myself." 

In 2012, he had already co-founded the publishing house “Schaff-Verlag” (schaff-verlag.de) for “communication of architecture”, in which his drawings from Stuttgart, Frankfurt, Berlin and especially from Hamburg are published. You can find these drawings among many others in our book "Florian Afflerbach - Der Zeichner", which his partner Dr. Jörg Schilling will publish as well.

Many know Florian as a committed urban sketcher. He was one of those who helped set up the German urban sketching community in Stuttgart, Cottbus, Berlin, Munich and Siegen. 

Some of you might know Florian as “Flaf”, others as the “car guy”, because he had an exceptional talent for drawing vehicles. Once he said: “When looking at vehicles you can learn a lot about designs and proportions. They dominate urban images just like architecture itself.”

Florian loved sharing his skills, for instance at international sketching workshops in Lisbon, Barcelona or Malaga. 

This is what we would like to take up, this is why we want to publish this book.

 

Who we are

Florian’s family and friends stand behind the idea for this project, the crowdfunding campaign as well as the publication of the book:

Tina Jacke
Heinrich Afflerbach
Katharina Afflerbach
Claudius Afflerbach
Arno Hartmann
Jutta Drewes
Dr. Jörg Schilling

 

Useful links

If you want to follow-up on Florian’s work, these websites provide you with more information.

  • Florian’s own website: flaf.de
  • Florian’s drawings on flickr
  • Florian’s contribution to the Urban Sketchers community
  • schaff-Verlag (schaff publishing house): schaff-verlag.de 

 

Credits

  • Music: Composed and played by Rainer Seyda

He viewed himself as a procurer of architecture. This is why he decided to teach drawing at university.For Florian, drawing was “the best way to fully grasp a building”. This is why an overview of my drawings is a perfect reflection of myself." In 2012, he had already co-founded the publishing house “Schaff-Verlag” (schaff-verlag.de) for “communication of architecture”, in which his drawings from Stuttgart, Frankfurt, Berlin and especially from Hamburg are published. You can find these drawings among many others in our book "Florian Afflerbach - Der Zeichner", which his partner Dr. Jörg Schilling will publish as well.Many know Florian as a committed urban sketcher. He was one of those who helped set up the German urban sketching community in Stuttgart, Cottbus, Berlin, Munich and Siegen. Some of you might know Florian as “Flaf”, others as the “car guy”, because he had an exceptional talent for drawing vehicles. Once he said: “When looking at vehicles you can learn a lot about designs and proportions. They dominate urban images just like architecture itself.”Florian loved sharing his skills, for instance at international sketching workshops in Lisbon, Barcelona or Malaga. This is what we would like to take up, this is why we want to publish this book. Who we areFlorian’s family and friends stand behind the idea for this project, the crowdfunding campaign as well as the publication of the book:Tina JackeHeinrich AfflerbachKatharina AfflerbachClaudius AfflerbachArno HartmannJutta DrewesDr. Jörg Schilling Useful linksIf you want to follow-up on Florian’s work, these websites provide you with more information.
Florian’s own website: flaf.de

Florian’s drawings on flickr

Florian’s contribution to the Urban Sketchers community

schaff-Verlag (schaff publishing house): schaff-verlag.de 
 CreditsMusic: Composed and played by Rainer Seyda

story:
josue vasquez my name, I live in carabayllo in peru, in a village far from the city, a place where life is sometimes difficult because there are no jobs in this city.

I in my 21 years and with so many hopes and dreams that I have, I wish that things were so different here, want to live in peace and harmony with myself without going hungry sometimes and sometimes misery.

Currently live with my parents, we help each other, I have dreams want to have a business and help it succeed.

But things are not easy in this town, fortunately I have a small little piano I use it as a consolation and sometimes as a refuge for such lack, since I am a musician and I like to compose music for myself, makes me very well when presented difficult things, I have many dreams want to be in a better economic position, and also want to dedicate to the music as it is always my passion, and is the only thing that came to me in these difficult days




http://www.jamendo.com/es/list/a130043/detras-del-espejo

story:
Art-Reach enriches lives by connecting underserved audiences with cultural experiences so that they may enjoy and benefit from the transformative powers of the arts. 

We believe the arts are for everyone: CUE Art Connection Philadelphia.


WHAT IS ART CONNECTION PHILADELPHIA?

Art Connection enriches and empowers underserved communities by increasing access to original works of visual art. The program places original artwork from local artists in human service agencies throughout our region.  

Last year, Art-Reach worked with participants at local schools and human-service agencies who selected and received original, custom-framed pieces from a collection of artwork (generously donated by 10 artists via InLiquid, a virtual hub for visual arts in Philadelphia), to be showcased on the walls of their campuses. In our first year of the program, we placed upwards of 20 pieces among 5 facilities.

This year, we're setting the bar even higher. Our members will be arts patrons, informed curators, enlightened commissioners and active creators. Art-Reach members all over the region are excited, we’re already connecting with amazing artists, and we’re going for it. Are you coming with us?

 

WHO IS ART-REACH?

”Art-Reach allows me to expose an underserved population to the arts, letting them know that they have self worth and seeing their faces light up when experiencing these events, performances or visiting the museums is priceless and fulfilling for me."

-Art-Reach member working with individuals with cognitive disabilities

In a nutshell, we distribute deeply discounted tickets (often $1) to local live arts performances and museums to organizations that serve people who have disabilities and/or economic disadvantages, and bring creative, interactive workshops to them if they are unable to travel around the city. Art-Reach serves at-risk youth through mentorship with local teaching artists, subsidizes outings for low-income families to play and create together, brings music and dance to the elderly in need, and complements therapy for individuals with physical or cognitive disabilities through interactive art-making. 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

Art-Reach is committed to offering high quality programs while supporting artists and making sure the member agencies have low or no costs so that participation is as wide as possible. Luckily, we have received generous funding to get us started, but we are calling on you, our friends and supporters, new and old, near and far, to help us match that funding in order for this program to be carried out to its fullest potential.

Each level of giving represents a key element in making this abstract project a successful masterpiece. All funds raised will directly benefit Art Connection Philadelphia, and we fully intend to thank you for contributing the best way we know how: with prizes. Check out the different levels and choose the one that feels right to you.

Perhaps most importantly, we’re throwing a party!

Art Connection Celebration
Fleisher Art Memorial, 719 Catherine St, South Philadelphia
April 18th 6pm-8pm
The $25 giving level gets you in the door

It will be a great celebration of the artistic experiences we facilitate, and those who make them possible. We would love to see you there.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Art-Reach and our many programs are only successful because of supporters like you. We're a small organization, one that stretches a dollar as far as we can, and recognizes it as so much more than one hundred cents. If fiscally donating is not an option at this time have no fear, there are many ways to get involved with Art-Reach and Art Connection Philadelphia:

  • Spread the word! Nearly everyone we know knows of a group that could enroll as a member and benefit from our programs. If you know of a group like this, send them our way!
  • Contribute a piece of work to Art-Connection! Our art bank is full of work from artists of all ages, abilities, mediums and locations. If you have a piece in your portfolio or collection that you would like to contribute please contact us at info@art-reach.org
  • Become an Art-Reach Ambassador! Our volunteers are a direct extension of our staff, serving in and out of the office, to ensure the highest of service standards for our members and partners. We have multiple Ambassador and intern tracks, all of which are outlined at http://www.art-reach.org/ARR_Vol.html

 

 Photos used with permission of Ashley Smith, Wide Eyed Studios

story:
YOGA and MEN. Portraits & Interviews.

"Inside the Warrior" is a project meant to highlight and celebrate men who practice yoga. It is meant to change our perception of who should practice yoga and who does practice yoga.

We aim to put a spotlight on the participants of yoga that are most under represented by illustrating both the physical and the spiritual components of a yoga practice with portraits in addition to interviews, excerpts, and personal perspectives.

Julian DeVoe, writer, yoga teacher and advocate for joyful evolution is inspired by male yogis and wants to understand the minority he is a part of.  The questions are meant to evoke a deeper conversation.  They are meant to inspire, probe and inquire into the male yogi psyche.  This conversation is aimed at bringing voice to the masculine side of the practice and to usher in a yogic perspective for the society we live in.  Do we have something to learn from these men?  Let’s hear what they have to say.  

According to polls, only 20% of the people who practice yoga are men. That is slowly starting to change as more men realize the benefits and embrace yoga as more than a workout of stretching and breathing. As we already know, yoga creates a strong, toned, and flexible body. For many others, it is so much more than just the physical component and can be a path to spiritual growth and/or emotional healing.



The inspiration for "Inside the Warrior"

Amy Goalen, photographer, artist, and yogi, is fascinated with creating portraits that illustrate the transformative power of yoga. After photographing 2 of her yoga teachers last year she quickly realized that she wanted to photograph more than just the pose. She wanted to photograph the person within the pose and reveal the soul of a yogi. At first, it was about getting beyond the masks that we all wear. But as she began to work with more yoga men she started to see something different.

In addition to strength, flexibility, and athleticism there is depth of heart, sensitivity, courage, integrity, and a self awareness that comes through in these portraits. It is quite powerful and it has fueled Amy's passion for continuing the series and focusing it on yogi men.

There is a perception in our western culture that yoga is for women and hyper spiritual people. We aim to show that is categorically untrue. Men all over the world, in all walks of life, at all ages practice and reap the benefits of yoga.


What We Need & What You Get

Our initial goal is to raise $20,000. Over the next 12 months we will use the funds to travel and produce "Inside the Warrior" and a gallery exhibition to launch the release of the book. 

Amy has already been photographing yogis all over Southern California and Austin, TX. In order to photograph a more representative sampling of yoga men she needs to travel to different cities and locations throughout the US (and select cities internationally). The majority of the money raised from this campaign will be travel expenses for portrait sessions. Some equipment is needed for travel and location work such as a laptop and external hard drives for image storage. 

Cities Amy will be visiting for portraits (more cities may be added)

  • New York City, NY
  • Philadelphia, PA
  • Trenton, NJ
  • Charlotte, NC
  • Miami, FL
  • San Francisco, CA
*International cities are being considered if we have the funding and the interest. So far London, England and Manila, Philippines are possibilities. 

In addition to travel and equipment costs, funds will be used to produce the physical book, exhibition prints and promotional material to sell the book once it's completed. 

As a contributor you can receive:

  • Signed Set of 5 postcards from "Inside the Warrior"
  • Signed First Editions of the book
  • 11x14 Prints
  • Posters
  • Private Portrait Sessions 

We want this book to be something that is educational, inspiring, and revealing about men who practice yoga. We want "Inside the Warrior" to be something that is representative of the yoga community so getting to interview and photograph as many different men as possible will allow us to create a book that will speak to all men.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to make a monetary contribution please share this campaign on your Facebook page, Twitter, Pinterest, and Instagram pages. 

Help us reach as many people as we can about our project! You can use the Share tools right here on the Indiegogo campaign to help us get the word out.

Also, if you are interested in participating by being photographed by Amy or being interviewed by Julian please contact us at amygoalenphoto@gmail.com or devoe.julian@gmail.com. We would love to hear from you.

THANK YOU so much for reading, contributing, sharing, and just being interested in our project "Inside the Warrior". 

Most Graciously,

Amy & Julian

story:
The Plan

Hers the plan. I'm going to pack up my screen printing gear and cameras and hit the road. I'll head north first, to Chico, to make a zine from start to finish in under 24 hours.

Then I'll head south and towards the coast. I'll be campng in a couple different spots along the coast, with my final destination being Big Sur.

Somewhere along the way I'll figure out how to make screen printing on the road work. this is the main challenge, but I believe I'll be able to do it. Once that is figured out I will print a multi color postcard and mail them from the nearest post office.

I also plan to have a camera attached to my hand all the time, and use that camera to take a whole lot of photos. 

What I need and What you get

The trip is happening between February 16th and the 22nd. 

I have the screen printing equipment and the cameras.

All I have left to do is stock up on film, and get some ink for screen printing.

When I get back I'll have a bunch of film to develop, prints to make,

frames to buy and zines to print.

In return youwill  get some fun postcards, t-shirts and photographs.

 

The Impact

Your contributions really meant he world to me. This is sort of a test for what is my ultimate goal of a total mobile screen printing vehicle that I can take across country.  Helping me out for this short trip will prove that this idea isnt just me being totally delusional.

 

If you can't help out, that's a-ok.

It would still be a real big help if you could get the word out. Share to your favorite social media sites and tell your friends, someone out there might be interested.

Thanks Bye!

story:
About the project


Two years ago, I had a plush design picked up and produced by indie art toy Producer, PatchTogether. While very popular it was also made in a very limited number and sold out the same weekend it was open for general sales. From that point onward one of the most common questions I was asked online, and in person at conventions was 'Are they going to make any more Skulldogs?'. When I found that PT was no longer doing any plush toy production runs, I started to look for other options.

It took me a year to finally find a new company to have a small order of plush toys made. So here we are, the plush will be in production as this project is funded. The goal here is set to cover about half of the cost to start this up, plus fund the bonus items being sent.

Plus, allow for those that missed out on the original toy a chance to own a plush Skulldog finally.

About Skulldog

I've been using a teal, skull faced Bull Terrier as a mascot to represent my online artistic presence since 1998, a design that encompasses both the silly fun side of my art, along with the more creepy stuff.


About the Plush

Hot dang, this is why you're here. Photos do more justice than written stuff.
About 7 tall, about 4 wide, the perfect size fora desk, shelf or dash.
The photos show the prototype sample already made, the finals sent out to supporters will be created based on that template. You can take a peek at the full turn around here.
 
 ETA on plush arrival to funders: End of November!

About the SWAG

I made you some swag for supporting this project! These are all exclusive to the fund drive, and won't be for sale outside of it.
  • Check that button, it glows! Buttons are 1 inch sized, or about the same shape of a US Quarter. While the whole button does glow, the skull will show the most prominent in the dark. Given a good 30 minute light boost, I've gotten these to last up to 2 hours in glowing.
  • See that sticker? That's waterproof and rated for up to 2 years of outdoor use in standard weather. I can't promise it will survive a hurricane, but if it doesn't, it's also printed with Earth friendly non toxic inks. It's 4 inches all around.
  • How about some original art? You got it!
  • 'Art Adopter' level gets you a pre-made Skulldog mini painting. It's done in watercolor and various pencils. Each is unique and one of a kind.
  • 'All the things' Levels gets you a custom mini painting, you get to pick! Either I will turn your character into a Skulldog, based on provided reference, or written description. OR You can provide some short prompt words for me to create a new Skulldog from. These will be done in watercolor and various pencils.

About some extras if we go over the goal

We'll see how high this goes, I have some extra button ideas ready to send to print, and potentially turn the sticker into a die-cut, or increase the size.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Use the provided media site quick links. OR post a journal to note to just about anywhere else you can.

 

 

Thanks for all the continued support and throwing of money at computer screens. I wouldn't be running this if I wasn't so consistently pestered about Skulldog themed thingies.

story:
(Per la versione in Italiano scorrete in basso)

THE STORY BEHIND A STARVING ARTIST

Hello! My name is Simona. I'm an Italian Indie Doodle Artist.

Some years ago I had an unexpected surgery because of a serious Endometriosis issue (had another one last February). After that I developed an interest in doodling and drawing, something I had never been seriously interested in before. I found out that by drawing I could fight against the demons of Depression and Chronic Pain and let my thoughts flow free. Zendoodling has become a huge part of my life during these years, my skills have improved very much and I have also sold some artworks. I cannot figure a day without drawing.
But this year it could be very difficult for me to keep up with it...

In 2013 my hubby and I lost our jobs. The crisis has been hard in Italy, and (for the Italian standards) we both are too old for finding a regular job but, at the same time, too young for retirement. Moreover, I am the only one receiving a social check, and this is going to end in July.

And here is the STARVING ARTIST. With a starving hubby and 4 starving cats!

In order to live though this situation I need to find enough funds to be able to purchase art supplies and produce items for fairs and online shop (prints, postcards, totebags etc.).

So I wonderd if you could help me reach my goal and help me draw and my kitties have their daily kitty-food. :)

The most important things in my life - together with my drawings - are family and make people smile. What I would like to do if I reached more than my funding goal is helping my sister's NGO Organization, called GNU SOLIDARIO (http://www.gnusolidario.org). They provide GNU HEALTH, a free medical system for the underprivileged. Being able to create a small business with my art will let me help it with donations.

Of course, I will be VERY GRATEFUL to all of the friends who agree to help me. I'll thank you with my ARTWORKS based on my series SECRET GARDEN and OWLS!

If you cannot afford sending money, you can STILL HELP by PROMOTING this campaign in your blogs and websites, or by using the IndieGoGo "share" buttons. I will appreciate it very much! :)

Thank you in advance for you help! I will update this funding campaign constantly, so check out this page often!

*********

LA STORIA DI UN'ARTISTA AFFAMATA

Ciao a tutti! Mi chiamo Simona e sono un'Artista Indipendente Italiana.

Alcuni anni fa ho subito un'intervento d'urgenza a causa di una malattia insidiosa chiamata Endometriosi (e ne ho subito un altro questo febbraio). Dopo l'intervento ho sviluppato una forte attrazione verso il Doodling (scarabocchio) e il disegno, cose che non avevo mai affrontato seriamente prima. Ho scoperto che disegnando sono in grado di tenere a bada i demoni della Depressione e i Dolori Cronici e di lasciare che la i miei pensieri scorrano liberi.
Negli anni lo zendoodling (scarabocchio Zen) è diventato ben presto un compagno di vita. La mia abilità è migliorata e sono anche riuscita a vendere alcuni dei miei pezzi. Ormai non posso più immaginare di passare un giorno senza disegnare! :)
Ma il 2014 mi sta davvero mettendo alla prova...

Nel 2013 sia io che mio marito abbiamo perso il lavoro. La crisi è dura in Italia. Stando alle offerte di lavoro, siamo troppo vecchi per trovare un impiego regolare e troppo giovani per la pensione. Inoltre, io sono l'unica a ricevere l'assegno di disoccupazione. E anche questo finirà a Luglio, se non trovo qualcosa prima.

Ed ecco spiegato il perchè dell'ARTISTA AFFAMATA. Con un marito affamato e 4 gatti famelici!

Per poter far fronte a questa situazione, mi trovo nella necessità di cercare fondi per acquistare i prodotti artistici, pagare le bollette dell'ADSL (per la vendita online) e produrre pezzi per le fiere e il negozio online (stampe, cartoline, borse ecc.).

Mi chiedevo, quindi, se foste interessati a darmi una mano a raggiungere il mio obiettivo e aiutare i miei cuccioli ad avere la loro pappa. :)

A parte il disegno, le altre cose importanti della mia vita sono la famiglia e far sorridere le persone. Ciò che vorrei fare se dovessi raggiungere e superare il funding, è aiutare l'organizzazione non governativa di mia sorella. Si chiama GNU SOLIDARIO (http://www.gnusolidario.org). Hanno sviluppato GNU HEALTH, uno strumento medico gratuito per aiutare i non privilegiati. (C'è anche la versione italiana).
Se fossi in grado di avere un piccolo business incentrato sui miei lavori, potrei dare una mano con delle donazioni.

Naturalmente sarò DAVVERO GRATA a tutti coloro che vorranno supportarmi! Vi ringrazierò con la mia ARTE basata sulle mie serie GIARDINO SEGRETO e GUFI. Ogni pezzo sarà diverso. (nella colonna di destra troverete ciò che offro con la descrizione anche in Italiano).

Se non potete permettervi di inviare denaro, non c'è problema: potrete contribuire PROMUOVENDO questa campagna sul vostro blog o sito web. Oppure usando i bottoni di condivisione di IndieGoGo. Lo apprezzerò molto! :)

Vi ringrazio fin d'ora per il vostro aiuto. Farò costanti aggiornamenti, quindi tornate a trovarmi qui!
story_txt: (Per la versione in Italiano scorrete in basso)THE STORY BEHIND A STARVING ARTISTHello! My name is Simona. I'm an Italian Indie Doodle Artist.Some years ago I had an unexpected surgery because of a serious Endometriosis issue (had another one last February). After that I developed an interest in doodling and drawing, something I had never been seriously interested in before. I found out that by drawing I could fight against the demons of Depression and Chronic Pain and let my thoughts flow free. Zendoodling has become a huge part of my life during these years, my skills have improved very much and I have also sold some artworks. I cannot figure a day without drawing. But this year it could be very difficult for me to keep up with it...In 2013 my hubby and I lost our jobs. The crisis has been hard in Italy, and (for the Italian standards) we both are too old for finding a regular job but, at the same time, too young for retirement. Moreover, I am the only one receiving a social check, and this is going to end in July.And here is the STARVING ARTIST. With a starving hubby and 4 starving cats!In order to live though this situation I need to find enough funds to be able to purchase art supplies and produce items for fairs and online shop (prints, postcards, totebags etc.).So I wonderd if you could help me reach my goal and help me draw and my kitties have their daily kitty-food. :)The most important things in my life - together with my drawings - are family and make people smile. What I would like to do if I reached more than my funding goal is helping my sister's NGO Organization, called GNU SOLIDARIO (http://www.gnusolidario.org). They provide GNU HEALTH, a free medical system for the underprivileged. Being able to create a small business with my art will let me help it with donations.Of course, I will be VERY GRATEFUL to all of the friends who agree to help me. I'll thank you with my ARTWORKS based on my series SECRET GARDEN and OWLS! If you cannot afford sending money, you can STILL HELP by PROMOTING this campaign in your blogs and websites, or by using the IndieGoGo "share" buttons. I will appreciate it very much! :)Thank you in advance for you help! story:
Short Summary

I am Jamie Hindley CFD.  I own a small, local floral studio in Ferndale CA called Passion Flowers.  Since I entered the floral design world, I have jumped in with both feet.  I attend floral design programs all over the US several times a year so that I can be on top of current design trends, new products, and the best floral mechanics.  Last year I pushed myself even further and reached the highest attainable goal in the floral design world- I passed the American Institute of Floral Designers test and will be inducted this summer. I am the only designer from Humboldt County to do so.  I am one of about 60 designers from California.   I continue to jump in with both feet when it comes to new projects. 

I was given the opportunity to be involved in PAFA in Bloom at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts by interpreting my own assigned piece of artwork.  I couldn't pass it up.  My first thought was that it would be great to use all California flowers in my design since I am one of only 2 designers from California that was chosen.  I support the California Grown movement as much as possible.  Since I will be across the country, I thought it would be a great place to showcase their flowers.  I chose art from George Inness titled "Woodland Scene" to interpret. It is an oil painting featuring lots of dark, rich colors.  It will be a 3-D design featuring all California Grown Flowers.     

I am looking for funding to help me get myself, and my products to Philadelphia.  Not only do I have to send myself back there for about 6 days, but I must also ship my product.  The money raised will go towards supplies such as: containers, foam, tools, adhesives, construction items for my project, and any flowers I may need.  It will also be used for shipment costs for my items from California to Philadelphia.  Anything above those costs will go towards my travel costs, and the fundraiser reception ticket.  I anticipate I will need about $3500 to complete this creative opportunity.  

I have a few different perks for people that donate to this exciting event.  I will have photos taken of the completed piece along with photos with the original artwork.  They will be made into blank greeting cards and photo prints.  The photo would be a great conversation piece in your place of business.  Also available, in minimal quantities, will be flowers for a year, a prom package, and a unique floral artwork of your own.  

Please follow my journey on my facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/PassionFlowersbyJamieH... I will keep everyone updated with photos along the way.  I am really excited for this next step in my career.

story:
J'ai été invitée il y a à peine un mois à effectuer un stage (une chance exceptionnelle) auprès d'un imminent violoniste brésilien, Ricardo Herz, au Brésil au mois d'avril.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k_17BNX4y2Y

J'ai fait tout ce que j’ai pu pour réunir les sommes d'argent requises pour ce projet le plus rapidement possible, mais les délais concernant les demandes de bourse étaient déjà échus. Mes efforts m'ont tout de même permis d'amasser le deux tiers de la somme requise pour mon stage - j'ai réussi à cumuler 2500$ en allant chercher des commandites d'organismes privés et en jouant dans le métro, mais il me reste tout de même 1500$ à amasser et cela, en moins de deux mois!

Pour tous ceux qui me connaissent (pour ceux qui ne me connaissent pas, je vous invite à parcourir la brève description de mon parcours présentée ci-dessous), vous savez à quel point je suis engagée autant dans mes études et mes projets personnels que dans la communauté et auprès de vous. Aujourd'hui, c'est moi qui ai besoin de votre aide.

Je fais appel à votre grande générosité. Vous ne pouvez imaginer à quel point ce projet m'est cher et toute contribution (peu importe le montant) est la bienvenue. Votre aide me permettra, dans un premier temps, de mener à terme ce merveilleux projet et dans un deuxième temps, de me rapprocher petit à petit du grand rêve de me réaliser en tant que musicienne éclectique et accomplie.

Sans le sens de la communauté et l'esprit d'entraide, j'ai la fervente conviction que le potentiel créatif humain ne peut survivre dans une société individualiste où le progrès économique et l'avancement des connaissances scientifiques ont préséance et où les arts et la culture sont relayées au dernier rang et brimés dans leur expression fondamentale. Aidez-moi et contribuez à l'émancipation des arts et de la culture et à l'éveil d'une communauté effervescente et fourmillant de talents et de potentiel. Encouragez la créativité, le dépassement de soi et la coopération internationale.

Et moi, je vous dis merci.

Partagez SVP!!

Qui suis-je? Pour ceux qui ne me connaissent pas...

Je me nomme Sarah-Judith Hinse-Paré et je poursuis présentement mes études en interprétation du violon populaire à l’Université du Québec à Montréal. Depuis mon plus jeune âge, mon rêve est de jouer de la musique dans un spectacle d’envergure et plus précisément pour le Cirque du soleil, c'est pourquoi j’ai commencé le violon classique à 7 ans. J’ai poursuivi des études secondaires et collégiales au Conservatoire de musique du Québec. J’ai participé à de nombreux stages de perfectionnement  au Camp musical des Laurentides et au Domaine Forget, au Centre d'art d'Orford.  Je me suis produite en concert avec l’Orchestre de la francophonie et l’Orchestre symphonique de Gatineau. J’ai également été invitée à jouer avec l’ensemble Thirteen Strings d’Ottawa et l’Orchestre réseau des conservatoires.  J'ai participé bénévolement à  l'Orchestre philharmonique des musiciens étudiants de Montréal et à l'Orchestre contre la hausse des droits de scolarité.

J’ai entrepris des études musicales dans un programme de musique pop/jazz afin de diversifier mon style d'interprétation et plus spécifiquement afin de mieux maîtriser les techniques d’improvisation et pour me permettre de développer tous les outils nécessaires à la réalisation de mon rêve, soit de jouer pour le Cirque du soleil.
