story:
Short Summary

Everyone wants a portrait of themselves.  What I am excited to create is tangible images to reflect personality, the part of a person we don't get to see right away.  I capture the vivacious light and brightness that we contain within ourselves, that vision that we have of ourselves, a portrait of the soul and a message of love and hope.  Who are you?  What outlook do you want to offer to the world?

I found this online class on intuitive painting called Bloom True by Flora Bowley.  This beautiful promo video helps to explain this class.  None of the art is mine.  

 

I have signed up and will be taking this class Feb 10-Mar 15.  I was drawn to the message about intuitive painting, the techniques, and of course, the amazing colors.  I have a lot of the supplies and to help fund what I need I am offering a rare opportunity for you to own amazingly affordable art that helps you express what you are all about.  I invite you on this unique journey and offer you a piece of it as I explore myself and my painting style.  Please check out my website as an indication of the creative place I'll be starting from.   

If you are a playful risk taker that loves self-expression, being inspired, if you're looking to show off the beauty this world has to offer, if your personality can not be contained with mere words and metaphors, if you are looking for a way to portray yourself/your message to others I have art that reflects this.  I can also make a one-of-a-kind painting to your specific voice and needs, that colorful and free person that you are.     


What I Need & What You Get

Just a quick itemization of expenses:  The class itself costs $130, I have supplies, but I still want to buy some fun colors and shimmery paints. I'm hoping to invest in the best paints, Golden Acrylics.  Prices for 4 oz of paint range from $7-$22.   Making prints available from this project costs $50 an image plus the cost of printing.  Finally, the investment of a good scanner would save me the cost of capturing images of smaller art.  I've been recommended the Mustek A3 1200S, used by several artists and only $180. 

  • Do you revel in the journey, embrace first, adventure, new beginnings, blooming possibilities?  My exploration, experimentation, creativity, reflective approach, layers of learning and color, and technique, are going to be encapsulated on one giant canvas as I go through this guided journey.  It's the first full painting using the intuitive techniques that I learn and I'm offering it up to someone that reflects this message.  There will not be another one like this.  This is the trailblazer.   
  • I will also be making smaller excursions on 10x10 boards in regards to this new style taking shape.  Are you ready to be surprised with oodles of color and juicy brightness?  Meet the one that makes your heart sing.  You can also personalize your very own painting with input on color and subject matter.
  • If you have your own dream that you would like to see made into a painting I am offering a 16x20 watercolor commission in my traditional visionary style.  Every surreal vision painting is a unique journey that a client and I take together.  Whatever you have to offer, whatever you want to express I can help you make it come alive.  The sources of inspiration are limitless, the painting that you help navigate will be unique to you and what you want to express.   
  • I have affordable prints to choose from at a range of different prices and sizes. Shipping is included for everything.   You can still have a piece of art that represents your shining self.  
Choose an images starting with the letter "D" as one of your 8x10 rewards ($18).  Choose an image starting with the letter "G" as one of the 11x14 giclee print reward ($35).


Above is an example of one of my vision paintings.  This print is available as an award at the $35 level.  Be sure to ask for "Sophia's Garden." Or buy the original unframed watercolor for yourself.  

The Impact

This adventure is a chance for me to share my art and continue to follow the fun.  I hope you can join me.  I want to offer more color filled art, inspire more people, improve my skills, bring more color into the world, gain confidence, share how wonderful life is, and I want you to have an outlet to express yourself more fully.   While we share this message and embrace being open to creativity you are helping me continue to do what I am most passionate about.  

I would love for you to be part of this experience.  I am most inspired to paint knowing that it is shared with others.  Also, this class is something you can take while spaces are available.  Maybe you will join me!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to participate financially you have still read this far, that means you have been with me on this part of my journey and I am so grateful.   I would greatly appreciate it if you would choose 3 people to tell about this campaign.  We're all in this together.  

  • Stop by and like my Facebook page and leave a comment. I would love to hear from you and I'll be posting updates as I go through this class.  
  •  Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • use hashtag #colorfuljourney to spread the word and follow posts.  Upload pictures of your own colorful journey

Express yourself, love life, see beauty, listen to your inner-knowing.

Thank you so much for your positive thoughts and support.

I'm hoping to invest in the best paints, Golden Acrylics.  Prices for 4 oz of paint range from $7-$22.   Making prints available from this project costs $50 an image plus the cost of printing.  Finally, the investment of a good scanner would save me the cost of capturing images of smaller art.  I've been recommended the Mustek A3 1200S, used by several artists and only $180. 
Do you revel in the journey, embrace first, adventure, new beginnings, blooming possibilities?  My exploration, experimentation, creativity, reflective approach, layers of learning and color, and technique, are going to be encapsulated on one giant canvas as I go through this guided journey.  It's the first full painting using the intuitive techniques that I learn and I'm offering it up to someone that reflects this message.  There will not be another one like this.  This is the trailblazer.   
I will also be making smaller excursions on 10x10 boards in regards to this new style taking shape.  Are you ready to be surprised with oodles of color and juicy brightness?  Meet the one that makes your heart sing.  You can also personalize your very own painting with input on color and subject matter.
If you have your own dream that you would like to see made into a painting I am offering a 16x20 watercolor commission in my traditional visionary style.  Every surreal vision painting is a unique journey that a client and I take together.  Whatever you have to offer, whatever you want to express I can help you make it come alive.  The sources of inspiration are limitless, the painting that you help navigate will be unique to you and what you want to express.   
I have affordable prints to choose from at a range of different prices and sizes. Shipping is included for everything.   You can still have a piece of art that represents your shining self.  

Choose an images starting with the letter "D" as one of your 8x10 rewards ($18).  Choose an image starting with the letter "G" as one of the 11x14 giclee print reward ($35).



Above is an example of one of my vision paintings.  This print is available as an award at the $35 level.  Be sure to ask for "Sophia's Garden." Or buy the original unframed watercolor for yourself.  The ImpactThis adventure is a chance for me to share my art and continue to follow the fun.  I hope you can join me.  I want to offer more color filled art, inspire more people, improve my skills, bring more color into the world, gain confidence, share how wonderful life is, and I want you to have an outlet to express yourself more fully.   While we share this message and embrace being open to creativity you are helping me continue to do what I am most passionate about.  I would love for you to be part of this experience.  I am most inspired to paint knowing that it is shared with others.  Also, this class is something you can take while spaces are available.  Maybe you will join me!  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are unable to participate financially you have still read this far, that means you have been with me on this part of my journey and I am so grateful.   I would greatly appreciate it if you would choose 3 people to tell about this campaign.  We're all in this together.  
Stop by and like my Facebook page and leave a comment. I would love to hear from you and I'll be posting updates as I go through this class.  
 Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
use hashtag #colorfuljourney to spread the word and follow posts.  Upload pictures of your own colorful journey
Express yourself, love life, see beauty, listen to your inner-knowing.Thank you so much for your positive thoughts and support.

story:
Return to New Echota

We enjoyed our time printing at New Echota last October so much, we have decided to return to print again. This time, we have some interesting projects from other collaborators. Works to print include a poem in the Mayan language by Isaac Carrillo Can, work by Frank Brannon and Jeff Marley, and possibly a couple of other projects.

For those who don't know, New Echota was the last capitol for the Cherokee Nation in the eastern U.S. before the Trail of Tears in 1838. The first indigenous language newspaper, the Cherokee Phoenix, was printed here beginning in 1828. Before the removal, the original press was seized by the Georgia Guard in 1835. New Echota Historic Site today is maintained by the Georgia state park system and is situated close to Calhoun, GA. The print shop at New Echota was re-created from historical discriptions along with a press from the late 19th century.

Why is This Important?

We feel that to print these works at New Echota, in the same place that the Cherokee Phoenix was printed, and printing in the Cherokee language is a significant act in itself. This act recognizes and honors the lives of our ancestors that lived, loved, and died there. It honors all indigenous peoples by collaborating with different peoples from diverse backgrounds, uniting us through art, language, and action. It solidifies the notion that through art based collaborative efforts, we can bridge communities.

How Will the Money Raised Be Used?

We are seeking funding only for the actual costs of this project. We've included are budget so you can see exactly where the money will go. Both Frank and I will not be receiving any type of personal compensation for this. If we do raise funds beyond our goal, our intentions are to use those to return to print at New Echota in 2015 for a third time.

Our Budget:

  • Food..............................$100
  • Gas................................$100
  • Printing supplies..........$180
  • Lodging.........................$160
  • Fees & Postage..............$60
  • TOTAL...........................$600

How You Can Help

For those who get involved and support us, you'll receive some of the fruits of our labor at the $25, $50, and $100 levels. Here's how it breaks down:

  • $25 - Receive one print from Jeff Marley (his choice).
  • $50 - Receive two prints, one from Jeff Marley and one from Frank Brannon (their choice).
  • $100 - Everything! You'll get one of each project printed, including the Mayan/Cherokee poem, prints from Jeff Marley, prints from Frank Brannon, and anything else we produce.

All prints will be delivered within three weeks of completion of the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends! Help us spread the word about this campaign.
  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Google+, and Twitter!

story:
Brief Summary

My name is Joe Nardelli. I am creating a table top picture book called LOVE LOSS LIFE – A Tribute to Michele DeMeo as a promotional tool for the documentary film I am making about Michele.

This picture book is intended to celebrate Michele DeMeo's life and is a reflection of the challenges she faces as depicted in our film scheduled for release in May 2013. You can view information about the film at www.lovelosslife.org.

To capture Michele's story I have been interviewing family members, friends, health care professionals and professional associates of Michele’s to learn more about her life and the special woman that she is.

I recently received a Creative Impact Award from the Cultural Alliance of York County, Pennsylvania to help me complete my film.

As I endeavor to better understand the challenges Michele is facing as a hospice care patient living with ALS, melanoma and autism, I am also discovering the influence her strategically positive attitude is having on everyone included in her personal life, in the York, PA community and in her professional circles.

I capture the story of Michele in my film and will reflect the essence of her lovely personality through the picture book, which will serve as a unique and personal memoir of the film making experience we shared together.

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR

As a producer I have completed numerous film projects for clients such as ABC Networks, Warner Bros. Records, Sony Music Entertainment, Capitol Records and other major corporations. I have received Gold and Platinum records as well as awards and recognition for narrative, educational and music video programs I have directed and produced. I am also proud to say I worked directly with Miles Davis and many other celebrated musicians, actors and directors.

I first turned to education in 1996 with the production of “My Hair’s Falling Out... Am I Still Pretty” A Childhood Cancer Education Video. The success of this film (Parent’s Choice Silver Honor Group Film Award) lead to the implementation of a childhood cancer education initiative that reached hundreds of middle-school students over a period of six years, in New York City, Pennsylvania and Indiana.

Following a fifteen-year career as a producer I turned back to writing and directed a play entitled “No Plugs To Pull”, which opened at the William Redfield Theater in New York City. The plot (ironically) was based on the decision a woman with a terminal illness makes to end her own life with assistance by a physician, but in the moments that follow her decision she is given an opportunity to change her mind.

I am proud to say that many people attended my play over its six-week run and that Kurt Vonnegut, Jr. was among them. Two years later Mr. Vonnegut released a book called "God Bless You Dr. Kervorkian".

To expand my interests in pubic service I accepted an administrative position in a NYC public school as a Parent Coordinator. The skills and expertise I acquired over a nine-year period in parent advocacy recently lead me to Tom Allon, who has stepped in as a candidate for the 2013 NYC Mayoral Race. As a volunteer on Tom's campaign I am writing parent policy and educational reform strategies.

I hold an M.F.A. from New York University in Film and Television Production and a B.A. from LaSalle College in Communications Arts.

 

THE PURPOSE

I want to make this table top picture book so people who are challenged by end of life circumstances and physical disabilities can be inspired by Michele's story.

It is also my hope that this book will provide Michele's family, friends and professional associates a memory of Michele, especially over this very special period of time in her life - from her diagnosis of ALS through the completion of our film. This is how we can all celebrate her.

This picture book will include original photos from the documentary film as well as notes about the process Michele and I experienced making the film together. It will also include a very special story that marked a distinct turning point in our collaboration during the filming process.

The picture book will also help us promote the release of our film.

At some point a portion of all proceeds will be donated to the International Association of Central Services and Hospital Materials Management (IACSHMM) an organization that sets standards for sterile processing technicians - a little known field in the medical industry, in which Michele served as a dedicated professional and leader for twenty years.

 

THE CHALLENGES

Currently, I live in New York City, but I am planning to visit York, Pennsylvania to be closer to Michele over the next few months. I will travel to her regularly to organize the photos and write and edit the text for this book with her.

At the pace Michele likes to work I believe we can complete this picture book  and have it ready for distribution as early as April. It will be released as a promotional tool in advance of the documentary film, which will be submitted to all of the major film festivals internationally.

Like our film, the picture book will give individuals, especially those challenged by end of life circumstances, a point of view that is truthful and inspiring.

In the picture book (as she does in the film) Michele will share insights about the importance of family and acceptance, her reflections about spirituality and purpose, the need we all have for creative expression and ultimately what it means to let go.

Your participation as a funder will allow me to serve Michele's greater vision, which is to inspire others to live life to its fullest every day by choice, even if we are told by someone else, that our time on earth is limited.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign requires $17,500.00 to cover the costs of materials and supplies, the design and layout, digital conversion and color correction of images, copy editing, writing and the physical production of 500 books.

There are unique production circumstances to consider. Mainly, because I will have to be on stand-by for most of the preparation, writing and editing phases of the collaborative and creative process. This means that atypical transportation, accommodations and meal expenses will be incurred and that I will have to adapt to Michele's irregular schedule with limitations due to the care she now receives and how she manages her time in order to remain strong and healthy.

We will produce a 12"x14" hard-cover, full-color table top picture book that includes photos, captions, text and commissioned illustrations.

The perks on this project are really unique because the book will only be released in a limited edition. And everyone will receive something they will be proud of.

Specifically donors will receive an allocated portion or combination of the following for their funding participation: a thank you in our book in a special section dedicated to all funding participants; a limited edition, digital copy of the books original cover on beautiful photo paper; a thank you in our film credits as a picture book funding source participant; a copy of the first edition of the picture book; a copy of a limited edition, signed copy of the picture book with a unique signature page that is inserted in a protective sleeve then affixed permanently to the inside cover of the book; a password that allows private access to the documentary film.

Additionally, two donors will receive an all-expense paid trip to a screening of our film at the first film festival that schedules it in New York, Massachusetts, Chicago or Utah.

If we aren't able to reach our entire funding goal, we will scale back the size of the book and the design details, and replace the cover illustration with a photographic montage.

 

The Impact You Will Help Us Create!

The combination of this picture book and the film when released has a potential to directly impact almost 30,000 collegues that know Michele professionally. They read her profesional articles, they train to the standards and guodes she has written, they practice methods she has created and they utilize devices she has invented.

The extended medical professional reach may be 100,000 or more combined individuals, organizations and professional associations worldwide. And if you consider the patients each of them reaches along with the network of individuals and professionals who follow Michele on Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter and the related Blogs generated by her authorship in the medical industry, we are talking about possibly a million individuals who will potentially come to eventually learn of the picture book and film.

Michele's brand will also soon be launched and sponsored by one of the largest medical supplies corporations in the world. This will result in an unforseen reach that will continue to grow steadily as legislators across the nation enact sterile processing legislation in their states with Michele DeMeo's name attached to every bill signed into law.

And all of this preceeds the actual success of the film, already acclaimed by medical professionals who have requested copies for use in their hospice and palliative care education departments.

And if the hundreds of emails we've received by those who have viewed the trailer is any indication - the film and picture book could easily become the most anticipated medical documentary since Michael Moore's "Sicko".

To measure the impact our picture book and our film will have on readers and audiences is impossible, but if you support us the goodwill created by you will keep us on a path to reach the goals we know we can achieve.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

And if you can't afford to make a funding committment please feel free to contact me directly through the film's website to share how you can help us spread the word about the picture book campaign and importance of living life fully during the time we are given here on earth.

I would like to thank you personally. Just reading this far means that you are someone who is interested in life, and that you have the willingness to discover how others are trying to make a difference.

And don't forget! If you wish to help us please use the Indiegog share tools!

Thanks so much!

Joe Nardelli

Author and Filmmaker

story:
Hi! My name is Cole Palmer, creator of Mon Chérie Commissions and Art Store. I am a young artist in San Francisco and I have been practicing art for many years, but due to lack of funding/means of distributing my art, I have never been able to take my passion to the next level. 

Several days ago, I launched the site www.moncherieart.co.uk to sell my photography, paintings, and accept commissions for customized painting/photography for friends and family, and hopefully to a wider variety of clients in the future. Please check it out, especially the "About" page to find out more.

 Unfortunately, my small customer base means that the cost of setting up and running the site far outweighs the profits (not to mention advertising which I need to expand the customer base). I am also lacking some necessary photo equipment. I'm using a Powershot s90 right now for a camera, and although I have produced some great work with it, I simply need a more professional camera to practice photography as a career. I also need some lighting equipment and backgrounds for photo shoots. If this project is successfully funded, I would finally be able to realize my dream of being an artist.


Where the $5,500.00 goes:

  • Indiegogo/Payment Fees: $500

  • Advertising the site: I have some small scale ads on Facebook and Google that have produced good results, but I lack the funding to produce them at a level that would reach a profitable customer base: $1,000.00

  • Buying photography/ painting equipment: $3,500.00 (we have decided on the Fuji X-E2 for a camera!)

  • Producing artwork/Perk Fulfillment: $500.00

I can't begin to describe how beneficial this project would be to the site and my art career. 


PLEASE SHARE. The more the word gets out, the more successful the site is.

story:
Hello, I'm Hot Cuppah Jo.

Primarily, I'm known through my blog, hotcuppahjo-art.tumblr.com, where I currently post fan art and original pieces. Recently, my computer broke down, and in order to continue as a public artist, I desperately need a new one. I started drawing in elementary school, and have since refined my own style. Primarily, I work with digital illustration while studying graphic design in college. I've been so grateful to see people on tumblr enjoy the work I produce! 

Then my computer died. My father's computer that I borrowed in the meantime is well on it's way to the grave. However, if I purchase a new and reliable computer, my Photoshop program will be too dated to install. In order to keep producing art and continue my university studies, I will have to invest in a new computer and new software. 


The investments I need to make include:

– $555 for the Photoshop CS5 Creative Suite (includes Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)

– $1075 for the MacBook Pro (to last me without breaking down)


And, of course, there are perks: including character sketches, line art, flat color, and full color (see gallery for examples). All perks would be drawn digitally in Photoshop in my personal art style. Due to the individual and unique nature of the perks, some will take longer to complete, but will definitely be worth it.


–Any additional contribution over $1,630 will pay off indiegogo fees and/or contribute to additional art supplies (intuous tablet, stylus, etc.)

–All funds, whether the campaign goal is met, exceeded, or unreached, will go to art tools and supplies only so that I can continue drawing and releasing art. 


Even a dollar will help me reach my goal. If you can't contribute, but would still like to support me, please spread the word! Share this campaign on your blog, Facebook, or with your friends and family. Any word of mouth helps me to reach my goal and continue drawing for the community.

A computer and software are crucial tools in creating art and continuing my studies as a designer/illustrator. With your help, I can obtain the supplies I need to pursue my artistic endeavors, both on tumblr and in a future career. As a college student, I can't take on the cost alone, but want to continue drawing. I want my fan art to bring joy and feels to the tumblr community. I want my original work to be successful in the future. I just have to make that a possibility.

Primarily, I work with digital illustration while studying graphic design in college. I've been so grateful to see people on tumblr enjoy the work I produce! Then my computer died. My father's computer that I borrowed in the meantime is well on it's way to the grave. However, if I purchase a new and reliable computer, my Photoshop program will be too dated to install. In order to keep producing art and continue my university studies, I will have to invest in a new computer and new software. The investments I need to make include:– $555 for the Photoshop CS5 Creative Suite (includes Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)– $1075 for the MacBook Pro (to last me without breaking down)And, of course, there are perks: including character sketches, line art, flat color, and full color (see gallery for examples). All perks would be drawn digitally in Photoshop in my personal art style. Due to the individual and unique nature of the perks, some will take longer to complete, but will definitely be worth it.–Any additional contribution over $1,630 will pay off indiegogo fees and/or contribute to additional art supplies (intuous tablet, stylus, etc.)–All funds, whether the campaign goal is met, exceeded, or unreached, will go to art tools and supplies only so that I can continue drawing and releasing art. Even a dollar will help me reach my goal. If you can't contribute, but would still like to support me, please spread the word! Share this campaign on your blog, Facebook, or with your friends and family. Any word of mouth helps me to reach my goal and continue drawing for the community.A computer and software are crucial tools in creating art and continuing my studies as a designer/illustrator. With your help, I can obtain the supplies I need to pursue my artistic endeavors, both on tumblr and in a future career. As a college student, I can't take on the cost alone, but want to continue drawing. I want my fan art to bring joy and feels to the tumblr community. I want my original work to be successful in the future. I just have to make that a possibility.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joshua Mays and I am a painter artist muralist illustrator. I'm from Denver, I lived in Philadelphia and I'm currently living in Oakland California. I have been fortunate to have my art appreciated by so many people in so many places.

With BEACON, what I want to do is paint four murals in Oakland before October 1st. I am asking for your help to pay for the supplies, paint and the artist hours that are going to go into creating these murals. So far I have approached several sites and two of them have said 'yes'. I'm dealing with this on a first-come first-served basis so whichever of the first four sites say yes those will be the four murals I will be painting. I am really hyped to get going on these murals and I'm excited to exhibit the process and ultimately the finished pieces.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am raising $10,000 for this project. ($2000 will go to paint and supplies, $8000 for artist hours)
  • I will be creating new drawings and a limited series of silkscreen prints that will go along with selected originals and print packages that I shall give as perks for donating to the campaign.
  • If I don't reach the entire goal, that means I have less funds for hours and supplies, which means the project will still go on, but on a smaller scale. To make this project as big as possible, let's reach the full goal!

The Impact

I want to scatter a story told with murals through different neighborhoods in Oakland, CA. I'm doing this out of the excitement of contributing to the elaborate creative conversation happening here in the Bay Area. I plan on broadcasting the the creative process and results in hopes that locals and visitors to the city of Oakland will be inspired to follow the path laid forth and explore the diverse collection of colors, textures, sights and sounds that this city has to offer.

I have so far already created murals in Philadelphia, Denver, Washington D.C., Portland, Mexico City and Oakland.


Risks & Challenges

The main challenges, at this point, on top of raising funds is just getting walls okayed for the project. So far, with 2 walls secured, we're halfway there. I will communicate with my Oakland network to find and approach property owners for the final 2 walls.

Other Ways You Can Help

Outside of donating money to the Indiegogo, you can help me out by sharing my campaign on social networks (facebook, twitter, instagram, etc.) Also, I will be able to use some help with painting the murals. Please contact me if you're interested in donating time as a mural assistant. Thank you, very much!

story:
Even though I have a degree in commercial photography I lean much more to the 'Art' side than the 'Commercial' side. The main project I have been working on for over a year, Epistrophy: Nudes, culminates in a show at Gallery 110 in Seattle this September.  

I originally started focusing on shooting nudes when I moved to Berlin in 2008 because I thought people would buy pictures of naked people.  While it's true that people buy pictures of naked people, I didn't have much success selling mine. When I moved back to Seattle in 2010 I continued shooting nudes.  

 The main theme I have in my mind when I'm shooting is repetition.  Namely, the automatic repetition of thoughts, emotions and physical movements that we make everyday, which brings us to the word Epistrophy.

The word Epistrophy has two meanings that I'm interested in.  An Epistrophy is a repetition of a word or an expression at the end of os successive phrases or verses for poetic effect or to add emphasis. --And my favorite definition:  An Epistrophy is the experience of seeing our own distance from our true selves,  a moment when we become aware of our separation from the One.  The pictures in this show are trying to convey this automatic, unconscious repetition, but also the transcending of it.

I need to raise $3,850 to make this show a reality and not just a bunch of images on my hard drive.  The fine art, archival Giclee canvas prints, 11 in number, will cost about $2,500 in total.  The expenses for having the main gallery to myself as well as other associated expenses comprise the reminder of the $3,850.  

Any funds I receive over the amount of $3,850 will go towards my next show planned for June 2015.  And if I don't make the full amount then I will scale back the size of the show to fit my budget

For every $100 donated you will receive a signed 18x12 print of my choice, though requests for specific photos are welcome

Thank you!

David Beckley

story:
Exhibit A Debuts at Miami Art Week

Exhibit A is taking it to the next level when we head to Miami Art Week to participate in Aqua Art Miami, December 3 - 7. We can't wait to show off by work by Anne Gant, Amelia Fais Harnas, Jeremy Holmes, and Melissa Zarem. Your support will help us make a splash with our debut on the international art scene.

Exhibit A has built a reputation we're proud of with our exhibition program in Corning, New York. In Miami we will introduce ourselves to more than 10,000 visitors, including international collectors, museum professionals, art world luminaries and art enthusiasts.

AQUA ART MIAMI  |  exhibitor page: EXHIBIT A  |  ART MIAMI  |  ART BASEL MIAMI  SCOPE  |  CONTEXT  |  

Information on Art Week in Miami: Films at Art Basel Miami Beach | The Miami Art Scene |  Art-Collecting.com  |  Miami All Around | more to come


Getting to AQUA Requires Green

We are up for the extra work. We don't mind packing up a lot of art. We look forward to learning the ropes so we can more confidently participate in reputable art fairs. But this endeavor is expensive. The bare minimum includes booth fees, crating and shipping costs, travel expenses, additional insurance and added personnel both in Miami and in Corning. 

If we raise more that would be fabulous, and if by some miracle we cover our expenses that frees us up to invest in presenting our artists with extra flair. And maybe even enjoy a tropical drink with a festive little umbrella while we are in Miami!  


In Return for Your Support 

Only a few hours left! Perks you can get in return for your support are listed to the right, This is a great opportunity to get a sculpture by Jeremy Holmes. He's will be making four wooden ribbon sculptures just for A is for Aqua contributors.

And be sure to check out our last minute additions and specials!


The Impact

There are twenty-some art fairs and a plethora of art events taking place during Miami Art Week. Having an art gallery from Corning present at one of the biggest art destinations in the world is a big deal. It will:

  • Build audience and gain recognition for the gallery and Exhibit A artists.
  • Expand awareness of Corning and the Finger Lakes Region of New York as a culturally vibrant destination.
  • Enable Exhibit A to prepare for and participate in future art fairs thereby improving our ability to compete and survive as a commercial gallery.
Exhibiting at reputable art fairs is a major step towards a promising future for the gallery and its artists.




    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you have read this far you are likely a fan of Exhibit A and our artists. Clicking the the contribute button is just one way to help. We welcome any assistance you can give us with getting the word out. Please invite your friends to check out 'A is for Aqua.'

story:
The ever elusive disappearing job of the recession has struck again! And this time it's in our own home! We are reaching out to our community and asking for help. We want to provide you with the value of the things we're best at: art and healing.

We need to raise $3000 by the end of September to cover rent and other expenses.

Your contribution will make you eligible to receive Original artwork from Chris, healing sessions from Perrin (including massage and Reiki), and a free signed copy of Perrin's upcoming novel: Cloud City.

Your contribution will allow us to continue renting our apartment - a fertile nest of a creative genius zone, and allow us to continue achieving our dreams and giving our gifts to the world  from the most potent platform possible.

We both have big dreams for our lives and have overcome many challenges and sacrificed a lot to live in Los Angeles and get to where we are now. We are both determined to keep moving forward. We also know that we can't do it alone, We need your support to let us know we're on track and that what we have to offer is of real value. So thank you, we appreciate you and your support.

story:
My company refused to buy me a Mac Pro, would you help buy me one instead?

Here's the story:

3 days ago (1 Dec 2014) I tweeted:

https://twitter.com/chenluois/status/539383599900786688

My company replied:

Some people kindly suggest me to broke my old MBP so that I could buy a new one, which should work, but apparently my company won't allow me to do that:

Even the software I created came up to against me (yes, it's a software)!:

 

I felt really upset, as the CEO and chief developer of the company, they don't even have budget to buy me an iMac 5K.


So, iMac 5K is not an option, but how about Mac Pro? I still hold faith to my company.

This morning (4 Dec 2014), I tweeted to my company:

https://twitter.com/chenluois/status/540315030139322368


My company once again replied "NO" to me this time. How cruel!

Even worse, my company said they won't give me a penny if I don't finish Mou 1.0, what kind of company is this! It's not fair!


Luckily I have some good followers, one of them suggested me to fight back:

I fought back to my company: NO Mac Pro! No Mou 1.0!


Unfortunately my company don't reply.


My company refused to buy me a Mac Pro, would you help buy me one instead?


All I want is the $2,999 version Mac Pro:

  • Would you like to help even if you don't know me?
  • Would you like to help even if you never heard about me?
  • Would you like to contribute, help buy me a Mac Pro?
  • WOULD YOU?



FAQ:
Q: Is this a joke?
A: Yes, but I do really want a Mac Pro, would you like to help?

My company refused to buy me a Mac Pro, would you?

story:
“No matter how dreary and gray our homes are, we people of flesh and blood would rather live there than in any other country, be it ever so beautiful. There is no place like home.” 
                                              ― L. Frank Baum, The Wonderful Wizard of Oz 


A little about me: 

Hi! I'm Brittany. I'm a 25 year old artist, writer, theatre-maker, and dreamer from Flint, MI. I've lived here my entire life, attended Flint Community Schools, and graduated from the University of Michigan - Flint. I've spent the last few years exploring ways in which I can marry my passion (namely the arts) with my strong desire to give something back to the community that has contributed so much to the person I've become. 
In light of the overwhelmingly negative image of Flint in recent media, I've created an image which I hope will instill a sense of pride, while also daring to dream, and remind us all that although we wish for brighter days, we must have the courage to press onward; that change lives within our own hearts and minds; and that ultimately, in the end, there really is no place quite like home.  

The Goal:

My goal of $900 will cover the initial production of 100 T-Shirts and 500 post cards, as well as booth rentals at local market and craft fairs in the month of April. 

As the goal of this project is to restore pride and ownership in a struggling community, I would like to sell the shirts at a rate that is affordable to Flint residents, and will still allow me to continue creating art with a positive impact. 

The Perks:

For Each donation of $100 or more, you will receive a signed print of the original image, a t-shirt (or one T-Shirt will be donated in your name to a Flint resident who cannot otherwise afford it at the April Art Walk), and a three-pack of post cards.

For each $40 donation, you will receive a T-Shirt and signed post card, OR receive a signed post card and one T-Shirt will be donated in your name to a Flint resident who cannot otherwise afford it at the April Art Walk. 

For each $25 donation, you will receive a T-Shirt, OR one T-Shirt will be donated in your name to a Flint resident who cannot otherwise afford it at the April Art Walk. 

For each $10 donation, you will receive a three-pack of signed post cards 

For each $5 donation, you will receive a signed post card

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, that doesn't mean you can’t help! 

Use the indiegogo share tools and help spread the word about this project via facebook, twitter, email, and all of your social networking sites! 

Follow me on Facebook: Facebook.com/BReedTheatre or visit my website: BritReed.Weebly.Com to keep up with other projects and events! 

Consider visiting and supporting my employer, Shop Floor Theatre Company (www.sftco.org) to help us keep creating positive change in Flint, MI and beyond!

story:
Summary

The PlayaGods are currently building a spectacular 40' Viking ship, called Fjörgyn. It will have an amazing sound system and aerial silk artists performing from the mast. Our most recent endeavor was Thor, a 20' Viking ship. PlayaGods seek to reunite mother and son, so Fjörgyn and Thor will sail together on the playa.We have been involved with various theme camps such as Brand-UR-Ass, Homebrew 4A Homebrew and Pink Fuzzy Monkey with Superhero Underwear at Twisted Family Reunion; and worked on the Porch Flea, built the Roadside Temple, created the very first Banana Phone Charging Station, as well as participated in and/or supported countless other Burning Man projects over the past 16 years.

What We Need & What You Get

Fjörgyn is a massive 40 foot viking ship with a lot of planned features. Your donation will help offset the cost of providing an incredible experience on Fjörgyn for all who venture along its path at Burning Man. Some of the features include:

  • 3,000 watt sound system complete with two 18" subs, four tower speakers with 15" bass drivers, and four additional speakers hanging from the bow and stern of the ship to provide incredible lateral sound, perfect for late night dance excursions and epic sunrise DJ sessions.
  • Mast boom where aerial silk artists will twirl over a dancing crowd, 29 feet above Fjörgyn's deck.
  • Open dance floor with radical illumination, all on top of a 16 thousand pound axle.
  • Elevated DJ Crow's Nest on the mast will overlook the entire art car, and allow the DJ to stand in any direction to face the crowd on the boat, or perhaps a massive dance party on the adjacent playa.
  • Fjörgyn can transport 30 vikings at a time on her wild adventures of pillaging and plundering.

Perks

We have some amazing one-of-a-kind perks for varying levels of donation, including Thor's hammer pendants, t-shirts, hand-made Viking beanies complete with horns and blacklight reactive, and even a special night out on Fjörgyn with you and your best friends.

Construction

Fjörgyn is already under construction, check out some photos below. Your contribution will help ensure this Viking Ship will join Thor on the playa for some epic adventures. The primary materials your generous donation will help pay for include the sound system, the lighting, and the cost of the metal frame, shell and exterior finish.




Photo of Thor, our first Viking Ship art car, about half the size of Fjörgyn.

story:
John Atkinson - known to many as Vacadude - got REEEEEEEEEALLY CLOSE to winning a 3-D printer in a recent contest, and along the way he got a lot of fans, friends, and family very excited at the prospect of seeing him make bobblehead dolls of some super cute barn owls. But the contest winner was some (admittedly quite nice) other dude who already has a lot of 3D printing experience and who only wanted to make R2-D2 replacement parts with the printer he won.  (Congrats, other guy!  We're big fans of R2-D2 too.)   But now we'd like to raise enough money for John to buy his own 3-D printer and get him up and running with 3-D printing.  We know he'll create some amazing things with it - Bobblehead owls will only be the start!

$550 gets him an entry-level 3-D printer.

$700 gets him a higher-end two-nozzle printer.

$850 gets him a printer that also scans 3-D objects.

And there are much nicer/bigger 3-D printers we can get him if we raise even more money.  ($3,000 would get him a printer that can print an owl in 1/2 scale, for instance, or $6600 would pay for a printer than can print a full-scale barn owl in life size!)  Printer filament (like ink for 3-D printers) is an additional expense, so let's definitely raise enough money to set John up with plenty of printer filament to last him *at least* through his development phase, and preferably far beyond that.

Every cent of the funds raised (after fees from Indiegogo and Paypal, of course) will go directly to John and will help him buy a 3D printer.  It's probably worth noting that John had nothing to do with setting up this campaign, mostly because it's pretty clear he wouldn't have felt comfortable asking for money.  And THAT, of course, is why it was worth setting up this campaign FOR him. 

*****UPDATE #1*****

We've added some perks since this got started.  So if you already made a contribution at the perk level and would like to claim that perk, please let us know! 


*******UPDATE #2*****  (12/2/14)

The good people at XYZprinting have reached out to John and made a very special offer:  They're going to loan him a 3-D printer for a few months (along with a good supply of printer filament) to develop and create his bobblehead design (and whatever else his creative mind can come up with).  Then they're going to send a camera crew to visit with him and document his progress for promotional purposes.  After all of that is finished, THEN John will put these funds toward purchasing his own brand new 3-D printer.  This is VERY exciting, as it will enable him to practice and learn for a few months before he has to decide which model to purchase, and it also increases the chances that he'll be able to choose an even nicer model once it's been released. 

THANKS TO ALL OF YOU for making this campaign a success. We reached our goal in less than 24 hours!!   These funds will be put to very good use.  I'm going to leave the campaign up to give more folks a chance to contribute and select one of the perks if they'd like to, but I feel terrific about how all of you came to show your support so quickly and so thoroughly.  Thank you, thank you, thank you!

*******UPDATE #3--From VacaDude***** (12/4/14)

I would like to thank, from the bottom of my feathery heart, everybody for their support in making this campaign successful!! I know that some of you made contributions even before there were perks, so if that happened and you are interested in any of the perks you see, feel free to send me a message, and we can sort it all out and make it right.

Now, some folks were asking about a mailing address for me--because they wanted to contribute but did not have PayPal, or just wanted to do it by check. Here is my address (and of course, all the perks and same award levels will be honored):

John Atkinson

1563 Solano Avenue, #531

Berkeley, CA  94707

You may have noticed that I have added some more perks, even though the fundraising goal has been met and exceeded. These additional offerings are things that people have asked me for over the last five years, but before now I could never figure out a good way to make them available. I feel by offering them as perks here, it can be both (1) a good way to announce that I am making these items/services available, and (2) a way to gauge to see if the interest in them is still there.

Just to be clear, the amount raised to date is already enough to get a 3D printer and get me started in the making of bobbleheads and figurines. Any additional funds raised would go toward getting the materials and tools to facilitate the creation process.

This whole thing has really got the ideas flowing, so stay tuned!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.


The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Restocked 2021 ASL Calendar - SOLD OUT

UPDATE JAN 24 2020: I will ship your order on 25 or 26. you will receive the tracking number. 

Meet goal or nothing (refund) due bulk cost. 

All Perks are Free shipping for only USA. 

 2021 American Sign language calendar has all "Build the Sign Language Sculpture" art series, plus it has sign language on every holiday and events. This is 2nd calendars that we created. 

What’s special about this calendar, it has the date for ASL day and International Day of Sign Languages.

On the last page, it has name of each monthly ASL signs.

I decided to give you second chance to order 2021 calendar, last year was very tough for  a lot of people. Meet the amount of bulk calendars to meet the values, I can ship you the shipping. Thank you for your supporting! Hope all you have good year of 2021, as this calendar inspire you everyday when you put it up. 

Thank you for your patience

story:
A Magical Mobile Sculpture

Tarna is a mobile sculpture of a giant Jackalope. Our mythical horned rabbit is being built on a refurbished minibus. On the outside, it's a metallic art car with a DJ sound stage, complete with lighting and flame effects. On the inside, it's a plush lounge and cozy gallery space. 

Concept art by Marie Poliak

Tarna was created by a passionate team of artists and professionals, who have experience volunteering with other art cars (Heavy Meta, The Bleachers). Our goal is to complete this project for Burning Man 2019, and to continue showcasing the project at select festivals and events across North America. We are asking for your help.

What We Need

The total budget for Tarna is over $50,000. So far, we've thrown epic fundraising parties, and earned artistic awards and grants. But most of the funds have come out of our own pockets, as the founders and organizers.

So, we also hope to raise $10,000 via crowdfunding, which will help cover the following costs:

  • Constructing the metal body 
  • Buying a chest-thumping sound system
  • Building and fueling our flame system
  • Engineering and rigging our lighting system
  • Crafting the interior lounge and art space

Design drawings by Olivia Coombe

The Team

Andrea Shehara Kong (Director of Operations): Andrea keeps our logistics on track.
Danny (Musical Director): Dan guides our musical style, and helps host kickass events.
Emma Duggan (Director of Production): Emma steers our team to build the damn stuff.
Jordan St. Claire Snyder (Art Director): Jordan sets our artistic vision across the project.

Fabrication Leads: Alex Cowan & Andrea Dorelli Shevlan
Structural Leads: Caroline Wojtyla & Matt Culver
Fire Leads: Jesse Knapp & Kyle White
Lighting Leads : Dom Scott & Troy Strum
Interior Lead: Laura Brien

And special thanks to: Adam Fore, Alex Borins, Alex Lebedev, Alina Demirian, Amer Ameen, Amy Demidenko, Ana Matic, Angela McQueen, Anne Marley, Austin Simps, Brandon Sage, Brittany Wharton, Byron Borzecki, Camille Stone, Christiane Yerex, Christina Luck, Cosmin Negreanu, Dalton Moreau, Dante Arcangelo Scaffidi-Argentina, Darryn Coleman, David MacLeod, Dasha Pyat, David Suckling, David Swords, Eric Holt, Farah Sandhu, Farrell Rafferty, Heidi Eve Kutzelnig, Irving Shaw, Jackie Spade, James Fisher, Jamie Chebodiac, Jesse Champagne, Jesse Long, Jillian Jerat, Jonathan Stein, Joshua Shessel, Julia Gi, Kale Parsons, Keight Margot, Keith Mustachi, Kevin Bracken, Krista Cassidy, Kyle Bernard, Laura Elliott, Lolita Devlin, Lydia Sayeau, Lyon Smith, Maia Friedlander, Marc Reeve-Newson, Mareks Petersons, Marie Poliak, Mariel Pauline, Marina Izvekova, Mark Raven-Zemla, Matt Loppie, Matt Von Wilde, Matthew Languay, Mel Hergott, Mel Nevsky, Mell Barry, Melony J Wood, Michelle Imai, Miruna Toma, Muda Hayee, Nabeel Kassam, Natasha Sarjeant, Nikki Sin, Olivia Coombe, Paula Burrows, Petro Vesna, Qais JD, Rehanna Devraj-Kizuk, Reiva Francis Moreau, Rey Castonguay, Richard Rotter, Rob Gvildys, Roxy Nobles, Ryan Smythe, Ryan Wilson, Sabrina Bulley, Sampson Pants, Sarah Bourne, Scott Honsberger, Shane Baelish, Shuna Heeney, Sierra St. Louis, Stace Docta, Stacy Campbell, Stevie Delcampo, Taliya Cohen, Tim Clarke, Tim San Andres, Tim Sandik, Tyne Garvey, Vikki Humphrey, Viktor Espinoza, Zel Tyrant.  

How You Can Help

If you are able to donate, you'll receive a perk as our thanks.

BASIC BACKERS

$5 - Virtual Hug: The thought still counts. 
$10 - Special Thanks: We'll list your name in our newsletter and in the car's guestbook. 
$15 - Digital Soundtrack: You'll receive a private link to hear our DJs doing their thing. 
$20 - Tarna Sticker: We'll send you a high quality die-cut Tarna sticker.
$40 - Antler Pendant: Receive a 1/4 inch thick acrylic pendant of Tarna signature antlers.
$60 - Tank Top: Receive a tank top with the Tarna emblem. (S - L)
$60 - T-Shirt: Receive a t-shirt with the Tarna emblem. (S - XXL)

Jackalope Painting by James Zirco Fisher

SUPER BACKERS

$80 - Warrior Patch: You are one of Tarna's warriors, recognized by this sew-on patch.
$100 - Steel Pendant: A 1/4 inch thick steel pendant of the Tarna emblem.
$111 - Tarna Leggings: Tarna's unique foliage-patterned tights.
$120 - Jackalope Poster: A limited edition print of James Zirco Fisher's Jackalope art. ​
$150 - Jackalope Model: A painted, plastic mini-sculpture of our gorgeous art car.
$175 - Embroider a Tarna Pillow: Write a message on a pillow for the car's interior lounge.

TOP BACKERS

$200 - Welding Lesson: Visit our Toronto workshop to learn from Alex, our lead fabricator.
$300 - Photoshoot with Tarna: Flex real hard in front of the finished art car. Show everyone.
$500 - DJ Set on the Jackalope: DJ whatever you want on the playa for 90 minutes.
$3000 - Party Anywhere in Ontario: We will bring the car, spectacle, and music to you.
$9000 - Party Anywhere in North America: We will bring it. Very far.

Even if you can't donate to our project, one of the biggest ways that you can help is to share this campaign. Find us on Facebook and Instagram, engage with us and share. The more noise you make with us, the louder we get.

story:
Our Story

Elicser Elliott, Toronto's most recognized street artist, has been invited for a two month artist residency in South Africa. Elicser may be leaving Toronto for a while but he'd like to stay in touch with you and there are also opportunities to join him, as muse, on his travels. 

 

"Dear Toronto" is a travel log project - Elicser will be sketching, drawing, painting, and more, with you in mind. Each day will be documented and compiled into a travel log that will be distributed digitally to all contributors.

His journey begins on March 6th, heading to Cape Town where he will be based at A Word of Art as a participant in their residency program for 2 months (returning May 6th). 

 

You can help him get there by supporting this campaign with a contribution of $25, $50, $100, $250 or $500. Each with it's own reward - beyond a smile and a huge THANK YOU. See the perks for details.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Impact

While in South Africa, in addition to art making, Elicser will be running workshops with local communities teaching the art of spray painting & mural creation along side other international artists in residence.

This campaign will provide the financial support Elicser needs to sustain his 2 month stay in South Africa while also helping with expenses left at home including rent (the last thing he needs is to be evicted while he's away). 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach $4000 to fund art creation during Elicser's 2 month trip to South Africa. 

You can help and receive a postcard or illustration from Elicser or commission an original Elicser portrait of yourself or a loved one!

 

BUDGET:

To cover basic travel & art making expenses.

Flight - Toronto to Cape Town   $ 1,200*

Ground Travel within SA -          $    400

Residency Fee -                         $    600*

Materials (Paint etc) -                  $ 1,000

Production (Print & Post) -          $    800

                                   TOTAL     $ 4,000

*Note: Flight and Residency fees have been booked, confirmed and paid for. These funds will be recouped to allocate towards living expenses (ie Food)

Each level of funding in this campaign is independent of fulfilling the entire campaign goal of $4000. All donors will receive their perks (delivery for perks involving prints & giclée canvas prints can be expected in June). 

Other Ways You Can Help

Needless to say, SPREAD THE WORD.  Please share this campaign every day on Facebook, Twitter or any where you spend your time. If you know a fan of Elicser, let them know or contribute as a gift to them!

story:
To celebrate the 20th anniversary of the classic shoujo manga (girl's comic) and anime, SailorMoon, I'm creating an original series of 1.5" acrylic charms of the main cast of heroines that can be worn as jewelery or used as cell phone straps or keychains.

SET ONE

SET TWO

SET THREE



As a young girl growing up in the 90s it was rare to find a comic that not only had a strong female heroine, but also a cast filled with a myriad of different types of female characters reaching across the spectrum. For budding comickers such as myself, Sailor Moon was a big part of our formative years that showed us that not only could women be the heroes, but we could be the heroes and still be ourselves. There was no one perfect way to be the heroine, nor was there one perfect way to be a woman.  Sailor Moon was one of the most inclusive fictions for young girls of it's generation, no matter who you were, you could find a Sailor Soldier/Guardian/Scout that you could relate to on some level, and it meant a great deal to many young creators and readers of my generation. To this end I decided I wanted to do something to celebrate it's 20th anniversary and it's introduction to a whole new generation!


I certainly do. I've previously done serialized graphic novel work such as Next Exit, for Slave Labor Graphics and RE:Play for TokyoPop. I currently create the series, Dire Hearts, for the inclusive fiction magazine, Sparkler Monthly, published by Chromatic Press.

(Note: While this project, and my current series, is all ages, not all images or series on links below are, please click responsibly!)

Sparkler Magazine

My Tumblr

My DA

Sailor Moon has a lot of characters, so the initial output for a printing of a set of 10 charms is quite a bit more than I can afford to pay out of pocket. I’m hoping to raise funds from fellow fans to help take the sting out of the initial payment and see these girls made to the best quality they can be!

I plan to still go forward with the set because I really want to see these girls through to fruition. I will simply have to cut back on other items in my 2014 lineup and raise prices in my online store and at conventions to make up the cost. That being said, if you purchase this set through a pledge here, they will be considerably cheaper than I’ll be able to sell them for after this fundraiser is over, via my online store or at conventions. So by helping early, and getting them to print, you’re saving yourself some money and getting some cute charms, it’s win-win right?

Right now I’m just aiming to cover printing costs and get this base set out. But hey a girl can dream can’t she?

$2800- ADDITIONAL 3 CHARACTERS ADDED TO SET

$3100- ADDITIONAL 3 CHARACTERS ADDED TO SET

Who? Well lets see if we can make it to half way and then I'll share additional lineart for the new characters!
story_txt: To celebrate the 20th anniversary of the classic shoujo manga (girl's comic) and anime, SailorMoon, I'm creating an original series of 1.5" acrylic charms of the main cast of heroines that can be worn as jewelery or used as cell phone straps or keychains.SET ONESET TWOSET THREEAs a young girl growing up in the 90s it was rare to find a comic that not only had a strong female heroine, but also a cast filled with a myriad of different types of female characters reaching across the spectrum. story:
We are the Parade Committee of the annual Pride Parade in Vancouver, Canada. For the first time, we are creating our own large-scale Reflection Float to enter into the Parade, with the purpose of commemorating the history of the LGBTTQ community, celebrating our achievements as a community, and looking forward to the future.

We have teamed up with the Public Dreams Society, the organization behind the annual Illuminaires and Parade of Lost Souls events. As a collective of talented artists, Public Dreams Society push the boundaries of performance and installation art, and we are thrilled to partner up with them to build our Reflection Float. The end result of this collaboration will be the showstopper of the Parade - a gigantic, colourful, bright and impactful float.

As two not-for-profit organizations, we are reaching out for financial assistance to help us make our Pride dream come true.

The funding we raise will determine the scale and scope of the project; the more money we raise the bigger and better the float will be. Funds raised will go entirely towards design and construction of the float, through artist fees and material costs.

Vancouver Pride Parade

The 2013 Vancouver Pride Parade will take place on Sunday August 4th, running through downtown Vancouver along one of the most beautiful and scenic parade routes in the world. This year marks the 35th Anniversary of LGBTTQ Pride in Vancouver, and the Parade will reflect that.

We will remember our history and honour those who came before us, while looking forward to our future. We will celebrate our 35 years of tremendous growth and achievements, and further unite the LGBTTQ community and allies. We will stand behind those who are still fighting for the right to live, love and be equal.

Vancouver Pride Society

The Vancouver Pride Society is the organizing body behind the annual Vancouver Pride Parade, Festival and Pride Week events. The organization has been established on the international stage as a leader in organizing grassroots community events on a large scale.

Public Dreams Society

Public Dreams brings art and celebration to communities throughout Vancouver. By combining spectacular and eclectic performances like lantern processions, giant puppets, group choreography, music, and sculpture, Public Dreams enliven city spaces and cultivate the fertile ground necessary to create and enhance neighbourhood vitality. Public Dreams’ annual events are artistically innovative, environmentally friendly and culturally inclusive – bringing people together across the diverse landscape of British Columbia’s Lower Mainland.

story:
Shaky Start

Hi folks, I'm Libby Walkup, I'm a writer, an editor, a publisher (Ginger Piglet mag), a refurbed Apple addict, an amateur iPhoneographer, crocheter of washcloths and, coming soon, with your help, a book making artist.

I began making books at the end of my MFA program. My first book was,


(first book, up cycled saltines box cover based, cloth my grandmother once used to make me a pair of Zubas and some card stock cut from a large sheet)

well, not very good.

But I kept trying.

(Japanese stitch collected paper journal)

And though my product photos need improvement, I got much better at making books.

(Photo courtesy Samantha Kinlin)
But there's a long, long way to go before I'm making the kinds of books I have designed in my head.

Coming Home

When learning to make my first books, and my head was spinning with cover art ideas, I realized all of the things I'd collected and moved with me halfway across the country to grad school and then back with me to Minnesota after grad school, had a reason for existing in my life: scraps of old fabric, buttons, the needles, the thread (though I didn't sew), the yarn too thin for me ever to crochet with, the sample swatches from when I worked at Discontent in 2004.

(sample swatch book cover mid-project.)

You know how some people go through thrift stores, shopping for hours, looking for that perfect blazer or pair of jeans? Yeah, that drives me nuts. I don't have the patience, however, that first time I popped into Orange Records on First Ave in Fargo, I flipped through every single album. It was meditative. Binding books I felt the same, but there's so much to learn and practice and I can't do all of it without a guidance and hands on research.

I'm sure a few cities would be angry with me for saying, but London is THE place to study book arts and I'm planning a ten day crash course, self-guided study trip to London's three extensive artist book collections at The National Art Library, Victoria and Albert Museum and Library of Chelsea Art and Design and The London Center for Book Arts. While there studying and absorbing book arts I will immerse myself in the literary arts community and create a unique project called Collecting London  as a giant thank you for your love, support and hard earned cash. Collecting London will be based off my theory and feeling that London is Love.

I've only got 20 days to book a reasonable flight, so don't hesitate.

Why November?

  • Richmond Upon Thames Literary Festival
  • London History Festival
  • Hampstead Arts Festival
  • Foyles Book Shop readings
  • Beyond Words Poetry
  • More than 20 spoken word events across the city

The Cost Break Down

(all costs are est. based on current prices and exchange rates):

  • Flight: 1,100 USD.
  • Food (est. 10 days): 450 USD.
  • Transportation (London): 90 USD.
  • Class at London Center for Book Arts: 130 USD.
  • Day trip to Surrey Some Odd Pages and Sessional course: 91 USD.
  • Materials and shipping costs to send you your gifts: 1018 USD.
  • Grand Total: 2879 USD.

The Give Breakdown

While spending time in London learning bookmaking and attending and participating in literary events, I'll collect things: bits of paper from thrown magazines, maps, hotel tidbits, museum brochures and hundreds of photos of odd doors, street art, text art, funky buildings, and anything else that catches my unique eye. Having spent time in the UK before, my photos and collections will deviate from the standard tourism bits. Utilizing the learned tools these collected items will go into professionally printed and bound and handmade book projects especially for you. Pick your poison:

  • Postcards, prints and stationery.
  • Upcycled handmade books.
  • Tiny and large  professionally printed and bound photo books.

The Love Affair

They say books are dying. They say books won't survive the digital age. They say no one reads or writes in books anymore. I say books are not dying they're changing, or they have to change in order to keep up with culture. Books are so, so, so important. Not only the printed, published books, but books for writing (where do you think those other books start?). Me and books have had a love affair since I was a small child documenting the ins and outs of first grade in a tiny (square, I might add) pink journal with a lock that my sister broke (later she stole the journal and it was lost forever), though I haven't the proof (little sisters, amiright?).

Journals document our interests, our feelings and our days. They keep track of our to do lists and act as historical record. And when your child's child's child becomes a writer and thinks "How cool would it be to have Great Grandma's journal, maybe there's a story in it," they'll find it tucked away somewhere and become entranced with the mundaneness and sordid details of it all and then turn it into something amazing. Would you want to deprive your great grandchild that possibility? 

My great grandparents didn't even so much as leave me letters to decipher and I'll be miffed about that for at least another twenty years (don't even get me started). Don't leave your great grandchildren miffed with you. Learning to make books and immersing myself in book culture, which started with writing, through on to publishing and back round to the making, puts me, and by proxy you, not only at the forefront of the future of books, but strongly standing to preserve the book.

Obstacles Overcome

There are two challenges I see in this plan:

One:

  • The class schedules at the two book making facilities not coinciding with my plans.
Prevention plan:

  • As things come together I will contact both facilities and work out something for a special visitor. Essentially arrange a class with them or arrange to use their facilities with guided help for a small fee for the days that I'll be in town.

Two:

  • Money. Obviously. 

Action plan:

  • Listen, guys, the base price is the flight, right? So if I can get that, just that, I'm going to muster what I can together and do what I can while I'm there with what I have.  I really hope this comes to full fruition, but I want you to know that it's that important to me.

Need More Visual?

Keep watching my Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, Google+ or Facebook fan page for book arts work I want to learn and sample text art images and previous photos taken to get an idea of what I might conjure for this project. Once you donate I'll regularly update with examples of how I've grown and what I've learned via email.

Tough Times?

So, times are tough for you? Yeah, me too, obvs, but I'd still appreciate your help. If even a dollar is more than you can give, Indiegogo makes it super easy to share my campaign with your friends and followers. We all post a bunch of random crap to our various walls daily, I hope you can take a few seconds and post this for me.  In fact even if you are able to send me a dollar, I'd appreciate you sharing this with people. Who are we to deny anyone the opportunity to fund a budding artist?

Follow libbywalkup on Instagram and twitter, and www.libbywalkup.tumblr.com to see my most recent prints and to keep up with Collecting London when I get over there.

story:
Arts on the Move Festival is a not-for-profit organisation. The festival is a one-day event that takes place at Poltimore House and invites theatre, music, dance, visual art, poetry, comedy and other live performance to join us in raising awareness for both the Poltimore House Trust and the local artistic talent in Exeter. We are an event that accommodates a wide audience of all ages and are a guaranteed fun day out on an English summer's day.

Arts on the Move Festival celebrates the arts and heritage of the South West.

On Sunday 25th May 2014 (1pm-8pm), Arts on the Move will open the Poltimore House gates for its third year running. We've had a fantastic range in performance artists over our time and this year looks to be, once again, an incredible day rich in talent from both local and University of Exeter artists.

However, festivals cost a lot of money! We wouldn't have made it this far without the charitable generosity of our audience members and hard-working volunteers. We owe so much to the wonderful public of Exeter, who we in return aim to give a vibrant and wonderful day out once a year.

All funding goes directly to the Poltimore House Trust. This year some profit will also be available for funding for our artists subsequent to the event, to help them continue their projects in Exeter. Even our hard-working management and organisation team are volunteers! So the money that you donate is 100% for a charitable cause. It may help us with the decorations, artist's expenses, marketing, and food & beverage businesses. The more money we raise, the bigger and better the festival can become.


For more information regarding the Poltimore House Trust and all the exciting work they are doing there please see the link below:

http://www.poltimore.org

For more information regarding the festival please see our Youtube, Facebook and Twitter pages:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUhXbw7rDFSjvP8vs2NWK1g

https://twitter.com/artsotmfestival

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Arts-on-the-Move-Festival/156876634428266

In return for your generosity, we will be offering a range of prizes.

If you donate £5 you could win 2 free tickets with return transport from the University of Exeter to Poltimore House.

If you donate £10 you could win 3 free tickets with return transport from the University of Exeter to Poltimore House AND one free drink with each ticket.

If you donate £20 you could win 5 free tickets, return transport from the University of Exeter to Poltimore House, one free drink with each ticket AND a special thank you gift from the festival.

In order to get your prizes, you MUST enter  donation by May 20th 2014.

Alternatively you can buy tickets for the festival at:

http://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/arts-on-the-move-festival-tickets-10473860599?aff=eorg

Thank you for making this event possible, we look forward to seeing you there!

Love and Greetings,

From the Arts on the Move #aotm team.

story:
You can create positive impact on the lives of hundreds of children in Haiti.

Art Day Celebration (ADC)  is the collaborative art program of Diakonos International, developed to uplift, empower and nurture vulnerable children in Haiti through the exploration of the creative arts. 

This three day program directly creates impact for children by allowing them to:

  • Process their emotions and feelings
  • Improve capacity to learn while building self-confidence 
  • Foster natural creativity

Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti, is filled with orphaned, abused, homeless and neglected children. An estimated 300,000 children, some as young as 3 years old, are forced to work tirelessly as "restavek" (unpaid household servants). Many of these children are savagely beaten and rarely get any schooling. 

ADC's Mission is to:  

  • Support and/or establish art education for children in rural, impoverished communities.
  • Provide children with access to quality art activities such as painting, drawing, photography, music, poetry and more, as a therapeutic, educational and developmental tool. 

2015 ADC Program:

  • July 16th,17th & 18th – Port-au-Prince, Haiti 
  • 110 children registered between 4 -16 years old
  • 10 volunteers from US, NY, CA, FL, 

Operating Costs : $ 18,505.00 (annual) 

WE NEED $7,500 for:

  • Food &Transportation for 110 children $3,500
  • Site Fee $2,000
  • Art Supplies $2,000

Diakonos International is a 501(c)(3) devoted to bringing hope to and caring for these children who are living in the shadows of extreme misery and oppression. Their vision is to create a learning society where kids can blossom into educated, fully functional, self-supporting and productive members of society. 

PLEASE DONATE & SHARE NOW

1 USD = 47.7 Haitian dollar (goude)

Your dollar matters.  A lot.

We thank you!

"For the first time, I saw desperation erased from the child's eye's and replaced with hope." - Martine Longchamp, Founder, Diakonos International
