An estimated 300,000 children, some as young as 3 years old, are forced to work tirelessly as "restavek" (unpaid household servants). Many of these children are savagely beaten and rarely get any schooling. 



ADC's Mission is to:  


Support and/or establish art education for children in rural, impoverished communities.
Provide children with access to quality art activities such as painting, drawing, photography, music, poetry and more, as a therapeutic, educational and developmental tool. 



2015 ADC Program:



July 16th,17th & 18th – Port-au-Prince, Haiti 


110 children registered between 4 -16 years old


10 volunteers from US, NY, CA, FL, 


Operating Costs : $ 18,505.00 (annual) 
WE NEED $7,500 for:



Food &Transportation for 110 children $3,500


Site Fee $2,000


Art Supplies $2,000





Diakonos International is a 501(c)(3) devoted to bringing hope to and caring for these children who are living in the shadows of extreme misery and oppression. Their vision is to create a learning society where kids can blossom into educated, fully functional, self-supporting and productive members of society. 
PLEASE DONATE & SHARE NOW
1 USD = 47.7 Haitian dollar (goude)
Your dollar matters.  A lot.
We thank you!
"For the first time, I saw desperation erased from the child's eye's and replaced with hope." - Martine Longchamp, Founder, Diakonos International

story:
Introduction to Smart Art for Kids

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit my campaign,

Hello, my name is Stefanie from Cape Town, South Africa and I've been passionate about art since I was 4 years old. It has always been my dream to bring art to kids, especially those with special needs and learning difficulties. I suffer from bipolar disorder and my struggle has given me insight into the challenges experienced by those with mental difficulties.

I've been tutoring children in various projects for the last 10 years. I studied psychology at UNISA and I've completed several courses on education for kids with special needs & child psychology. I worked with high school kids with learning difficulties and I've also worked with preschoolers with autism spectrum disorders and other difficulties. Helping these kids changed my life and I am now forever dedicated to this cause.

Our tailored art sessions will be beneficial to children suffering from the following disorders: Selective Mutism, Autism Spectrum Disorders, Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder, Separation Anxiety Disorder and other special needs and learning difficulties.

The Studio and outreach programs

Opening my own studio has always been my passion. I have used all my personal savings to obtain as much art materials and equipment as possible. For our sessions to reach as many children as possible they need to be very affordable. The studio project and outreach programs are costly and this is why we need your help. We need to purchase equipment, furniture for the studio, various art materials, admin and advertising and other costs. any small donation would be greatly appreciated.

We don't have much to offer in the way of perks. We are so sorry. We have a few artworks on canvasses but shipping would be quite expensive and they will most likely get damaged in transit. However, Cape Town backers are more than welcome to contact us if interested.

Benefits

Our art studio and creative sessions:

  • Create a safe environment for fun, play and freedom of expression
  • Explore various techniques and mediums
  • Provide themed lessons designed to educate and inspire
  • Assist in developing divergent thinking styles
  • Build fine motor skills
  • Develop problem-solving abilities
  • Improve self confidence
  • Encourage neural connections
  • Find new ways to communicate if communication is a concern
  • Introduce new weekly projects covering various mediums
  • Provide sessions tailored to each child's individual needs

Thank you so much :)

Update #1 Thank you so much to our first 2 backers!

story:
About the Mural

The design will be a permanent version of our studio’s original mural at 829 Bainbridge St, entitled “BIRD FEED.” 

The more we raise, the bigger the bird. We’re offering limited edition T-shirts and art prints of the original design in exchange for your generous support. Your neighbors will thank you, and your friends from Boston will cry :D

 

About the Artists

Meg Saligman Studio has created several Philly landmarks, but we want this to be next. Some of our work you’ve likely seen around town includes:

Broad & Spring Garden St. (Common Threads), Delaware Ave. (American Flag), I-76 mural (Passing Through), 13th & Locust (Philadelphia Muses), Knotted Grotto, during the Pope’s visit

 

What We Need & What You Get

100% of funds go toward producing kickass art in Philadelphia. This includes paint and supplies, aerial lifts, insurance, artist labor, work permits, project management...there’s actually a lot that goes into producing a mural! This will cover all the details necessary to immortalize our majestic victory in SBLII.

The more we raise, the bigger the bird. Our funding goal of $60,000 will afford a mural roughly five stories high. If we raise more than this, we will paint a bigger bird. 

In exchange for your generous support:

- We’re offering limited edition T-shirts, hoodies, flasks, & art prints of the original mural

- We'll paint the name of your loved one permanently on the wall in a THIS IS FOR YOU section. <3**If you select this perk, send us a message with the name**<3

- Donors can choose to sponsor fake names as official sponsors on the wall. Bill Belichick would LOVE to see his name up on this mural, right?!

- Extra generous donors will have their (real) names emblazoned as official sponsors on the finished mural too.

- Extra extra generous donors will earn a classically beautiful, classically fierce eagle custom painted in or on their homes.

 

Mural Location

The official mural site is to be determined. If you own a giant building and are interested in featuring this painting, let us know. The city will love you with unrivaled passion.

 

Spread the word!

Don’t forget! Every dollar counts. This is an awesome way to thank both our indomitable team and our raucous fan base for years to come. Thanks Philly! Congrats again to our champion Eagles!!! WE WON THE SUPER BOWLLLLL

story:
Hello. My name is Jonathan Vreeland, and I have in one form or another been working with wood for most of my life.

The very first time I did anything with turning wood was I had a part time job making pool cues locally for a pretty high end maker, called Cuesport, and they made Mali cues. This shop has since gone out of business some years ago. Anyway, this experience interested me a lot, and I bought a small lathe and began making small items like pens and small boxes bowls and similar things.

After a bit, I put my work in a local craft gallery, and much of it sold pretty well, and I subsequently bought a larger lathe capable of turning larger items like functional bowls and larger urns and such, as well as more artistic items as well.

I find this to be  something extremely rewarding, to take a chunk of wood that may be destined for the fireplace and make something beautiful and valuable from it. This creation of things one can touch and see fills a part of my soul that I had not known was empty.

Then I began to have more serious health issues, and one thing led to another and I had to sell my shop of tools and things I used to make my stuff. That was about 8 years or so ago. Now, I find myself in a position to once again fulfill this dream of mine to create beautiful things, functional things, all sorts of things from wood, but find myself short of funds to make this a reality. Every penny I have beyond what I pay my bills with is going to this  project.

Here is what I need to begin with: I need first of all a space to turn in as my basement has begun to flood pretty badly in the spring and is unsuitable for putting expensive machines and tools in anymore, so enclosing my porch or putting a small outbuilding in the backyard is necessary. Then I need a lathe and the tools to turn wood, basics, as the other tools can be added as time goes on separately from this project. Also, a small bandsaw, drill press and bench sander are basics as well. These can be obtained relatively inexpensively, the real expense is the lathe.

I am working on getting some pictures of what little I have left of the work I have done up on this page as well.

Thank you all for taking the time to look at this page, and considering a donation. For any donation of 50 dollars or more, I will make a weed pot, or bud vase, of wood and send it to you, shipping included. These are one of a kind items, no two are alike.

story:
On A Mission of Civiliti

Civiliti provides an extremely unique "self-sustainability" model... allowing YOU and the EcoArtist, musician, or artisan to directly support non-profits. 50% of your EcoArt purchase goes to the EcoArtist and 25% goes to the environmental or rights non-profit of YOUR CHOICE...
 

Where we are now

We are developing a Civiliti Catalog to promote EcoArt and create awareness, stimulate dialogue, and encourage long-term respect for the natural systems with which we coexist. EcoArt focuses on ecological, geographic, political, biological and cultural interrelationships within our environment and proposes paradigms sustainable with the life forms and resources of our planet.
 
Civiliti is a collective of people and organizations (Civiliti Champions) committed to respecting the environment, understanding the need for cultural preservation, and creating sustainable revenue streams for EcoArtists and for non-profit organizations that support human rights and biocultural diversity. Our vision is a global community with shared values of respect, kindness and compassion that understands our collective rights and responsibilities to each other and the environment.

 

Civiliti Seeds ... Civiliti Perks

We need to raise $86,000, all of which will be used for building out our key Civiliti Mission:

  • Development of the Knowledge Center (for EcoArt, for environmental sustainability, for human rights)
  • Build out the necessary technology to distribute through the TV, PC, Tablet and Mobile
  • Build the Audience to maximize the revenue distribution to the EcoArtist community and to the Non Profits ... that you choose!

(No Fundraising will be used for staff time)

We have a completely unique set of Civiliti EcoArt packages

Based on 10 different contribution levels (see the Perks Chart).  We are thrilled to have any level of funding to support our Mission and we thank you.

In addition to the Introductory video...

there are 2 minute "shorts" on specific topics ... from our Mission to the Self-Sustainability Model, from News and Knowledge to See Things Differently. There is also a 7 minute video: The Book On Civiliti. Visit civiliti.org to learn more.   

AND see the Civiliti Catalog Sampler and the PERKS Gallery  for your choices of EcoArt. We will personally contact you after your donation to verify your individual choice of PERKS.

    You Can Help in other ways as well...

    • We need "Civiliti Champions" to work with us as volunteers
    • Help us by sharing Civiliti through all your Social Media Networks
    • Join us:  We are always delighted to add new partners who share our passion for the planet and human rights!
    • Artists, Artisans, Musicians:  Sell your EcoArt through the Civiliti Catalog!

    Civiliti is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Civiliti must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
MAKOTO

Makoto is my new project/book for this early 2017.
What is Makoto, what does it mean? Makoto is a Japanese word meaning "Sincerity, Thruth" 誠.
誠 is the kanji also used to represent the Shinsengumi, the special and famous police during the end of the Edo period. That era was full of different emotions (bravery, anger, pride, betrayal, etc).
After reading and seeing a lot about this part of the History (Samuraï), I felt even more connected to Japan. I needed to express what I had in my mind, and I naturally have choosen to use traditional Japanese tools to create it. 
Makoto -Sincerity-  is what I express in my Art, there is no lies there because I can be free of my thoughts & feelings.
 

FOR WHO?

This book is for everybody. 
You like Japan, Samuraï, calligraphy, black & white illustrations, my Art, or simply want to learn some more Japanese words... this book is for you.
There will be 1 or 2 illustrations more explicit as the Samuraï period is about fight, but it's in black and white ;)

THE BOOK

  • A5 horizontal format, soft cover
  • 40 pages (stitched)
  • Language: French & English (+ kanji & prononciation)
  • Color: although it's made with black ink, it will be printed in color to keep the shades of the original ink stick (black & red stick from Kyoto)
  • Style: traditional Japanese ink prepared on a stone with the ink stick & water. Illustrations are in a different style than my usual work, going to the essential idea with more dynamism, free style.
     

THE PERKS

To avoid a huge list of perks and extra commission percieved, I didn't add the "shipping option". 
If you want to have the book shipped, just let me know, the costs will be requested after the campaign (check the details below).

  • Makoto: the book, simply.
  • Makoto + drawing: the book with a quick drawing inside on the 1st page
  • Makoto + t-shirt: the book + 1 exclusive t-shirt (tank top or T-shirt model). Just confirm me the size and model you wish.
  • T-shirt : 1 exclusive t-shirt (tank top or T-shirt model). Just confirm me the size and model you wish.
  • Package 1 : the book +drawing + 1 kanji (calligraphy) + postcard set
  • Package 2 : the book + 1 kanji painted for you.
  • Package 3 : the book + postcard set (5 illu)
  • Japan set 1: the book + 1 postcard send from Japan + a package from Japan* that I will collect during my next trip (shipping tbc)
  • Japan set 2 ; the book + 1 postcard send from Japan + a traditional calligraphy set from Japan (shipping tbc)
  • Super Package! JAPAN package: the "package 1" + a pack from Japan* that I will collect/purchase during my next trip only for you. The items can be a total surprise unless you want specific items. Shipping costs tbc.
  • Full Japan set: the book including a drawing inside + the postcard set + the kanji + a special big pack from Japan* (collected during my next trip, wide selection!) + a postcard sent from Japan + special traditional calligraphy set (from a special area).
  • Every euros count: donation, as you wish

* As bigger the contribution is, as bigger the pack from Japan will be. You can increase the budget of the perk you wish and leave me a not about your request.
Package will contain different things from Japan (snacks, goods, manga, music etc), if you have allergies, be vegetarian etc, I can adapt the content.

Shipping not included (5€ international, no tracking), for the big packages the weight will be calculated later.

All donations & perks purchased includes your name added in the book (thanks), if you don't want to see it appearing, inform me or just keep the Anonymus status.

All books will be signed (to you), if this is a present for another person, just send me the name ;)

THE BUDGET

The campaign will run during 1 month only, but as the budget is not really huge, we can reach it quickly ;)
The money will be used to produce: 

  •  50 to 100 books (more if needed of course)
  •  Postcard set (x 5 illustration of the book)
  •  Promotion (flyers & posters)
  • Art supply: rice paper mostly, paper
     

Creation

The illustrations & kanji are already in progress. Many pages are done, but there is still lot of work to do. 
Every illustration is/will be created with the feelings of the moment, each brush movement is linked to an emotion and thoughts that came into my mind.
For each kanji creation, there is lot of time spent for the practicing, learning and also lot of paper, ink and rice paper used hahaha.
 

 Any help is welcome

You don't have the budget to buy the book, or you are not especially a "book collector"? You can still help of course. How? Here are some ideas

  •  Any donation is welcome, from 1€ to any other amount you wish.
  •  Share this campaign on social medias, because not everyone may have seen it yet.
  • Talk to your friends about my Art, some may like it too.

 

Thank you all, I will return now to my calligraphy practice to make this project ready at the end of the campaign.

story:
Beautiful & unusual subscription art packs

I love art, and have spent many an hour browsing online to find the perfect print or flicking through rows of greetings cards trying to find something a bit different. There is so much great art and design out there to enjoy - but finding it isn't always easy, and can often mean investing significant time, effort and money. I want to make it simple, quick and great value. With Ink+Paper, I will be offering you a regular selection of amazing artwork for a great price and no hassle. I also want to fairly reward the artists involved for the effort and talent that goes into their work, as well as doing something to help my community.

If this sounds like a project you'd like to support, please read on for more detail!

Overview

Ink+Paper will work with 12 artists over 12 months, curating bi-monthly collections of diverse and exciting art and design, in the form of beautiful, high quality art postcards and prints. These will then be beautifully packaged and sent to the doorsteps of Ink+Paper's subscribers.

This crowdfunding campaign will help get the first collection into production, which will be available exclusively to backers. From November 2017, the Ink+Paper subscription service will be up-and-running, and distributing packs every 2 months.

Subscription options will be:

  • 5 A6 art postcards (including envelopes)
  • 1 art print, just smaller than A5
  • The whole collection: 5 art postcards and 1 art print

    Ink+Paper aims to:

    • make the discovery of great art and design effortless
    • promote and support amazing artists
    • connect artists and art lovers
    • create beautiful art products at great value
    • donate from each pack to support great local* causes

    As a subscriber you:

    • get high quality, beautifully presented art products (and exciting post!)
    • discover wonderful artists working in a wide range of styles
    • directly support these artists
    • help causes supporting and improving local* communities

    You win, artists win, great causes win!

    *‘Local’ means local to Ink+Paper in its home city of Bristol, UK.

    Artists

    By supporting Ink+Paper you will be supporting the work of the brilliant contributing artists.

    Ink+Paper will search high and low on your behalf to find wonderful artists and designers to work with, from successful full-time creatives to aspiring talent. Ultimately I want Ink+Paper to become known as a source of exciting and unusual art products, where you know you will always find something engaging, beautiful and fun! These subscription packs are the first step towards this vision, and these are the standards I will be holding myself to throughout the development of this product.

    With this is mind, here is the first collection and the six artists behind it!

    Natasha Newton - Moon Rise - Art Print

    About Natasha:

    Natasha Newton is a full-time artist and illustrator, who splits her time between the English counties of Suffolk and Surrey. She gains most of the ideas and inspiration for her work during regular walks along the beach, and through the heath lands, fields, and forests that surround her, as well as the landscape of the Peak District National Park.

    Her paintings are created in acrylic on canvas, and in watercolour, gouache, and ink on paper, as she enjoys the versatility of water-based media. She works from dark to light, applying the paint to the canvas in thin layers, while allowing each application to remain partially visible through the subsequent layers, giving the paintings a wonderful richness and depth of tone.

    Website

    Babs Pease - Red Squirrel with Beech Nuts - Art Postcard

    About Babs:

    Babs has been working as an artist and printmaker since graduating from Edinburgh University and lives outside a small village near Dollar, Clackmannanshire, Scotland. Much of her inspiration comes from the beautiful landscape of the Ochils and the rich variety of flora and fauna within it. Her designs are all hand carved onto linocut blocks and then printed by her, using an antique victorian relief press.

    Website

    Ella Goodwin - Let It Go - Art Postcard

    About Ella:

    Inspired by fairtyales and folklore, craft and nature, Ella's work takes you through a whimsical world of delicately detailed scenes and characters.

    As well as Illustration Ella's background is in Animation and Graphic Design, which she studied to a Masters Level concentrating on narrative for children and development. Ella's passion is for visual storytelling and whimsical illustration often highly detailed using traditional and digital mediums.

    Ella also tutors part time for IDI on their Graphic Design and Illustration BA, runs Norwich Makers Market and curates local exhibitions.

    Website

    Kat Tromans - Hyperreality - Art Postcard

    About Katherine:

    Katherine Tromans is a Freelance Illustrator and Designer based in Birmingham, UK,  who creates luminous paintings and prints. Her practice is inspired by botany, geology, fairytales and the mind. Katherine enjoys the blurring of reality with the imaginary, and her work is created with subject matter she collects from her travels.

    She enjoys the challenge of piecing together diverse environments, using pencil delicately, while her palette is luminous and vibrant; choosing colours you would not normally associate with the subjects she draws, to play upon the idea of an imagined, alternative reality.

    Website

    Carla Jennings - Winter Robin - Art Postcard

    About Carla:

    Carla loved to doodle & create intricate patterns from a young age, so when she came across Zentangle a few years ago she became addicted. 

    She spends hours searching for patterns in the hedgerows & beautiful gardens around where she lives in Cornwall, UK. These, along with her obsession for our feathered friends, are the inspiration for her illustrations.

    She loves her job, but she finds just as much pleasure in the joy & inspiration her artwork brings to other people's lives.

    Website

    Adam Fisher - Rainy Day - Art Postcard

    About Adam:

    Adam Fisher is a Welsh-born, British illustrator and artist best known for his imaginative, quirky style and engaging subjects. He has loved drawing and painting since he was able to pick up a crayon.

    Adam's unique illustration work is shaped by his love of folk art and visual storytelling. He loves carving wood, writing ghost stories, collecting folklore and picking mushrooms.

    He has worked with Crayola, Carrefour, Citibank, United Airlines and the BBC. He works quickly, never misses a deadline, and brushes his teeth twice daily without fail.

    Website

     

    Art Packs

    Here's a breakdown of the contents of an Ink+Paper art pack:

    ALL PACKS will contain:

    1. Card envelope     2. Protective card insert     3. Presentation bag(s)     

    4. Information card

    POSTCARD PACKS will also contain:

    5. Silk-finished Art Postcard     6. Envelope

    PRINT PACKS will also contain:

    7. High quality Art Print

    The Postcards will be printed on 400gsm card with a silk finish, measuring 105mm x 148mm (A6), and each will come with a Kraft paper envelope.

    The Print will be a giclée print on 290gsm Hahnemuhle art paper, measuring 140mm x 199mm (just smaller than A5).

    All Packs will be packaged securely in a card string and washer envelope, along with a rigid insert of 2mm greyboard to avoid the possibility of damage to your art. Each product will be presented in its own glassine paper bag, to ensure it remains in good condition until you wish to remove it. You will also receive an information card with details of the artists and supported cause - more details will be provided by email and on the website.

     

    Causes

    The idea for Ink+Paper itself came from a desire to work with and promote awesome creativity, but I also really care about doing what I can to support the local community and the individuals within it, and I want to build this idea into my business model. For this reason, I am committing to donating from every pack I sell to support the great work being done by the people of my city: Bristol, UK. I will be supporting a different cause with every new collection, and the very first collection is no different. This means that from every person who contributes to this fundraising campaign, part of their pledge will be donated to our first supported cause (see below) - it’s fundamental to my vision for the business, so it has to be part of this crowdfunding effort as well.

    1st supported cause: Borderlands Refugee Centre

    Borderlands Refugee Centre works with people seeking asylum in the UK and refugees from other countries, including people who have been trafficked. Through their weekly drop-in (open on Mondays and Tuesdays) they strive to combat exclusion in society by providing a safe space for their members. They offer English lessons, food and drink, games and support services, all of which can be accessed for no charge. 

    For more information, visit: www.borderlands.uk.com

     

    How I will use the money raised

    Apart from high quality production of your prints and postcards, I will use the money raised for:

    • ordering materials for the presentation and packaging of the prints and postcards
    • paying initial artists’ fees
    • donating to our supported cause
    • contributing to running costs such as the website and required software

     

    Timetable

    This crowdfunder is raising money to produce the November Ink+Paper collection. Once the crowdfunding has ended, the backers’ packs will be produced and ready to ship on 20th November.

    The Ink+Paper website will be up-and-running from 1st November, and the January 2018 Ink+Paper collection will be available to the general public for subscriptions from this date. All backers get an Ink+Paper discount code, and this can be redeemed on subscription purchases through the website from 1st November as well!

     

    ​Social Media

    Please do share this campaign with your friends, family and followers - it would be a massive help!

    Twitter: @InkPlusPaperUK   www.twitter.com/InkPlusPaperUK

    Facebook: InkPlusPaperUK   www.facebook.com/InkPlusPaperUK

    Instragram: inkpluspaperpics   www.instagram.com/inkpluspaperpics 

    Website (live from 1st November): www.inkpaperart.co.uk

story:
Wir sind ein neu gegründetes internationales Braukollektiv aus Berlin. Wir möchten ganz besondere Biere entwickeln und werden uns dabei vom Reinheitsgebot nicht stoppen lassen.

Wir wollen unsere eigene Kollektiv-Brauerei aufbauen. 

Damit wir diesen Traum schrittweise verwirklichen können, haben wir seit Anfang des Jahres begonnnen als sog. „Lohnbrauer“ unsere Biere in regionalen Brauereien zu brauen.

Unsere erstes Bier ist bereits auf dem Markt: Ein rotes Hafer Ale, unser "Red Oat Ale". Mitte Mai folgt mindestens noch ein weiterer Biertyp, der dann im Handel erhältlich sein wird.

Unsere Biere sind allesamt Delikatessen, die nur mit feinsten natürlichen Zutaten gebraut werden, aber das einschränkende Reinheitsgebot nicht allzu ernst nehmen, dafür aber mit umsomehr Kreativtät hergestellt werden. Alle unsere Biere sind sog. „Craft-Biere“. Das bedeutet, sie enstehen in kleiner Stückzahl, mit feinsten Zutaten, langen Reifezeiten, viel Chaos und Liebe in überwiegender Handarbeit.

Als Kollektiv praktizieren wir einen solidarisch-ökonomischen Ansatz. D.H wir möchten den gleichen, fairen Lohn und gleiches Mitbestimmungsrecht für alle Kollektivmitglieder. Unser Unternehmen soll denen gehören, die darin arbeiten! Wir möchten andere Kollektive und Genossenschaften unterstützen. Wir wollen die Umwelt schonen, indem wir möglichst regional und Vorort produzieren.

Craft Bier Revolution

Der deutsche Biermarkt ist derzeit im Umbruch. Einerseits sinken die Liter-Konsumzahlen pro Kopf von Bier leicht, andererseits geht aber ein sichtbarer Trend zur Klein- und Micro-Brauerei und damit zum Konsum von Qualitäts-Bieren.

In den USA hat die Entwicklung hin zur Etablierung des "Craft-Beers", die sog. „Craft-Beer-Revolution", bereits vor 20 Jahren begonnen und ein völlig neues Marktsegment geschaffen. Craft-Beer wird von der Nordamerikanischen Brewers Association als Bier definiert, dass in kleineren Stückzahlen und unabhängig von Konzernen produziert wird.

Auch in Deutschland zeichnet sich eine ähnliche Entwicklung ab, welche kleineren Labels und Brauereien die Möglichkeit bietet den großen Bier-Konzernen Marktanteile abzujagen. Insbesondere Berlin, der Standort unseres Unternehmens scheint derzeit Ausgangspunkt dieser Veränderung zu sein, der eine Vielfalt in der Bierwelt mitbringt, die sich heute gerade mal erahnen lässt.

Wir haben einen Traum. Den der eigenen Brauerei. Und den, dass irgendwann alles anders wird. Craft-Beer-Revolution also... Aber was wäre eine Revolution ohne die Anarchisten? Richtig, es wäre keine. Wir können nicht anders. Wir machen das, was wir am besten können: Revolution.  Geschmacklich, qualitativ, in Bezug auf Verfahrensweisen und Zutaten.

Helft uns unsere Brauerei aufzubauen!

Wir benötigen noch 50.000 € Startkapital um unsere eigene Brauerei aufzubauen.

Hilf uns unser Startkapital zu bekommen! Spende, teile unsere Message, lade Freunde ein, mach Werbung für uns!

Sorge für Vielfalt in Bierwelt - Es soll nicht umsonst sein.

SPENDET UND SICHERT EUCH SATTE RABATTE AUF UNSERE BIERE!

www.spentcollective.de

[ACHTUNG: Lieferung unserer Perks nur innerhalb Europas! Den Rabatt erhaltet ihr als Rückzahlung im Januar 2015, wenn ihr uns eure Quittungen/Kassenbons zusendet, aus denen eindeutig hervorgeht, dass ihr unser Bier gekauft habt.]

[TERMS OF FUNDING: YOU MAY DONATE FROM EVERYWHERE IN WORLD BUT WE CAN DELIVER OUR PERKS TO COUNTRYS IN EUROPE ONLY!]

story:
Finding art that resonates with you isn’t easy. But neither is being an artist. Rents are high, wages are low, and funding is tough to come by.

For the past five years I've been the editor of Art Threat, a blog on socially-engaged art. Artists we write about often thank us for spreading the word. But while media coverage can help build an artist's profile, it rarely brings home the bacon.

Meanwhile, readers sometimes ask where they can buy an artist's work. Too often the answer is that they can't, at least not without a trip to a gallery in New York or Toronto.

As an arts marketer who loves building both audiences and community, I saw an opportunity to help artists sell prints of their work to an audience that is hungry for meaningful art for their homes. 



We're just about ready to open shop, and you can help us achieve that next step by making a contribution and getting some sweet perks in return! The funding will help purchase the remaining equipment and supplies we will use to get prints out the door and into your mailbox. 

We are raising $5000, which will be used as follows: 

  • $2500 — Equipment: a wide-format, workhorse printer.
  • $1500 — Materials: papers and labels and inks — oh my!
  • $500 — Web Design: some dinero for the developers.
  • $500 — Postage: getting perks into your hands.



It's all about the art! Our campaign perks will fill your walls with limited-edition prints made by artists who create change through creativity. 

Contribute and you'll get a digital gift card to redeem for a print once we launch the Hugs With Arms shop. The limited-edition prints come in three sizes and are printed on acid-free art paper using archival inks. They're shipped with a signed certificate of authenticity and are guaranteed to arrive in mint condition. Worldwide shipping included!

We will launch with 20 unique prints to pick from, and will release new prints every month.

All contributors receive exclusive VIP access to the shop for 10 days so you can get first dibs on our very first limited-edition prints before we open to the public. 

Perks also include one or more $10 coupons that you can give to a friend — earning good cultural karma! — or use yourself on a future order. 

Finally, Perk Bundles give you more bang for your buck, featuring two or more prints at a reduced price. Our most exclusive bundle also includes a special trip to your favourite art gallery. 

Learn more about our perks on the right side of this page. These offers are exclusive to Indiegogo contributors, so help us achieve our vision and get some art up on your walls!



Hugs With Arms partners with artists who share one thing in common: they are inspired by, and participate in, movements to create positive change in our communities.

The artwork they create is diverse, limited only by what can be reproduced in two dimensions. You'll find painting, drawing, photography, illustration and more. The images on this page offer a small taste of the creative juices that flow from our partners.

Participating artists include Anthony Freda, Kate Puxley, Pierre Leichner, Biliana Velkova, Kevin Lo, Babak Salari, and Tatiana Philiptchenko, with more being announced in the weeks and months ahead. 


Our art prints come in three sizes: 8x10, 11x14 and 16x20 (in inches). The printed area will be slightly smaller, depending on the dimensions of the original artwork. Each print also features a half-inch inch border to help with framing.

The images above will give you a general idea what each size of print looks like if you add a mat, frame and fuzzy dalmatian.


We're pumped to offer you fantastic, affordable art, and we're just as jazzed to help artists earn a living doing what they're passionate about. While many artists struggle to pay the bills, those who produce socially-engaged artwork can face even greater barriers to funding or commercial success. 

When you buy a print through Hugs With Arms, 50% of the funds go directly to the artist.

By working with artists to sell prints of their work, we're creating an additional income stream that doesn't require shifts at McGapbucks. We take care of the business and production side of things — marketing, shipping, yelling at paper jams — and artists can focus on creating art and social change.

It's win-win-win: you get amazing, affordable prints, artists get some cheddar, and we get to deliver powerful visual messages across the planet. 




      

If contributing doesn't work for you, that's okay! There are other ways to help:

  • Sign up for email updates, and we'll give you a heads up when we open.
  • Find us on Facebook or Twitter and share the campaign with your friends. 
  • If you know artists who might want to join us, please let them know!

Q: How do I know the prints will look awesome?
A: Our artwork is printed on acid-free archival paper using Epson Stylus Pro printers with UltraChrome K3 inks. The reproduction quality is approved by the original artist, and we inspect every single print before we ship it out.

Q: Are there any extra shipping fees?
A: Nope. Worldwide shipping is included with our perks.

Q: What if my print arrives damaged? 
A: We guarantee that prints will arrive in your hands in top condition. If for any reason the print is damaged before you get it, contact us at hello@hugswitharms.com and we'll send you a replacement. 

Q: What do the artists get out of this? 
A: Artists receive 50% of the revenue from print sales, and we bust our butts to introduce them to a new community of art lovers.

Q: Is there a minimum order to redeem the bonus coupons?
 A: Nope. The coupon codes we'll send our Indiegogo contributors can be used on any purchase once we launch our shop this spring.

Q: What if I decide later that I want a larger print?
 A: That's not a problem! The gift cards included with our perks can be applied to a bigger order — you just pay the difference.

Q: Will I be able to redeem my gift card for the artwork on this page?
 A: While the images above are included as examples of our artists' work, most will be available as prints when we launch. Artists still need to approve proofs, so there's a small chance that a particular artwork won't reproduce well enough to meet our standards.

Q: If I get the Bundle 3 perk, will you actually come to a gallery with me?
A: I most certainly will, so long as the gallery is in one of these cities: Victoria, Vancouver, Edmonton, Saskatoon, Toronto, Ottawa, Montreal. We'll work together to find a date that fits both of our schedules. If your city isn't on this list, I may still be able to make it work — shoot me an email and let me know where you are. 

Q: What's with the name?
A: The short story: Hugs With Arms is about giving back. Here's the long story.

Still have questions? Email us at hello@hugswitharms.com.
story_txt:
Finding art that resonates with you isn’t easy. But neither is being an artist. Rents are high, wages are low, and funding is tough to come by.For the past five years I've been the editor of Art Threat, a blog on socially-engaged art. Artists we write about often thank us for spreading the word. But while media coverage can help build an artist's profile, it rarely brings home the bacon.Meanwhile, readers sometimes ask where they can buy an artist's work. Too often the answer is that they can't, at least not without a trip to a gallery in New York or Toronto.As an arts marketer who loves building both audiences and community, I saw an opportunity to help artists sell prints of their work to an audience that is hungry for meaningful art for their homes. We're just about ready to open shop, and you can help us achieve that next step by making a contribution and getting some sweet perks in return! The funding will help purchase the remaining equipment and supplies we will use to get prints out the door and into your mailbox. We are raising $5000, which will be used as follows: 

$2500 — Equipment: a wide-format, workhorse printer.

$1500 — Materials: papers and labels and inks — oh my!
$500 — Web Design: some dinero for the developers.
$500 — Postage: getting perks into your hands.


It's all about the art! Our campaign perks will fill your walls with limited-edition prints made by artists who create change through creativity. Contribute and you'll get a digital gift card to redeem for a print once we launch the Hugs With Arms shop. The limited-edition prints come in three sizes and are printed on acid-free art paper using archival inks. They're shipped with a signed certificate of authenticity and are guaranteed to arrive in mint condition. Worldwide shipping included!

We will launch with 20 unique prints to pick from, and will release new prints every month.All contributors receive exclusive VIP access to the shop for 10 days so you can get first dibs on our very first limited-edition prints before we open to the public. Perks also include one or more $10 coupons that you can give to a friend — earning good cultural karma! — or use yourself on a future order. Finally, Perk Bundles give you more bang for your buck, featuring two or more prints at a reduced price. Our most exclusive bundle also includes a special trip to your favourite art gallery. Learn more about our perks on the right side of this page. These offers are exclusive to Indiegogo contributors, so help us achieve our vision and get some art up on your walls!Hugs With Arms partners with artists who share one thing in common: they are inspired by, and participate in, movements to create positive change in our communities.The artwork they create is diverse, limited only by what can be reproduced in two dimensions. You'll find painting, drawing, photography, illustration and more. The images on this page offer a small taste of the creative juices that flow from our partners.Participating artists include Anthony Freda, Kate Puxley, Pierre Leichner, Biliana Velkova, Kevin Lo, Babak Salari, and Tatiana Philiptchenko, with more being announced in the weeks and months ahead. 
Our art prints come in three sizes: 8x10, 11x14 and 16x20 (in inches). The printed area will be slightly smaller, depending on the dimensions of the original artwork. Each print also features a half-inch inch border to help with framing.The images above will give you a general idea what each size of print looks like if you add a mat, frame and fuzzy dalmatian.
We're pumped to offer you fantastic, affordable art, and we're just as jazzed to help artists earn a living doing what they're passionate about. While many artists struggle to pay the bills, those who produce socially-engaged artwork can face even greater barriers to funding or commercial success. When you buy a print through Hugs With Arms, 50% of the funds go directly to the artist.By working with artists to sell prints of their work, we're creating an additional income stream that doesn't require shifts at McGapbucks. We take care of the business and production side of things — marketing, shipping, yelling at paper jams — and artists can focus on creating art and social change.It's win-win-win: you get amazing, affordable prints, artists get some cheddar, and we get to deliver powerful visual messages across the planet. 
       If contributing doesn't work for you, that's okay! There are other ways to help:
Sign up for email updates, and we'll give you a heads up when we open.
Find us on Facebook or Twitter and share the campaign with your friends. 

If you know artists who might want to join us, please let them know!

Q: How do I know the prints will look awesome?A: Our artwork is printed on acid-free archival paper using Epson Stylus Pro printers with UltraChrome K3 inks. The reproduction quality is approved by the original artist, and we inspect every single print before we ship it out.Q: Are there any extra shipping fees?A: Nope. If for any reason the print is damaged before you get it, contact us at hello@hugswitharms.com and we'll send you a replacement. Q: What do the artists get out of this? A: Artists receive 50% of the revenue from print sales, and we bust our butts to introduce them to a new community of art lovers.Q: Is there a minimum order to redeem the bonus coupons? A: Nope. The coupon codes we'll send our Indiegogo contributors can be used on any purchase once we launch our shop this spring.Q: What if I decide later that I want a larger print? A: That's not a problem! The gift cards included with our perks can be applied to a bigger order — you just pay the difference.Q: Will I be able to redeem my gift card for the artwork on this page? A: While the images above are included as examples of our artists' work, most will be available as prints when we launch. Artists still need to approve proofs, so there's a small chance that a particular artwork won't reproduce well enough to meet our standards.Q: If I get the Bundle 3 perk, will you actually come to a gallery with me?A: I most certainly will, so long as the gallery is in one of these cities: Victoria, Vancouver, Edmonton, Saskatoon, Toronto, Ottawa, Montreal. story:
Hello I'm Joe Benitez

I'm sick of being a broke ass artist . I hate working for money so I wanna get me some serious coin so I can do some kick ass stuff on my leisure . So give me money and make me rich and I promise I won't ever ask for anything else again.

story:
Hai from Thunder.

Hai. My name is Thunder Thepony. I am helping my housemates raise more money for their mutant vehicle/art car that they are currently building to take to Burning Man this year.

You see, they want to be able to cart humans (horselessly) around from theme camp to theme camp, in order to reduce the amount of FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out) experienced at Burning Man. It's all very scientific and better explained by the graph below:

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funds are needed for materials & transport. The entire project costs at least $8,000 including: 

  • Dune Buggy $1500
  • Steel & Materials $1500
  • Automotive parts $1000
  • Cutting Discs, Welding Wire & Gas, Bits, Hole Saws etc. $1000
  • Transport $3000

This does not include any personal costs or labor (all that has been gifted by the volunteers). We have raised some of the money from fundraising parties but are still short of our goal! 

Indiegogo charges 9% fees, not to mention Paypal fees, if we don't reach our goal (as opposed to 4% if we do) so we are really hoping to raise $2,000 but are being cautious as there's only a few weeks to do it!

REBAR SALE - (CONTRIBUTE BY AUGUST 19th TO RECEIVE ON-PLAYA!)

We have two Indiegogo campaigns (for $500 & $1500 respectively). The $500 one is to sell the remaining Tavern Hopper clothes! This $1500 one is for ordering fancy (yet practical) rebar which we will transport all the way to the playa for you!!!! (wow service!!)

(For those who have never been to Burning Man, you may not know that you need rebar in order for your tent to not fly fly fly away!)   

Example of rebar. Pony approved!

CLOTHES SALE

We have lots of clothes left over from our last fundraising party. Please CHECK OUT OUR CLOTHES, T-SHIRTS AND UNDIES!! :) 

 

About

The Tavern Hopper project includes many members from the 2013 Vancouver Regional CORE team (the people responsible for building the Artifactuary effigy). Check out the Facebook group for action photos and to meet the whole team.

Please spread the word. Thanks! Love, Thunder Thepony

story:
Hi, my name is Avotcja. 

I’m a 73 year oldPoet/Musician/Playwright/Photographer/Teacher with Muscular Sclerosis who, with your help, is going to the 11th International Poetry Festival in Granada, Nicaragua this February. I’ve been published in English & Spanish in the USA, Mexico & Europe. I’m a popular Bay Area Radio DeeJay on both KPOO in San Francisco & KPFA in Berkeley, California for many years & leader of “Avotcja & Modúpue." 

What I Need & What You Get

This is an expensive undertaking, with planefare, hotel, food & ambulatory devices to help me get around, I will need $2500. So I’m asking for your help. There is no amount too small or too large & many friends have offered CDs and other gifts to offer.  With your help I know we can do this. My participation will create a link between the Bay Area cultural community & Nicaragua which we hope will grow in the future. Please spread the word & I thank you in advance for your support.

The Impact

I want to represent you and our community at the International Poetry Festival in Granada, Nicaragua. There are well over a hundred Poets coming from over 40 countries to this amazing Festival & I want to be one of that number. In the last ten years this Poetry festival (which also includes Music, Dance & Theater) has brought together more than a thousand Poets from 96 countries including Nicaragua who have shared their work with more than 400 thousand people creating an intergenerational & international cultural exchange. 

Risks & Challenges

As a disabled person I know how to overcome challenges. The journey to Granada is long but I know that with the backing and support of my community I can get there to share in the cultural exchange and represent our vibrant community at this international exchange of important poets, artists, and more from around the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word! Email your friends a link to this campaign. Share it on your Facebook page. Tweet it. It only takes a second, and you will be supporting my journey.

story:
Short Summary

 THANK YOU so much to everyone who contributed to Hare Today, Gone Tomorrow!  If you requested a perk, they will be mailed out in September.  If you will be redeeming a perk while joining us at Thursday, September 3rd in Black Rock City, we can't wait to see you there!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The South Bay HardCORE group was born out of the fires of the Circle of Regional Effigies, and has continued to bring art inspired by Silicon Valley to Black Rock City.  Silicon Valley has long been heralded as the epicenter of technological innovation. We are the creators of the Internet, the keepers of the Google search, the denizens of Twitter. And because of us, no longer do questions go unanswered. Whenever someone wants to know who that guy was in that movie, or how that magic trick was really done, the answer is a few keystrokes away. That air of mystery may have vanished from the world, but the magic of Black Rock City restores it (until it is released to the fire once again).

Drop by the giant Hat art piece on the playa, and the magician’s stage is yours to amaze your friends with your best Burt Wonderstone impression! Or just say ABRACADABRA and ascend the staircase to marvel at the giant fur-covered bunny ears and look out across the playa. But first --- you have to find the secret door! 

The piece is a large (20' diameter at the base, 26' at the brim) upside-down top hat with large rabbit ears sticking out of the top (overall height of 20'). The frame of the Hat (constructed from new lumber) will be skinned with recycled fence boards, giving it the appearance of rustic, 1930's dust-bowl era traveling circus.

It's called "Hare Today, Gone Tomorrow" because we will burn the Hat on Thursday night at 10:00pm!  It's the South Bay region's BIG night, and we want you to be a part of it!

Although we have always been largely internally funded, this is the most ambitious art piece the South Bay has ever constructed. 

We are creating a special "Magician's Wardrobe" that will open up into a carnival mirror/infinity mirror portal. It will be 7ft tall, 4ft wide, 2ft deep, and weigh under 100lbs. This is our highest level perk for fundraising!   The Magician's Wardrobe is a cabinet that opens to reveal a carnival mirror, which will have a ripple effect created by a small motor moving the mylar. A short while after opening, the reflection will dissipate and the infinity effect will kick on!  Imagine this in your living room!

We will definitely need your donation this year to finish our construction.    But we've got great ways for you to get some bunny-related swag, or participate in our on-playa happy hour and burn night!

 

 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 

  • Please share this South Bay campaign far and wide!
  • You can use the Indigogo share tools with just one click to share on with all your social media contacts!
  • We would still welcome your help on Friday morning at our burn site, as our Leave No Trace crew cleans up every last bit of charcoal (and enjoys some breakfast burritos and mimosas along the way!)

story:
Thank you for your interest in SculpturesPacific Magazine.

SculpturesPacific Magazine is our passion and we hope you will share that passion with us. 

We have successfully published 9 online issues that have been well received by the sculpture community!!

Through the very much appreciated donations we have received so far we can now publish our 10th edition.

However to continue publishing this on-line magazine we need your help.  

With your help we can:

  • ·      continue publishing on a quarterly basis
  • ·      grow our subscriber base
  • ·      update the SculpturesPacific website

Please look at some of our past issues (www.sculpturespacific.com), as well as the video, to get a sense of what we have proudly accomplished over the past 3 years.

Here are some quick facts about SculpturesPacific Magazine:

·      We have advanced to a footprint covering the entire Pacific Rim, featuring artists from Western Canada, the Western United States, and the coastal regions of Asia, also known as the Ring of Fire. Occasionally we will go out of our regular foot print, for example to Europe, to bring you an interesting story.  This coverage is unique among all public art publications.

·      Our content is written in plain language with minimal ‘artspeak’ yet provides professional coverage of working sculptors in various media and styles and from various cultures.  We cover sculpture from the most contemporary and ephemeral to more traditional works.

·        Our stories include feature articles about sculptors, public art programs, and a wide range of issues close to sculptors’ hearts … from the controversy of art auctions to what private and public collectors look for.

·      We are absolutely professional in our appearance and content.  Because of this professionalism, we have had the privilege of gaining contributing writers who have professional backgrounds as art critics and curators.  These individuals would not have volunteered to contribute their articles, unless they viewed our magazine as a professional and an important contribution to the sculptural and artistic world.

·        Our subscriber database is currently 3,500+

With this track record and professionalism, we can assure donors that they are giving to something that is well established.  Our track record speaks for itself and with your much appreciated help we can only grow!!

story:
Paint Love

We connect amazing organizations in Atlanta (that are working to improve the lives of youth) with incredibly talented artists who have a heart for service.

  • In 2014, we had 10 artists serve 100+ students through 6 events
  • Our artists taught abstract art, wax encaustic art, pop art, and even metal working!
Our events were so successful we now have a wait list for more artists and projects!!

Help us Make a Greater Impact

To continue growing and serving the organizations on our wait list, we need a group of individuals who are willing to donate financially.

In order to healthily grow Paint Love in 2015, we believe we need to hire a staff member. We cannot sustain this growth without (great!) people.

This decision brings us to our very first fundraising campaign. We would like to raise $22,000 to support:

  • over 450 students 
  • in 24+ events, 
  • with 13+ artists, 
  • partnering with 6+ nonprofit organizations serving youth, and 
  • at least 1 part-time employee working to coordinate the logistics, marketing, development, design, and community engagement of Paint Love.

The Need in Atlanta

Contributing to this campaign makes an impact in the lives of local youth:

  • Based on the research of the YouthARTS Development Project, arts programs have been found to positively impact youth, including youth in Atlanta. 
  • “Not only can such programs enhance young peoples' attitudes about themselves and their futures, but the programs also can increase academic achievement and decrease delinquent behavior.” (youtharts.artsusa.org/about)
  • Our artists and staff members witness this impact during each event!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways to be involved with Paint Love aside from donating:

  • Help spread the word about this campaign and Paint Love on social media
  • Visit gopaintlove.org to sign up to volunteer, become an artist, ask about being one of Paint Love's partner organizations, or just sign up for our mailing list to stay in the loop!

It's so simple. Thanks for helping us Paint Love in the lives of youth!!

Other Ways You Can Help There are so many ways to be involved with Paint Love aside from donating:  Help spread the word about this campaign and Paint Love on social media Visit gopaintlove.org to sign up to volunteer, become an artist, ask about being one of Paint Love's partner organizations, or just sign up for our mailing list to stay in the loop!   It's so simple. Thanks for helping us Paint Love in the lives of youth!!

story:
As a modest token of thanks for your support, ATI would like to offer you the following gifts:


NEW! At the $10 donor level:

NYC Vortex Walking Tour

Join Ráchel Räder, Chief Investigator for Ancient Truth Investigators, on a tour through NYC's vortex points. 

New York is known world wide as a place that attracts people of every walk of life. We invite you to join ATI on a walking tour of the city in April 2015. Rachel will discuss the exact points that give the city its magnetic energy and how it relates to your chakras.

Special instructions to follow for those who sign on.


At $10:

4" x 4" print by Jason Blandford which includes the ATI logo on the back.

At $20:

Chose between the following designs handprinted by Jason Blandford on 8.5" x 11" card stock. You can email nicklesblandford@gmail.com with your choice.

1                                                                           2

3                                                                          4

5


At $25:

A postcard from the team in Sedona!

At $40:

Petrified Spongy Coral charm on a black elastic cord. And a postcard from the team in Sedona! 

At $60:

Petrified Spongy Coral charm on a gold- fill chain. And a postcard from the team in Sedona! 

At $100:

Chakra Stone of your choice. 

Chose between Petrified Spongy Coral, Banded Strattite or Spotted Quartz. And receive a postcard from the team in Sedona!

            

At $300:

Custom made gold-fill prong set ring with any of the above elements used in the setting. And a postcard from the team in Sedona! 

Please help the Ancient Truth Investigators reach their financial goals so that they can provide you with studies on this culturally significant area. 

ATI hopes to provide the answers to missing links in Human Evolution. You can see the full listing of ATI's discoveries that were un-earthed at the Crystal Pyramids at latitude 36, longitude 34: HERE. Imagine what ATI will discover in Sedona, Arizona! You can be a part of this exciting new series of discoveries at any of the listed levels. 

     


Who are the Ancient Truth Investigators?

ATI is a collective of researchers in search of the lost ancient truths that turn conspiracy theories into recognized history. 
For the past 10 years, ATI has utilized echo-sounder and magnetometer technologies to map the topography of the Ocean sea-bed. They have discovered a web of unnamed megalithic structures, in the ocean’s deepest depths that have barely begun to be explored.
The ATI team has mapped out a series of prime meridian points around the world that exude an exceptional amount of energy.  One of the key points of energy that ATI aims to explore is in Sedona, Arizona. 


What is Stepping Into the Vortex? 

Stepping Into Vortex is the name of ATI's fundraiser to conduct research in Sedona, Arizona in April 2015. 

The ATI residency will take place at The Melting Point. 

By contributing you are funding the following needs:

· Equipment needed for excavations

· Materials for research

· Inter-dimensional mobility of the ATI team

· Publication of Dive Log Two, (the second publication made by ATI).

Places of Interest:

· Vortex hikes in Sedona

· The Grand Canyon: to take soil samples at different layers of sediment according to time frame postulated by ATI to be connected to the Sea People's history

· Native communities: to interview Mystics that may have insight

Objectives:

· Conduct a series of tests to read energy fluctuations and points of vortex anomalies

· Interview local Mystics in Sedona

· On-site excavations of  rocks and minerals

· Learn more about the connectivity of the prime meridian points around the planet

· Gain insight into the spiritual beliefs surrounding the special nature of this geographical location

· Find connections between the ancient civilizations in this area to the history of the Sea People

· Excavation of artifacts that help ATI gain perspective on minerals of varying energies present in the soil in areas once submerged under water before the Ice Age, ie: proof of the ancient civilization of Sea People

· Connect with other dimensions

· Study the overlapping vortexes present in Arizona


The Team

ATI member, Jason Blandford, will join Rachel Rader, Chief Investigator, in Arizona to collaborate in the exploration of the Sea People's history. 

Specifically, the two ATI researchers will investigate the language of the Sea People which is based in sacred geometry patterns. Jason is an expert in this field and a professional printmaker that explores patterns. Below you can see a small collection of his past works. 

  


Other Ways You Can Help

Consider sharing this fundraiser and spreading the word about the research that the Ancient Truth Investigators seeks to conduct globally. 

This is just the beginning for ATI! Their goals include expanding the research of particular energy points around the world.

story:
Greetings Potential Contributors to PETRI(E) Inventory 65,

I want to thank you for taking the time to consider helping to fund PETRI(E).  Currently, I am in my final year of studies at the London College of Fashion, where I am studying towards a degree in fashion journalism.  However, I have had an ample amount of experience working within the magazine sector of the fashion industry.  In my professional experience, I have contributed to and held positions at renowned publications such as TANK, LOVE, GQ Style, American Vogue and British Vogue.  You can learn more about my personal work and experiences at www.zadriansmith.com  My experiences at these magazines gave me first hand insight into how the magazine industry operates, and what I found was missing was an alternate perspective to the glossy content consumers receive today.

This inspired me to create a publication that would test the very nature of the world we live in. It's pure beauty unchained. Instinct. Intelligence and wit. It's founders, audience and contributors must rethink all they know to be real in order to understand.

The publication sources inspiration from Ray Petri, who was a true visionary, a Renaissance man. He is most remembered for the impact he left as an image maker. He was a stylist before the term was coined, and his work depicted the norms and created a new culture. He surrounded himself with a team of like-minded individuals that became known as the Buffalo Collective. His work in The Face and Honey magazines in the 1980s depict imagery containing a soul and a story. “It was a reflection of what people wore; fashion as lifestyle,” said Roger Charity, a member of the Buffalo Collective. His life was brought to an abrupt end in 1987, but the impact of his work still resonates strongly through nearly every aspect of the industry. He was ahead of his time and truly revolutionary.

PETRI(E) Inventory 65 is a publication that steers away from the traditional and engages with readers in a real and relevant way visually and through text. It is a collectible, something that people will cherish and look back to from time to time, finding a different experience in it every time they look back. Each Inventory will have a unique soul. It will be united by a constant theme without being monotonous, allowing the reader to consider and explore a wide array of topics united by a common thread. “PETRI(E) Inventory 65 is a fear of the future, anxiety in the present and comfort from the past.” The publication is named for Petri because he embodies the progressive nature of the content. His acceptance of the other is exactly what PETRI(E) will celebrate. In 2013, Petri would have turned 65 so each issue, published annually, will age accordingly. The (E) remains intact, although Petri dropped it when he rose to fame as a stylist, because it represents a return to the core.

This publication is important to me because it offers a platform for creative individuals who normally may not have an outlet to showcase their work to be heard.  We want to inform, inspire and educate.  Everyone on the team is passionate about their craft and have committed to the vision and goal of PETRI(E).

For the first issue contributors have been sourced globally and include:

Edward Meadham and Benjamin Kirchoff of Meadham Kirchoff (London)

Photojournalist Saiful Huq Omi from Dhaka, Bangladesh

Photographers Lukasz Wierzbowski (Poland), Sam Rock (New York), Nicholas Bean (New York) and An Le (New York)

Dr. Valerie Steele (New York) of The Fashion Institute of Technology

Francesca Burns (London) of British Vogue

Barry Kamen (London) and Tony Felix(London) of the Buffalo Collective

Film Director and Photographer Nabil Elderkin (Los Angeles)

Desmond Zhengs (New York), Coco Ehni (London), Maria Pineda (Honduras), Yuko Sugimoto (London), Joseph Luck (London), Luis Ramirez (Florida), Liz McCarthy (Oxford), Katy Shields (London), Chloe Sexton (London), Larry Vrba (New York), Lucy Garrett (Oxford), James Wood (London), Andrew Logan (London), Colin Dawidziuk (London), Mila Nesterova (London), Valeriya Vygodnaya (London), Raeann Hayden (London), Sara Polonghini (London), Yevgeny (London), Vu (London), MJ (London) and more to be confirmed.

The content is quite varied and will include stories on politics, lifestyle, culture, art, fashion, poetry, photo and fashion editorials  and creative non-fiction.

The publication will be available in a limited edition run in select specialty book stores internationally.  From our humble beginnings, we hope to create a wave of interest and creativity that inspires others to do better than their supposed best.

The most difficult aspect of the publication is gathering all the funding to do this in a manner that is of highest quality.  There is so much effort being put into the content and it's important the content is exhibited in a professional and innovative format.

The most demanding costs are printing, to print a start run of 100 - 200 magazines it will cost approximately $4,000 

Other costs include production for photo and fashion editorials which are being shot in Savannah, Ga., Poland, Bangladesh, Malaysia, Bangkok, Japan and London.

To help cover the costs I have been paying for everything out of my own pocket.  I did not want contributors to have to pay, because they are investing time and money into their projects. However, even whilst working two part time jobs I am realising that I need help to reach the goal for print.

This is why we need you, to make this dream come true.  As this is the first edition of PETRI(E) there are not many physical perks we can offer.  However, our sincere gratitude will be extended. Every contributor will be mentioned and thanked personally in the magazine and receive a thank you letter from the team with a print of one of the images that will be published.  Also, for those contributors who are interested in receiving a copy of the magazine we will ensure that you receive a copy at a massive discount (it's hard to give a figure at the moment of how much the discount will be or actual cost of the publication will be, because we have to estimate this based on the print run, which we will have a better estimate of once we know funding numbers).  

No amount to contribute is too big or too small.  Please remember that every little bit helps.  A dollar starts with one penny.

If you are unable to contribute and even if you can, I ask that you please spread the word to your friends, family or colleagues who you think might be interested in helping.

Life is short and we only live once.  So, live it doing what you love.

To Inspire, To Inform, To Educate

PETRI(E) Inventory 65

Thank you in advance.

Zadrian Smith

Chief Curator
